Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Phenomenal Service”
Reviews.Author: RMDHB
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Omni with my husband and two young boys (age 1 and 4). We had such a pleasant experience - travelling with young children can be such a nightmare but thanks to the Omni it was actually enjoyable. From the moment we checked in we had first class service. We were upgraded to a corner King room that was huge, perfect for adding a crib and a rollaway. We had a lovely view of the bay and ample room for the boys to spread out and play. They brought us a refridgerator and the crib and rollaway within 20 minutes of our request. They also gave our boys a backpack with lots of fun stuff. We enjoyed the heated pool and jacuzzi before heading down to McCormick and Schmick's for a happy hour dinner, which was also fantastic. We came back after a fun walk in the Gaslamp District and put the boys in the huge bathtub and headed to bed. The bed was comfy and despite the noise from the trains we got a great nights sleep. One thing that we did note was that the central air system was soooo quiet. My husband loves to have the air on all night and in other hotels it wakes me up everytime it turns on, not at the Omni. All in all I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, rather than travelling with kids or for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lotster
Reviews.Content: Brilliantly located hotel slap bang at the beginning of the heart of the gaslamp area so 2 min walk to loads of restaurants and bars. Also 2 secs away from the Padres basslball stadium. A few reviews have been unfair on this hotel due to noise from the stadium but think this is a bit unfair. the hotel itself is massive and really nice. The rooms were really big, with a fabulous bed and really nice bathroom. Everyone was very helpful and friendly and it has a nice vibe to it. Defiantely stay here if you want to be in the heart of life for San Diego. We would stay back and we have just returned from a 4 day stay there.

Reviews.Title: “BOOK THE OMNI SAN DIEGO NOW!!!!”
Reviews.Author: chenchen_10
Reviews.Content: On last Thursday my mom and I visited the Omni San Diego for her 87th birthday. I cannot begin to marvel at all of the wonderful experiences we encountered. EVERY individual we came in contact receives kudos from us. While I cannot remember every name of each Omni staff member I can remember the congenial deameanors and the prompt attention to details. Justin (the concierge) and Daisy (front desk) made our stay so memorable that we want to visit again. We were treated royally!!!!The suite was great, the view was great. Don't miss the opportunity to enjoy Omni hospitality while in San Diego. You won't regret it. Thanks to the ENTIRE Omni San Diego family for EVERYTHING!!! Sincerely, Dr. G.Thomas

Reviews.AuthorLocation: City of Big Bear Lake, California
Reviews.Title: “Gaslamp Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: Desiree P
Reviews.Content: Located in South Gaslamp across from Petco park and convention center. The best room is on corner -- one side bay view and other side balcon, some rooms with view of ballpark. Next to Hard Rock and Marriot for clubbing. Parking is standard city (about $36) but across the steet is an Ace parking structure (the same building the Hotel valet parks in). Great pool and lounging area. Walking to everything in Gaslamp.

Reviews.Title: “Wife Pleaser”
Reviews.Author: Snakepudding
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel room with good view. Room was missing coffee pot and microwave oven, so I rated it less than 5. The view from our room was very nice and loved by my wife. It was one of the cleanest rooms I have experienced. We walked everwhere for our meals and outings. Front desk honored my wife's birthday request for a "nice" room; very nice front desk personnel. We were notified about hotel parking ($35) and optional covered public parking directly across the street which was about $14 and we had direct access to the car to get items as needed and also avoided possible mistreatment of the vehicle. I signed up for the Hotel's free membership and got free internet. I recommend this hotel and the public self parking located a few yards from the hotel's front door.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful anniversary stay!”
Reviews.Author: allywally21
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Omni San Diego are to be commended for their attention to their customers. Everyone from the valets, bellmen (holla at Chip!), and front desk (Mary Beth) were awesome. We stayed here for our wedding anniversary with our two kids and had a wonderful time! We were brought ice cold champagne and chocolate covered strawberries... :) The pool is heated so even in the cold weather, we were able to go swimming. The room was promptly cleaned when asked... No complaints here! We hope to be back during baseball season as the omni is connected to petco stadium!

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel”
Reviews.Author: 02242012ss
Reviews.Content: The hotel is first class. Be prepared for a $35.00 parking fee. The staff is very good, professional and knowledgable. My only complaint and it's a major one is the walls are paper thin. Remember the movie "Animal House"? Well that's what you will find when you walk around the gas lamp district in San Diego. This hotel is ground zero to the party and that party can move to any room in this hotel. If that happens next door to you well don't expect to get much sleep. On the other hand if you're a party animal well you got it made. Stay somewhere else if your looking for peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel”
Reviews.Author: jher12
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at 11 different Omni Hotels and this hotel is by far the best one. No need to have a car. You step out the doors and you are in the Lamplight District. Just on the other side of the hotel is the trolley stop. Not to mention the ball field that is connected to the hotel. The staff is great and always upgrade me. Every side of the hotel has a great view. The only down side to this hotel is the trolley and train pass by and you can hear it form your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: GoodeCT
Reviews.Content: Perfect spot for walking the bay to the Midway...or walking the Gaslamp District...or going to a Padres game!! Too many area restaurants to try...loved the Mission for breakfast. Lovely staff, clean, great view. Took a bit of time to get used to the trolley noise..loved the earplugs on the bedside tables!! Not a fan of the "open" bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: mscri
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni in San Diego for a week. It is a nice hotel, good food at the restaurant, nice rooms, good service. The only down-side was parking, which they offer at $35 a day for valet parking. We parked in the same garage, which is across the street and paid only $20 a day. I understand that parking at all hotels in the city is expensive. I enjoyed my stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bouldercolorado45
Reviews.Content: Super friendly and professional check in. Requested a room away from the noise of the train, and got a great room on the top floor with great city and Petco Park views. Very clean/modern room with a great shower. Pool area was very nice. I would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: Lauren E
Reviews.Content: we were there for our anniversary and they were so friendly and personable. They ended up bring us some champagne and chocolates to our room! whole staff was accommodating, hotel had a modern feel, and was close to the gaslamp. I would definitely recommend for couple and business personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: c w
Reviews.Content: We just arrived to the Omni after booking on Priceline, and all I can say is WOW! Absolutely personal service. I mentioned while booking that this is our 10th anniversary celebration, boy was I in for a surprise. Got upgraded to a beautiful suite with floor to ceiling windows and received prepared strawberries and wine. In addition to that, a personal handwritten card from the staff welcoming us and wishing us happy anniversary and a great stay. What more could I ask for? Thanks for the warm welcome (room 1632 on March 22nd), we sure will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location, rooms”
Reviews.Author: Gogosugar
Reviews.Content: Stayed for work convention. Rooms very nice, better than neighbor Hard Rock, much nicer than Grand Hyatt. Great service. Gym was not great, but very happy overall.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location, GREAT Amenities, So So price.”
Reviews.Author: BoogAdvisor
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is its location. Next to the ball park, convention center, and good eats. The rack rate for this hotel was $249- so you really are paying for the location and the comfortable environment. For a business traveler, it was a great place to stay. For the young party crowd, you are probably better off at the Hard Rock across the street. Pros -The hotel actually connects to the ball park, is across from the convention center, and in the Gaslamp. -Parking garage located right next door. -Big comfortable rooms with separate Shower and tub. -McCormick and Schmick located on the first floor. It has a decent happy hour. Cons -Parking is $35 a night. -$9.95 per day for Wifi -It is 2012- Time for a flatscreen TV. Tips -You can park next door in the structure- We paid about $18 for overnight. -Try to get a view on the higher level. We only had a side view of the ball park which wasn't much.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular harbor view at the edge of the Gaslamp District.”
Reviews.Author: carol22b
Reviews.Content: The breathtaking view was (pleasurably) distracting and entrancing. Walk to the Convention Center in about 2 minutes & walk across a bridge to Petco Park. The Gaslamp District with all it's restaurants & bars is handy but Friday night seems when the 20-something locals hit it in droves. Good service throughout the hotel, pricey valet parking. Negatives? Odd frosted glass sliding door into bath may bother some friends sharing a room as it is less private than a solid door. Asian-style bathroom shelving makes it a bit awkward to find a handy spot to use the coffee maker. In order to get the view, you'll be on the side of the building which also overlooks the trolley, so there'll be some sounds. If you need quiet, tell the check-in desk and ask for the side away from Harbor Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, on the wrong side of the tracks”
Reviews.Author: bmarkhasin
Reviews.Content: The Omni experience is usually pretty good, and this hotel lives up to the standard of the chain. The hotel is modern, stylish and has a solid feeling of quality all around. The rooms are standard size, well appointed and have great bathrooms with fabulous showers (no tubs in our standard room type). We were staying with our child, so we opted for the two beds/room option. Unfortunately, the Omni uses doubles rather than queens, so the sleeping arrangements were tight for my wife and I. The comment in the title of this review refers to the horrific location of the Omni immediately next to the railroad tracks. Each train (and there are MANY on a daily basis) sounds its horn repeately as it approaches each intersection (and there are MANY intersections), so be prepared to hear a series of loud horn blasts roughly every 30 minutes in the evening and night hours - apparently sounding the horn is not obligatory during the daytime. The hotel actually provides two free pairs of earplugs in the nightstand drawer, anticipating that you will need them! The concierge said the city is working on making the Gaslamp District a quiet zone for rail traffic, but who knows when that will be enacted (if ever). To be fair, not only the Omni suffers from this noise issue - about 80% of the hotels in the area of the convention center are adjacent to the tracks. So be prepared for a bad nights sleep unless you can ignore a freight train passing within 20 yards of the hotel! The restaurant of the hotel was quite good for both breakfast and dinner, and in our opinions reasonably priced for the quality. The staff was attentive, courteous and helpful. Overall the Omni experience met our expectations, with the only detraction being the proximity to the tracks. I dont think a better option exists in the area, so enjoy the hotel, and utilize your complimentary earplugs!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: dgerson76
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a jr suite for a business trip recently. The hotel is perfectly located next to the trolly stop and right across from the San Diego Convention Center. The staff really stood out here, everyone I spoke to was incredibly nice and helpful. The pool bar is a great place to hang out and have a quick drink. You can also walk to any restaurant downtown, I recommend Oceanair for some great seafood.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Downtown San Diego Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Don322
Reviews.Content: I get to San Diego several times a year on business, and although I have tried the Manchester Grand, the Courtyard by Marriott(6th & Bdwy),and the Westin(Horton Plaza), I seem to always be more satisfied with the Omni. It's just an easier experience. Expedited checkin, usually get a room on a high floor with a great bay view, the room is clean and functional without too much froo froo,, and good enough acess and egress to the freeway. I especially like the fact that I can park myself overnight at the municipal lot just across the street from the entrance and pay $10, vs $33 at the Courtyard, about $25 at the Manchester, or $40 according to the sign in front of the Solimar.It is at the Southeast corner of the Gaslamp district, so you can walk a block or two in the action without having to put up with the noise or congestion of being right in the middle of it.

Reviews.Title: “Now Our Favorite Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: LauraBtraveling
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in San Diego many times at various hotels and this was our best experience thus far. We were greeted in a friendly manner at the front desk, checked in and out quickly, and all the staff was genuinely friendly, including housekeeping. We stayed over on a Sunday night so that may have made a difference, but it was quiet, and we slept well in the very comfy beds. The location can't be beat, close to everything downtown. Our room overlooked the convention center and had a beautiful view of the bay. I also loved the very plush towels in the bathroom, a rarity in hotels these days. The other reviewer's suggestion about the parking is a good one, as $35 is a little high for valet parking and there is parking available across the street. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Billy H
Reviews.Content: After reviewing every review I could find on google & tripadvisor about hotels in San Diego area,, I decided to try the Omni and I must say it's one of the best hotels I've have ever stayed at! Everything about this hotel is 1st class, the rooftop pool is a nice touch and the room and the staff are really nice.

Reviews.Title: “WOW very clean hotel, great location, would stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: pinkblonde00
Reviews.Content: Fantastic bargain, although I would recommend skipping the $35.00 "mandatory" valet charge by parking in the private garage right across the street, at about half the price. This is where the valets take your car anyway (we had a view of this garage from our room, so I saw them firsthand). Anyway, the hotel was spectacular, LOVED the pool with the rooftop view!

Reviews.Title: “Prime Downtown San Diego Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EaganTraveler
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Omni San Diego late and were warmly greeted by the front desk staff. She quickly explained the layout of the hotel, benefits we would receive as members of the Omni rewards program, and directed us to our room on the 16th floor. Rooms are large with nice furnishings and a very large bathroom featuring a tub/shower as well as a separate glass shower. Room was very clean and everything worked. Our view was of the stadium, pool on the 6th floor and railroad tracks. While not much outside noise, the door to the adjoining room allowed significant noise as I could hear every word said. Not sure if it is the gap at the bottom of the door or just the quality of the adjoining door. Ear plugs are in the night stand but did not find them until the next morning. Complimentary beverage was delivered on time and left outside our door with a simple knock. Hotel is steps away from the gas light area with many dining options including the Broken Yolk which serves a great breakfast. Weekend evenings are very busy with large crowds roaming the street at closing time. We used the Ace parking ramp which is very convenient but more expensive on over night weekends. Great if the hotel would add an airport shuttle to their list of many offerings. Based on a great rate, comfortable beds, excellent service and location, I would definitely select the Omni if downtown lodging is needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BMW1200RT
Reviews.Content: Very convenient to convention center,gas lamp district,shopping,great restaurants.....gave it 4 stars because I hated the louvered doors and 'windows' in bathroom. Zero personal privacy. Bad designer! This was our second stay...will stay here again. Self park in parking garage across street saves money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway!!!”
Reviews.Author: Steven C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great weekend getaway from the kids in San Diego. All was excellent for our first stay at the SD Omni - room, service, views, location in gas lamp district, style, parking garage across street, pool deck casualness, and fast wifi. Don't forget to join the free customer loyalty program.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Service”
Reviews.Author: mtnfireguy
Reviews.Content: I have to echo what several other have written regarding the service by the staff at this hotel. It is awesome. Every encounter I had with a staff member was pleasant. During our stay an issue arose that was no fault of the hotel's, however they went out of their way to assist any way that they could. I have to admit, I went to the front desk expecting to tell my problem to the young lady at the desk and then end up asking for a manager and then getting the typical "Sir, theres nothing we can do to assist as this isnt a hotel issue" Well.... that didnt happen. the young lady at the desk took care of it to the best of her ability and far beyond what I expected. I regret that I didnt get her name. The hotel.... comfortable, clean and nice sized rooms The location is great as we were attending a conference at the convention center and was a simple walk across the street. And of course the proximity to the Gaslamp! I would return to the hotel based of the service alone I h

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel for conference/business travel”
Reviews.Author: Melissa D
Reviews.Content: Service provided by staff of this hotel is the best I have experienced in the US to-date. Every staff member I encountered was pleasant, friendly, and helpful. The level of service provided by Omni is hard to find in the US hotel market today. Little touches, like the wake up calls provided by actual people rather than automated voice, rectifying the issue I had with my laundry not coming back in the state I would have expected them, and the staff going above and beyond was very much appreciated. The view was lovely, location was convenient to the convention center, and to a variety of local bars and restaurants was very much appreciated. I would recommend this hotel to anyone in San Diego traveling on business or attending a convention.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views and good location for seeing the city.”
Reviews.Author: Travel4pleasure07
Reviews.Content: This is a very well kept hotel. Right across from the convention center and the beginning of the Gaslamp District. Our room was clean and the bed was so comfortable. We were lucky to have a small balcony overlooking the pool and the waterfront. The staff was very attentive from the front desk letting us check in early to the valet getting us a taxi, or the concierge offering us information on the area and discounted tickets to the zoo. Their fitness center was amazing and the massage I got there was one of the best I have ever had. There was a Starbucks in the lobby that closed around 7 or 8 p.m. so if you needed water, soda or a little something to eat you had to access the mini-bar ($7.00 for a bottle of water or $4 for a can of soda) or order room service. I thought this was a little outrageous, but I suppose that is what I should expect at an upscale downtown hotel. The strange thing was that showering around 7 a.m. meant getting lukewarm water, when any other times of the day it was perfectly hot. Also the bathroom had shutter style doors that did not lock and two small shutters that opened into the room, leaving little in the way of privacy. My husband also commented on the TV not being a flat screen, that didn’t concern me too much but most places do have large flat screens nowadays. All this considered I would recommend this hotel to others but because of the price would probably not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience - Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Malcolmsmom
Reviews.Content: Wow! Truly one of the best hotels we've ever stayed at. Very convenient to Gaslamp District of San Diego but what makes this hotel stand out is the staff! We were celebrating our anniversary and mentioned it when checking in so they gave us a room with a nice view. When we returned from dinner there were lovely desserts and a bottle of champagne chilling. How special - we've never been treated so well! We booked through Priceline and are used to sometimes getting second class room or service because we didn't pay full price but this was definitely not the case here. Rooms are clean, modern and well-appointed. Some other reviewers had remarked on noise which we didn't notice at all but there is a train track nearby as well as the Hard Rock - I did hear some music around midnight but not to the point of waking us up. Everything was top notch! Thank you, Omni for a memorable anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: gretchstars
Reviews.Content: Another nice hotel in SD. Good service at the desk, but not much in the way of room service or amenities. There is no place to just go down and buy a bottle of water, which I would like. Valet is $, but normal for downtown SD.. and its so nice that you can walk over the bridge to Petco Park. I would totally stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel of our trip”
Reviews.Author: das_ubersoldat
Reviews.Content: we got a corner room with balcony for our honeymoon. also we received we had some strawberries with chocolate and a bottle of champagne prepared in our room -> awesome. the room was really spacious and had a very nice bathroom. we had some issues with the wifi but only on the ipad. apparently the antennas in the ipad are not very good as our laptop got the signal without problems. public transportation (San Diego Trolley) is nearby. if you want to avoid the high parking fees you can use the parking lot across the street. i believe it was 17 usd/24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly nice for a convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: JSSSeattle
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, not too large, and the double queen comfortable and very spacious. It was really convenient to the convention center and to the gaslamp district. One con: it's near to the Hard Rock Hotel, and the bar outside can get LOUD. Some of my colleagues were nearer to that end of the hotel, and it was noisy. That said, Omni provides earplugs in the nightstands, nice touch. Pros: the staff was just lovely, all the time and it's very clean.

Reviews.Title: “loved the omni”
Reviews.Author: fiona229
Reviews.Content: had transferred her from the Manchester Grand hyatt as had two back to back meetings. very nice hotel. room not as big as the hyatt but much nicer and well appointed. felt more modern and more high end. Staff absolutely lovely. there was no problem getting a late check out on the sunday I left. Very well sited for the convention centre and the gaslamp district. There is a lot of baseball memorabilia around the place. a bit lost on me but probably great if you are a fan. also has a bridge to petco park. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Except for Plumbing”
Reviews.Author: MarianneNY
Reviews.Content: We were able to get a bargain rate at the Omni in San Diego via Priceline. At first, we couldn't believe our good fortune. The hotel is beautiful and appears brand new. The rooms were much larger than typical. The location cannot be beat and is right near the convention center. The issue: the plumbing is so so loud. Everytime our neighbor went to the bathroom or took a shower we could hear the plumbing. This was true for our upstairs neighbor as well as those on our floor. Our own toilet was so loud after use we knew we were probably waking up our fellow floor mates as well.

Reviews.Title: “have returned numerous times but getting a sour taste.....”
Reviews.Author: acavenezia
Reviews.Content: ill keep this short and sweet, have stayed here at least 3 times...love this hotel, love the location, the restaurant, the bar, the room service, the bright , light , airy feeling of the hotel, and mostly the gym!! quite fab!! however, just returned from a 1 night stay on the 18th floor with a shower drain that would not drain..... very devastating and unforgiving especially for a woman with long hair.... shower was simply.. a night mare... the shower filled with water and turned a what would be "Simple" shower , into an over flowing bathroom... i had to manually drain the shower myself... my advice... dont stay on the 18th floor... on another note , we ordered coffee for 2 the next morning and were delivered 1 coffee mug and 1 packet of sugar... again , we clearly ordered coffee for (2) , two , deuce , hello 2!!!!!!!!!!! love this hotel but it is really starting to show its .... you know what..... its def time to re-group , give some training, lets improve Omni, such a great hotel but im seriously fed up ... maybe time for a change.?? ....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, But....”
Reviews.Author: ScarlettMX5
Reviews.Content: If you're using public transportation, this location can't be beat. The city trolley runs right behind the hotel and is easy to get to. It is also about a block from the Gaslamp area, where there are many restaurants to choose from. The service at the Omni was good, too. Our room was on the 15th floor, facing the water. We did not hear the trains that others had mentioned. We liked our little balcony, and the view of the bridge/water was nice. The room was clean and the bed and pillows were comfortable. However, the walls were a bit thin. Our first night (and morning) we were entertained by the lovers next door; the second night we were subjected to a party seemingly comprised of chatty, loud 20-year-olds. In a building this new, it is surprising that the soundproofing is not better. Since we stayed over a weekend, I would assume this is not as much of an issue during the week. If you stay here, I recommend you do so alone. The bathroom has louvers on the door and in between the bathroom and the main room. While this may be helpful in dissipating steam, it also means that you can hear EVERYTHING the bathroom occupant is doing. There was also a jackhammer-type noise every time anyone used the shower. You could hear the noise coming from other rooms as well. The hallway was strangely loud, too. If I needed a place to stay on business during the week, I would most likely return to the Omni. If I was going to be in SD over the weekend, however, I would try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Paul98110
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a solid, nice, clean place - especially for a business trip. It's convenient to everything and just as close to the San Diego convention center as the Marriott and Hard Rock. Try and get a room with a balcony - they're not huge, but the fresh air is nice. On the negative side, the hotel needs to upgrade their TVs desperately. My room had a 24-27 inch tube. The whole area is noisy. There's a train crossing a block away and the gates are up and down ALL THE TIME. Lastly, I would not valet park at the hotel. The parking lot, where the cars get parked if you valet it, is right across the street. You'll see when you get there. It's $17 to park it and $35 to valet it. Save the $18 and walk 30 feet.

Reviews.Title: “Short stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Traveler25717
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last year when we were in town for a wedding. The staff was very friendly and professional. The hotel was clean and trendy. I liked the pool and hot tub area to relax at. It was also a very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and modern close to the city centre”
Reviews.Author: PetrKasa
Reviews.Content: Nice, moderd and good quality hotel in the city centre, close to the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: 408Jac
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Omni San Diego with our two children. On arrival we were upgraded to a larger space, which was a fantastic start! Everything about the hotel was wonderful, but the most impressive thing was the staff. Every person we met was extremely helpful, and nothing was ever too much trouble. Mark the concierge was fantastic, giving us good local knowledge and some very handy tips. He made a real difference to our holiday. This hotel exceeded our expectations and we would return there in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Super location and very good service”
Reviews.Author: K_K_travellers
Reviews.Content: We had not pre-booked this hotel and picked it by pure luck. We got a room on the 22nd floor with a fantastic view of the water front. Stayed for 3 days and the car remained in the parking. Walked everywhere or went by public transport. Huge number of places to eat within walking distance. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Stay”
Reviews.Author: SoLaras
Reviews.Content: After reading a few negative reviews I was worried I made a mistake by booking on priceline but luckly that wasn't the case. Omni is located downtown, walking to distance to everything downtown San Diego has to offer, bar, clubs, restaurants, malls, banks, movies and much more. The service was outstanding. I got checked in by a woman names Heather that was very professional and welcoming, made me feel right at home. The rooms are very nice as well. Very clean, comfortable beds and lots of extras. wiFi is only free if you sign up for their online service ( which is free ) but I think adding that extra hassle is unnecessary. Parking is definitely a problem. The hotel nickle and dime the guest there. Be advise it costs $35 overnight at the hotel parking lot, $13 a night across the street parking lot. They should have free parking for a guest that pays $200plus to stay there. All and all I really enjoyed Omni and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Definate Return Trip”
Reviews.Author: UtahFamilytraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni in December with our two girls and had a wonderful time in San Diego. The accomodations were very nice, location to the gaslamp district, Petco Park convention center and monorail (or whatever they call it there) was perfect. My only complaint would be that the beds in our room were definately not queen size. That could be a big problem when kids are older/bigger. Upon check in our children were greeted with a kids activity bag with all sorts of fun stuff for them to do. They even delivered chocolate chip cookies and milk to our room that evening. There was a Baltimore Ravens game the following day so the lobby/lounge/restaurant was packed with players and fans, kind of cool to be in the middle of the action. We ate breakfast at the hotel both mornings and had wonderful meals. We had a view of the bay and were able to watch the Christmas boat light parade from our window. Sea World was only 10 minutes away so that was very convienient. Our best meal by far was at The Fish Market. It was too far to walk with kids so we cabbed it both ways but it would be a very nice adult walk. And the gaslamp district would be awesome with a group of adults. The entire area has so many bars and restaurants to chose from that it would be a fun destination without children :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with great views”
Reviews.Author: kfitzy7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice and I had wonderful views of the bay and coronado. Breakfast buffet in the morning was very nice, great selection of fruits and berries. The only complaint I had was the train runs right outside the hotel which I really don't mind usually but the train sounded it's horn before 6am waking me up out of a sound sleep all the way on the 18th floor. Also no flat screen TV and really poor wifi reception on my iPad.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: webb
Reviews.Content: The best location for conference or holiday. Excellent service. Beautiful rooms. Always my first choice for business or holiday.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay”
Reviews.Author: Kath54
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the Gaslamp district and is next to Petco Park. Walking distance to restaurants and bars and across the street from the bay. Fabulous views of the city. Very friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are clean, beds comfortable and amenities good. The valet parking fee isn't unusually high as most of the hotels downtown charge an arm and a leg. The Ace Parking structure across the street is a better value if you're not planning to use your car much (public transportation is a great option in SD). This was our second stay at this hotel (January, 2012). The first was over 4th of July weekend in 2011 and, with downtown activities-- fireworks at night, local symphony playing within walking distance (on bay)-- it just couldn't have been any better. Same outstanding service! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Clean - but V.Loud at lower floors”
Reviews.Author: Roger H
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend here and our first impressions were good, until the Huge Train rolled through about 100ft away from the Hotel sounding it's horn and generally making the entire hotel shake. Not much they can do about that obviously, but that wasn't the only noise complaint. Our Balcony room on the 5th floor was overlooking the Hardrock Hotel entrance, which appeared to be a gathering area for the smokers, plus the Music and general Noise from that corner of the street meant it was impossible to leave the balcony door open and enjoy the fresh air. Staff / Service was good, room was a little small, yet very clean and well looked after. We were a little disappointed that a newer 4 Star hotel such as this still had a small screen CRT TV and not a larger Flat Screen. Nice location, close to the Gas Lamp Quarter / 6th Ave area. All in All I'd probably give this place 3½ stars if Half Stars were possible, but moving to 3 stars for our particular lower level (5th floor) room due to the noise. Definitely ask for a higher floor and don't bother with the Balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Really want it to be 5 stars, but not quite!”
Reviews.Author: Moops
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my time at the Omni, and wouldn’t hesitate to return, but feel a full 5-star rating wouldn’t be quite fair. We stayed for 2 nights in December (over the new year) as part of a week-long California vacation. After much research I settled on the Omni and it met my expectations in almost all areas, though fell a wee bit short in a couple. Pros: • Great location at the bottom end of the Gaslamp • Good value (premier double queen) -- The 1st night was only $159 as part of their Say No To Snow promotion (free valet; complimentary margaritas; Macy’s coupon – which, technically I could have got on my own; bottle of sunscreen was also advertised, which I never got, though didn’t ask for); the 2nd night I paid their $219 internet rate • First rate service – check-in staff and concierge were very friendly and helpful; when making my reservations I requested a fridge for the room and it was already set up and plugged in when we arrived; also, I knew about the SNTS promotion, but couldn’t get the rate online since the promotion didn’t apply to new year’s eve which overlapped our stay – I called the hotel’s front desk directly and the manager was extremely helpful in ensuring the promotional rate applied to my first night • Two views from our corner room #2033 -- Direct view into Petco stadium and (slightly less nice!) the city/train-yard/part of Coronado bridge; having paid extra for a premier room it would have been nicer to have a water view (which I requested when making my reservations) -- a view of the stadium is cool, but in December when baseball is in the off-season, it's really not much of a bonus • Decently-sized room that fit: 2 queen beds; a TV armoire (with 5 drawers and, yes, no flat screen but the quality was good and lots of channels); office desk and chair; reading chair • Bathroom: Very spacious with a good-sized tub/shower; 2 robes; lots of shelf space and towels (including 2 bathmats, nice touch – who doesn’t hate standing on a soaking wet bathmat?!); good toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, moisturizer, vanity kit, sewing kit—soap but no shower gel); hair dryer • Other room amenities: Full-length mirror and mirror over the desk (nice touch for natural sunlight when putting on make-up since the bathroom doesn’t have a window); single-pod coffee maker; turndown service; large closet with ample hangers; laptop-sized safe; 2 luggage racks (which I loved, often you only get one) • Nice little touches – cookies at the concierge desk, iced water in the lobby, bottled water in the car through the valet service • Omni guest membership – free wifi (decent connection); up to two free beverages per guest per day (including freshly squeezed orange juice) – this was definitely a great perk! • Nice gym – The view of the parking garage is nothing to write home about, but the gym itself was very sunny and quite spacious with about 4 elliptical machines, 4-5 running machines, a recumbent bike, weights; nice little touches included free headsets to use with the running machines; a TV; free iced water and fruit; lots of towels • Outdoor pool – Since it was December we didn’t use it, but I could see how it would be a great place to spend time in the summer; there was also a hot-tub and several rooms with patios that opened directly onto the pool deck • Parking: Since valet was included only the first night we did the self-park the second night which was quite reasonable; the covered garage is a 5-second walk across the street and I ended up paying $17 which was likely an inflated price given it was new year’s eve ($12 overnight parking, then an hourly rate starting the next morning – we were checked out by around 10am) Cons: • Noise: I requested a quiet room, and for all I know #2033 may have been one of the quieter rooms as it was on a high floor; however, on the first night it was quite noisy from what must have been one of the neighbouring hotels or bars – sounded like there was an outdoor club with an MC egging the crowd on and cheering – this didn’t go on all night, but was annoying and somewhat unexpected; also, there indeed are train tracks below, and occasionally I would hear the odd train go by – being on a high floor it wasn’t unbearable and I was expecting some train noise, but want to highlight this for the light sleepers out there • While the room overall was great, just a couple of small little touches would have made it better: (1) Lighting – nice and sunny during the day since we had a corner room, but at night there is no overhead lighting so you are relying basically on table lamps and the room is actually quite dark which made reading difficult, (2) a ceiling fan and more hooks in the bathroom would have been great as there weren’t a lot of options for hanging towels, robes, etc. Would I stay here again? Absolutely! For the level of accommodation and service I feel the Omni offers good value. I don’t feel it quite warrants 5 stars given some of the noise challenges and minor annoyances to the room that could be easily addressed. But if you are looking for good service, location and relative value in downtown San Diego I think the Omni is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: euroUSA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few times since they opened a few years ago. Awesome location - right in Gaslamp. Great hotel overall. It isn't cheap, and what adds another $20 a night is the parking. Kind of annoying. But worth the money if you can shell it out, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel at a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 4hunters
Reviews.Content: We stayed there one night prior to our Mexican Riviera cruise. We had a suite on the 17th floor with a great view of the bay. Service was excellent as was our stay. I'm a frequent guest of the Omni chain and they always treat us well no matter the location. The somewhat trendy Gas Lamp district is within walking distance. There are numerous dinning options and plenty of bars to choose from. There is also a walkway which directly connects to Petco Park where the Padres play. There is a parking garage just across the street from the hotel if you're like me and rarely use the valet. I can't remember for sure, but I think parking was $10-15 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, even during black-out”
Reviews.Author: gezgin25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for about a week during Sep, 2011. The location is wonderful, views are really nice (Coronado bridge, the bay and the pool) and the rooms are spacious and modern. The pool area is great, too. The only downside perhaps is the the railroad but with the glowing ocean right in front of you, it doesn't really catch your eye. In addition to the niceties of the hotel, I actually wanted to point out the professionalism of the hotel management during the black-out that affected the entire South CA area and some parts of Mexico (my good fortune!). The electricity was gone everywhere from 4-5 pm till 2-3 am or so the next day. I was really impressed by how the hotel management handled the situation. They provided free snacks and sandwiches (even cheesecakes and ice cream), bottled water and soda to every guest. One of the elevators always kept running and a nice queue was set up for using it. We were staying up high (really high) so unfortunately our water slowly drained out. But, the toilets in the lower floors were running fine. I wish there were some lighting in the rooms for these type of emergencies but it wasn't a big deal. Another great thing was that we had a window that we could actually open up (you don't come across those a lot, especially in high rise buildings). This was really important as I heard that in other hotels where this isn't the case, it really got bad when the AC's went down. It is also nice being able to smell the fresh ocean. All in all, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect location”
Reviews.Author: AlexSteiger
Reviews.Content: With one caveat, this a great hotel. The location is prime, the service outstanding, and the accommodations very nice. The location is close to everything in downtown S. D. You can walk anywhere and if you're driving there is valet parking or the really handy parking lot right across the street from the hotel. You're right at the gate of Gaslamp Quarter, the historic district of downtown. You're also mere minutes from some great neighborhoods, like the mostly forgotten Little Italy (the largest in the country) and Balboa Park. Everyone from the valets to the front desk are very hospitable and friendly. There is a very handy McCormick and Schmicks inside the hotel, just off the lobby. They do a fine happy hour there with some good microbrews on tap. The views from most of the rooms (I've stayed here several times) are scenic, unless you're facing the rail yards. There is a light rail system outside the hotel that takes you to points beyond downtown, so that you don't have to deal with parking or traffic. And that brings me to my one caveat: the rail system. If you get a room too low to the ground facing the ocean, you may have troubles sleeping because of not only the light rail but the freight trains (the great offender) that come through the area regularly. If at all possible, snatch yourself one of the rooms on the higher floor and enjoy a little more quiet and a better view of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Huge and a little impersonal, but comfortable and brilliantly situated”
Reviews.Author: MichaelG77
Reviews.Content: The Omni San Diego is a *big* hotel with many floors, towering over the rail lines on the southern edge of San Diego's Gaslamp Quarter and even dwarfing the adjacent Petco Park baseball stadium (the upper levels of which are connected by private skybridge from an upper-floor lobby of the hotel). In fact the whole precinct seemed to be a mecca for baseball fans, Petco Park being the San Diego Padres' home ground. The proximity of the rail lines makes it very easy to get to the hotel by public transportation. I arrived on the Pacific Surfliner from LA at San Diego Union Station (the one with the famous 'Santa Fe' sign), jumped on the Orange Line trolley - a short train of light-rail vehicles running on railway tracks - and no more than ten or fifteen minutes later arrived at the Gaslamp Quarter stop which is virtually on the hotel's doorstep. Oddly, there is no train to the airport, but it was easy to get a cab there from the hotel's front entrance. The Gaslamp Quarter itself (the old downtown of New Town San Diego) has been reinvented in recent years as a glossy old-worlde restaurant/bar precinct seemingly popular with tourists and locals alike. If you become tired of eating out and crave fresh food, fruit and vegetables etc., there's the Ralphs grocery store a few blocks' walk to the north-west between Market and G Streets which the helpful front desk staff at the Omni directed me to. The immediate neighbourhood seems very neat, clean, orderly and safe (with the usual sensible precautions of course). It may be a tad glossy for travellers who are looking for a grittier urban experience, but heck, that's the Gaslamp! My room was on one of the upper levels and faced south. The view from the compact private balcony was pretty stupendous: the hotel pool directly below, then the rail ines (which I never tired of watching being something of a trainspotter - both the trolleys and 'heavy' freight trains run through here). Then, past the Hilton hotel and dockyard areas, the magnificent San Diego Bay and the Coronado Bridge. The changes in the view as the sun rises and sets are really something to see. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom well-appointed and the decor conservative and tasteful. I didn't notice any significant noise from within the hotel. Although other reviewers have commented on noise from the trains, it just blended into the general ambience for me and I slept well. The Omni struck me as pretty good value (incidentally, I got complimentary morning coffees through joining the loyalty program when booking online). It's certainly not 'budget' accommodation, and is more a business class-type place, but I'd stay there again. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Staff makes the difference”
Reviews.Author: EUtravelgal
Reviews.Content: Stayed in December for a convention. Location is ideal, for all the reasons reviewers have stated. Hotel is typical of a chain hotel but with a little added style. Staff, however, really stand out. They are clearly better trained to take care of the customer. Concierge was of the level I'd expect from a Ritz or Four Seasons--friendly (despite the hotel being full to the gills) and very ready to help with anything. Two restaurant suggestions spot on. I have not had this level of service from a Marriott/Hyatt/Hilton. Equally good were the bell staff and doormen. Absolute professionals. Rooms very well laid out and easy to live in. Bathroom more than adequate storage despite not being that large. Shelving helped keep everything organized. Lighting was poor. Both in the room as well as in the bathroom I was disappointed. Very difficult to put makeup on with the lighting in the bathroom (only overhead and too dim). Breakfast was provided as part of the package--buffet style. Very average, fruit was quite fresh. Omelets were very good. I would definitely stay at this property again, without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & Service”
Reviews.Author: messersa
Reviews.Content: I held a meeting at this property and the meeting space is great with easy access with great views via escalator. The meeting room hallways were decorated with baseball memorabilia which was really fun for the my attendees. Even if you don't have a meeting, you should wander up the escalators! The pool area was an awesome place to stay and check my e-mails while waiting for my room to be ready. The service was great, the location to the Gaslamp and the view - everything you need. The only down side was my attendees noted the restaurant in the lobby was very slow and no customer service. I don't think they are run by the same management as the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: zzjosephzz
Reviews.Content: Perfect location and service. Great location = very convenient for seeing the sights both within the city (Balboa Park, San Diego Zoo, Gaslamp Quater) and outside the city (Coronado Island, La Jolla) Great view, wonderful service and a very comfortable hotel. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ZygerImports
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Omni. We mentioned that it was our anniversary on check-in and were surprised by chocolate covered strawberries and sparkling water when we came in later in the evening. Great location, great view, wonderful service and a very comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: bos2sea
Reviews.Content: The location of the Omni Hotel is very convenient for seeing the sights both within the city (Balboa Park, San Diego Zoo, Gaslamp Quater) and outside the city (Coronado Island, La Jolla). This convenience comes with a price however, as the hotel sits right next to the light rail, freight and Amtrak tracks. Train horns/bells are pretty loud and the hotel's windows are not as noise-proof as they should be in this location. Although the light rail trains do not run all night, freight trains do come through in the middle of the night blowing their horns. Prepare to be awakened. Walls between rooms also need more sound-proofing as we could hear conversations in abutting rooms. Housekeeping is average: rooms are generally clean, but bed linens are not always laid on the bed properly (my bottom sheet ended about one foot before the mattress did, meaning my feet laid on the underlying mattress pad). Not exactly hygienic. Upper floors have nice views over the city or San Diego Bay, Coronado Island, and the Pacific (we were on the 16th floor with these views). The shower head in the bathtub was like a high-pressure power wash with no adjustment possible. You may lose some skin. The hotel restaurant serves a good but pricey breakfast. Park across the street in the public garage to avoid higher valet parking prices.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: aaronmelissa1108
Reviews.Content: Nice, affordable place to stay (we got a deal for $99 per night!) in a great location The only negative is the bathroom door in the rooms; doesn't fully close

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: GinaGosh
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel! I have stayed here several times and it has always been clean with pleasant service. Lovely pool (heated!) and hot tub. The location is great, near the convention center, the gaslamp district, and is connected to Petco Park!! It's my first choice when visiting the wonderful city of San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Staff was great, Hotel was Average.”
Reviews.Author: Sampsonite21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week in December. The hotel is located right near a tram stop, so that was convenient if you choose to not rent a car. If you are just staying downtown, there was really no need to rent one b/c everything is within walking distance. All of the staff were very friendly, helpful, and went above and beyond to make you feel welcome. When we first got to our room on the 14th floor, I was kind of shocked to still see the old box style television. Not a big deal, but as a couple who travels a lot we haven't seen these in quite a while. Also, there was no ipod docking station/alarm clock which I have also come to expect. The first night, I was woken up at least 3 times by the tram sounding it's horn about 10 times at the tram stop located right near the hotel.It does this every time it stops! Even 14 floors up, it was loud! A staff member said they were in the process of passing a noise ordinance and told me that the location of my room (front of the building) was actually the best spot as far as blocking the noise. So we didn't even bother switching rooms! The rest of the nights we slept with the fan on, so that definitely helped and I was only woken up one other time from the tram horn. The room overall was clean and basic. Enough room for the bed, small table, and the piece of furniture that held the tv and mini bar. Mini bar prices were insane. You are better off not even taking the key! The bathroom was nice, and roomy but if you are traveling with someone don't expect any privacy. The bathroom door is a sliding door with tinted glass. There is a large gap around when it shuts. You can see right in through the gap from the desk area in the room. Shower pressure wasn't great, but certainly not the worst I've deal with. We tried McCormick & Schmicks one morning for breakfast, which was a little pricey ( I think about $14 for an average egg/toast/meat/hasbrown breakfast, and about $3 for a cup of coffee) but the breakfast was good, and it was a large portion. A better option is only a few blocks away at The Broken Yolk Cafe, where prices were a little bit more reasonable (about $9 for the same breakfast). The happy hour prices at McCormick and Schmicks were great, and it was nice to sit in the lobby and have a drink and some appetizers. When we got the bill at the end of our stay there were about $14/day more in charges than the quoted price online due to other fees, even though we were under the impression that the price we were quoted included all the taxes and fees. So make sure you get the total price quote up front. Overall, it was a nice place to stay but I think if we go back to San Diego we will probably choose another hotel that is a bit more updated.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION - GREAT QUALITY!”
Reviews.Author: betti14
Reviews.Content: We came to San Diego on the day before Thanksgiving and left the day after - 2 nights at the Omni. The reviews really helped me choose this hotel. Location was perfect. Gas Lamp right at our feet. I couldn't believe how cheap parking options were. We had street parking the first night for free, and the second night $8 at the garage across the street. The hotel I believe is $32 but luckily we were able to get the other options easily. The hotel from the moment we got there til when we left was really great. The staff was excellent - they gave us a room overlooking the city, and which also looked into Petco Park. Being a baseball fan I really appreciated it! This hotel is attached to the park which is great during games, but didn't help us when we wanted to do a tour, we still had to go outside and around to the entrance of the park to enter. The room was nice - bathroom very modern - and beds comfortable. The gym was fully equipped, and the pool area was nice, though too cold to hang there the days we were there. No real view at the pool. Complimentary coffee in the lobby before 6am, then you have to pay at the coffee shop. We were so busy while there that we didn't get to spend a lot of time at the hotel, but I would have liked to use the pool and gym as they seemed great. For breakfast we got a quick bite at The Broken Yoke on 6th Ave. Spent the day at the Zoo and Safari Park, the next day at Petco Park doing a Tour, drive through Coronado Island, Quick ride to Tijuana (20 min ride), and then went to the USS Midway before heading to the airport early evening. Yes we did a lot, but there were no lines and no traffic to any of these places due to the holiday, so it we were able to do a lot. My only complaint was the front desk charged me for the large bottle of bottled water in the mini-bar - $9, which we never touched. I went downstairs and asked about it, and they immediately took off the charge. I just thought it was not a great thing to do to a guest when to assume they use the mini-bar without even checking. We got such a good rate for the hotel ($97 on hotels.com) that I didn't have a lot of complaints. It was an excellent value for what we got. The valet and concierge was super helpful, and I really felt like I was in the heart of everything. I would absolutely recommend. The Hard Rock next door looked very intriguing as well, and might try that place if I go back, but overall I think the Omni is the best value we could have gotten. We also looked at the Hilton Bayfront but I'm glad we chose Omni, it was closer to where we wanted to be (we had already done so much walking), and with the weather we wouldn't have been able to enjoy their signature waterfront pool anyway. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT STAFF, EXCELLENT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: busybee2544
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a Chargers/Ravens game and it was the perfect location. The cab ride from the airport was 15 minutes and only cost $13. Check-in was really fast. McCormick & Schmicks is connected to the hotel and the food is great. I had a king size room overlooking the pool with a balcony door (not much of a balcony). I was able to see the ocean. Nice size room and bathroom. Took the trolley to the stadium. 40 minute ride and $5 for an allday trolley ticket. All of the staff that I came across was great. Overall had a great stay at the hotel!! Looking forward to the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: curlycrafter
Reviews.Content: Came to San Diego on a 5 day business trip. We were treated fabulous! The service is very good. The Concierge was a real asset. Other reviews stated noisy train, but we were located away from the tracks and never heard a thing. Pros: comfy beds and pillows, central location, great service, very clean rooms, halls & elevators. Cons: tv was older, spa temp not very hot, limited towel racks in bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff... Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DOSatSP
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Staff was attentive, courteous and ready to serve - Location - Overall quality of hotel - Fast elevators Cons: - Train goes by in the middle of the night. If you're a light sleeper, Reconsider. - Plumbing is very noisy. Whenever other rooms turned on their water, you'll know. This kept my wife up all night. - Small rooms. I expected this being in a downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! The best hotel we've every stayed in!!”
Reviews.Author: Judith W
Reviews.Content: We were turned away from San Diego Hilton Bayfront and relocated to Omni because upon check in at the Hilton were told that they had run out of rooms although I had confirmation a month ago booking online. Very frustrating. However, funny how things turn out. We ended up checking in at the Omni as Hilton paid for our first night stay and we chose to stay the rest of our two nights here as the service from valet, to front desk, manager, housekeeping and the hotel restaurant manager Fernando were all top notch. They really go the extra mile to show they care and want you to have an enjoyable and relaxing vacation. My husband was travelling to San Diego for work and my two girls and I were welcomed each morning by all the restaurant staff and Fernando the manager went the extra mile to find coupons for the zoo/Sea World for us. The hotel restaurant food is absolutely delicious. We decided to eat there each morning and very reasonably priced. We also had dinner two nights as the food was so fresh and tasty. They also have an extensive kids menu for a really reasonable price. Second night housekeeping sent up for the kids milk and cookies. Each day I took the car out valet had two bottles of water in the car for us. The doormen were super friendly and always willing to help with directions. I can't say enough about this hotel and am so glad we ended up here. We definitely will be staying here whenever we come to San Diego whether for business or a family vacation. Thanks Omni! Keep up the awesome job!! The Vancouver family :)

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: pfranke
Reviews.Content: The Omni was fabulous. We were celebrating our 33rd anniversary. Everything from check in to check out was top notch. Check in was fast. Our room was fantastic. We had a corner balcony overlooking Petco park and the bay. Just beautiful. The entire staff made you feel welcome and special. Concierge printed out our boarding passes and had them waiting for us. Valet had waters for us when we picked up our car. Everyone was very helpful and nice. Really made our anniversary and the start of the Holidays very special. Thank you to Omni for making our stay one not to forget. P.F. Carmichael, California

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Kaihonu74
Reviews.Content: I liked the simplicity of the room and its layout. The decor was modern and updated. On the smaller size scale of rooms of this hotel category type. The lobby was small and a little disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “What a City!”
Reviews.Author: JFHSurrey
Reviews.Content: We were on our way to meet a cruise ship and decided to stay overnight in the Omni Hotel, San Diego. The hotel was lovely with rooms that were so comfortable with everything to hand. After such a long flight we were tired so didn't really explore more of the area but the staff were so helpful they made us realise that another visit would be on the cards. Our evening meal was very good and breakfast was yummy! We had stayed in an Omni Hotel in San Francisco a few years ago and was not disappointed with this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ptamom1967
Reviews.Content: I agree with what many of the other posters have said. Great location, comfy beds, and close to many hot spots in the Gas Lamp district. The only disappointment came from my 9yr old who was sad that the pool was only 3 1/2 feet deep and didn't quite meet his standards. I would definitely stay here again especially if attending a Padre's game. Tip: Try eating breakfast/dinner at the Broken Yolk which is only a 10 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: Angelo67
Reviews.Content: The last time we were here was in 2005, and now about 6 years later, this hotel is still very well kept and the room is very clean. As Select Guess member, you are entitled to free wi-fi (otherwise $9.95) and up to 2 morning beverages per person Great location as a base for your vacation, renting bikes, or shopping. Will definitely be back again if the price is still right

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Highly Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: RetroStewardess
Reviews.Content: Once again, I got a great rate at the Mni. Although it was a bit more than I had paid for past stays, the service at the Omni is worth it to me. The location can't be beat; adjacent to Petco Park on a quiet street with a parking garage just across the way. I had signed up for the Omni's Preferred Guest program, and received complimentary juice delivered to my room in the morning and was able to check in online. The staff was fresh-faced and friendly. Great view of Downtowwn San Diego from my room. Don't change a thing, Omni! You've got a customer for life!

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel - unimpressive view”
Reviews.Author: Constantine17
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business for 4 nights. The room was exceptionally clean, and cleaned daily by staff who appeared to care about what I thought. The concierge did a great job helping me pick a restaurant in the Gas Lamp district for a last minute dinner of a group of nine. Location was perfect as I was less than 30 yards from the entrance to the Gas Lamp on 5th Ave. and literally right next door to Petco Park. The only downsides was the view out the window my room overlooked the rail yards for the local transit authority. The attached retaurant was McCormick and Scmidt, which is ok, but really just an upscale chain. Overall, I would recommend a stay, at least the reduced price I was able to get. However, anything about $225 per night is really overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Solid service and location”
Reviews.Author: brownielinzi
Reviews.Content: The Omni San Diego is an excellent hotel, with super-friendly staff, including housekeeping. The things I liked, that other hotels in this class don't always offer include: umbrellas you can borrow on rainy days, and free internet wifi in your room (just sign up for their loyalty program). I also really liked the robes, and the floor-to-ceiling windows of the guest rooms. We had a beautiful view of the harbor, from the 19th floor! Some things I wasn't thrilled about, but aren't dealbreakers: even though we signed up for the loyalty program, I didn't hear anything about the free drink service in the morning- maybe it was because I signed up online prior to checking in? Also, we had a minor issue with a little bit of the bathtub water draining up the sink drain. Front desk staff were very concerned about this when I mentioned it and said they'd send someone to take a look, but it happened again the next day. Again, not a huge big deal. The beds were comfy, housekeeping staff was thorough, and overall a very pleasant place to stay. Also, the location across the street from the convention center, adjacent to the trolley line, and at the end of the gaslamp district can't be beat! I am hoping to return to the Omni next time I visit San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel we have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: navyfam
Reviews.Content: this hotel has to be the best that we have ever stayed, the rooms and views were amazing, the service from start to finish made us feel like royalty, they go the extra steps to make sure you are comfortable and in need of nothing, location is fantastic over looking the bay and city, if your a padres fan, the hotel has a sky-walk bridge from the hotel directly into petco park stadium, i will stay at this hotel every time we visit san diego, overall a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “If you can get a good price for it, this is your best bet”
Reviews.Author: Mogcyh
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect being a straight shot from the airport, not far from the Coronado bridge, a block away from the Gaslamp district and across from the Hard Rock Hotel. Service was great with one of the porters basically walking us out in order to direct us toward the Gaslamp district, which is literally around the corner. There's a huge parking garage across the way as well. The room itself was impeccable. As someone else mentioned, we had a room with wood slats in the bathroom (though we had fun with ours scaring each other). The almost not there balcony was still great for watching the sun rise and if only weather had been more cooperative, we could have enjoyed the heated pool and jacuzzi. The only way to improve would be if the bar attached to the McCormick Steakhouse stayed open later at night (closed by 11pm on Friday night). We did not pay full price, instead lucking out with a last minute deal and def will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Retro - NOT dated & a great location!”
Reviews.Author: csam48
Reviews.Content: FIRST and FOREMOST! Let me tell you I did not stay here. I visited a friend when I was in town and we spent a great deal of time in and around the hotel. The hotel lobby doe nothing for this hotel. Yes it is nice and the front desk was very helpful, but I mean it when I say “don’t judge a book …...”. What I noticed upon arrival and spending a great deal of time out front was the Valet service was extremely busy, maybe understaffed, and trying to ensure everything was taken care of. The problem was when they got a break in the incoming traffic, the ones and twos that came in received little to know attention. Several times I watched as elderly couples and families, unload their own cars, grab the luggage cart and fill it themselves, while several employees stood to the side (and yes they was an employee from the valet service, somewhere from inside and what appeared to be a bell hop – although I am not sure if they have them, perhaps it was another valet employee. This bothered me as at one point I felt compelled to assist an elderly woman getting out of a car as the employees stood around and conversed loudly. Given the benefit of doubt, maybe they were on break, but breaks should be done where customers are, otherwise it is not a break. My reasoning behind mentioning this is it happened several times. Moving on – Inside the hotel the facilities where nice, except I about fell out of my chair when I saw the Internet prices. I guess this is becoming the norm. But in their defense, they did allow you to pprint your boarding passes free, which my guess this day in age with the 3G/4G craze, it is all the hotel can do to make money from the Internet. Now for the rooms – Superb! Many times you find yourself in a large room with dated furniture or a small room with the latest and greatest fixtures, but the $600.00 lamp is in the corner with the 35 foot fake plant or in a place where a lamp would not matter. But these rooms were extremely well thought out in design and functionality. Many thanks to whom ever had the intuition to make a hotel room an experience, not a 70s basement room. Oh and the view, well look at the pictures I cannot do it justice. Lastly is the location. Just off the beaten path, this hotel is well placed and nestled off the strip. I recommend this hotel, regardless of the staff issues (everyone has their days, I know I have). Do let me add, this was my only issue with the staff as the remaining time I was there, they satisfied our every need. Thank you. I want to reiterate, I did not stay here but over the course of time, I was able to make a sound judgment on my thoughts of this hotel. In hindsight the amount of time I spent there, I should have just stayed the extra 3 hours and got a room.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels of its type”
Reviews.Author: ADSOxford
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times over the last few years and I will keep returning because this really is a fine hotel. The hotel is restful, with pleasing pastel colours, fine wooden furnishings - and it is modern but not in any way brash, unlike some nearby hotels in downtown. An important characteristic for a hotel right next to the Conventrion Centre is that it is QUIET! The rooms in particular are havens of peace and are extremely comfortable and well appointed, many with spectacular views. Another attraction is the fine seafood restaurant McCormick & Schmick's where the food is great, not only for dinner but for breakfast. Overall the service is excellent and I find reception and concierge especially helpful. Not only is this a great place to stay, it is superbly located very close to the Gaslight district. Quite simply, the best place to stay in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Nice with one exception”
Reviews.Author: HoneyComnyc
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, modern hotel. The only problem was slats in the wall between the bathroom and bedroom, not conducive to privacy. The room was very clean and bed comfortable and we had great housekeeping service. Next to Petco Park and you can watch the games from your room if you are high enough. The hotel did not have a breakfast restaurant, but I found "The Broken Yolk" three blocks away that did.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: JonTx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here several nights before going to San Francisco to the Omni. This place is very clean and modern. No complaints at all. We stayed in a regular room which was nice and then moved to a suite. It was even better. This is a well managed facility and it is walking distance to everything. You can even go to the baseball stadium via a sky bridge from inside the hotel. You have to go here!

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: ting w
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to gaslamp district. Noise level may be high during the weekend nights because there is a night club across the street, but overall great experience. Clean and nice comfy beds.

Reviews.Title: “Sunshine, cool breezes and an amazing location...”
Reviews.Author: UndercoverReviewer
Reviews.Content: The Omni San Diego is located in the vibrant, exciting and historic Gaslamp district in San Diego. Within walking distances are scores of restaurants and shops to suit every taste and making it easy for a dine around or group off property dinner. The hotel is across the street from the San Diego Convention Center and next to a trolley station for those wanting to expand their San Diego experience. What’s also nice is the hotel is only four miles from the international San Diego airport (which equates to about an approximate 14 minute ride and $15 cab fare). The hotel has easy valet access and drop off at the front of the hotel. This is especially nice as not all of the hotels in the Gaslamp area have this nice feature. The lobby is large, but not intimidating, with high ceilings and a nice sitting area. Adjacent to this area is a McCormick and Schmick’s Restaurant (they also handle the in room dining). There are four large elevators to take guests to the 21 floors and an escalator to the large ballroom on the 4th level. The hotel also features a nice fitness center and a small pool area. On a practical side if you are staying at the Omni San Diego, it has 511 sleeping rooms averaging 360 square feet. My recommendation for the best view is to request the top floors as looking west you have a view of the bay and ocean (and Coronado Bridge) and looking east and north is a view of the city. Views from the lower floors are less impressive and you'll hear more of the noise from the trolley station, Petco baseball park or from the partying Gaslamp crowds. The staff is terrific, the place is clean but does need the upgrades mentioned in earlier reviews. I would recommend the Omni San Diego especially to those on business and especially after the upgrades.

Reviews.Title: “Conference Hotel worth booking”
Reviews.Author: mad00145
Reviews.Content: I've stayed twice at this hotel and the experience was reliably excellent both times. Everything is good to excellent. The bed is very comfortable and the linens are very pleasant to the touch. The rooms are stylish but not really chic. The hotel gym has windows facing the convention center so you have a nice view while you sweat and its big enough to do mat work, aerobics, treadmill or elliptical. The pool is outdoors and looks lovely although we didn't take a dip. The restaurant feels like a hotel restaurant but the food is good, prices high. Room service was prompt and professional and efficient. We definitely will stay here again. Super convenient to the convention center without being attached to it. Easy walk to touristy part of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Grokker
Reviews.Content: From the friendly greeting you get when you arrive to the bottle of water they give you to take with you when you leave service is the word at this hotel. The rooms are nicely decorated and well appointed. We had a harbor view which was nice. My only complaint is the louvers between the bathroom and the bedroom? Why? Some things are best left for privacy. Other than that... The location is great at the foot of the Gaslamp District with many, many, bars and restaurants. A fun place to explore. We have stayed here twice and would definitely do so again.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a good value....at all.”
Reviews.Author: dizzydiz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the weekend, and booked high level suite. NOT impressed. Very outdated and abused furniture. And an old box tv set?? didnt they stop making those 10-15 years ago? Pretty sloppy when spending $400+ night. They do nickle dime for other things, and room service is not cheap and not very good either. The pros are great views from the room and service at hotel is very good. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: NorCalDiver_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for 2 nights. From our first encounter with the front desk to our last with the valet at checkout the service was fantastic. I booked 2 nights through two different rewards programs. At check in Luis linked the bookings so we would not have to change rooms. He also found us a corner room with both a city and water view with a balcony. I would definitely book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel--bathrooms suck.”
Reviews.Author: JohnSF8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a funeral (wedding) recently. Great location. Outstanding service. Beautiful view of the bay and Coronado. The pool bar is a great place to hang out and look out over the area. Only downside is the bathroom, if you are travelling with someone. There is no privacy. The door is slatted wood, and and there are slatted wood windows between the bathroom and sleeping area. Anyone in the room will know exactly what you are doing in there. Unless you are in a long term, just don't try anymore relationship (Hey, honey! Come look at this one--I think it's a record!), it is pretty awkward sharing a room.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty pleased would go back...”
Reviews.Author: Rhodestraveled
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and nicely decorated. Concierge was friendly and helpful. Location can't be beat. Room service breakfast was nice but a couple mins late ( I am a stickler for time ). :). Would definitely go back thank u San Diego and Omni you were so kind!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lovemyicecream
Reviews.Content: This was a really great hotel, very friendly staff, very clean, and it was also in the ideal location for exploring San Diego. If you get a deal on this hotel, you can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, very welcoming, AWESOME VIEW OF SAN DIEGO”
Reviews.Author: NPilot98
Reviews.Content: We used to live in San Diego, but we were just visiting for a bowl game, and decided to stay downtown so we could walk back to our hotel from our old favorite watering holes. Great location. Right off the trolley. And the view from our room was amazing, of the bay, looking northward, including Point Loma, Coronado, etc. We could go to the game at Qualcomm via the trolley, super easy!
