The room was decorated nicely and the bathroom was spotless (only little peeve, and I say this all the time for hotel bathrooms: not enough towel hooks/racks!). The staff were friendly and responsive and I didn't have a problem with noise as other reviewers did. The location of this hotel is fantastic if you are attending a conference, since it's only a 5-minute walk to the convention center, and a few steps to the Gaslamp District. The only suggestions I would make: update the TVs (old style, smaller TVs), and get softer bath towels. I was surprised that a hotel of this caliber had towels like sandpaper. The bathrobes were nice, though, and not scratchy! Be sure to join the Omni Frequent Guest program, as this will give you free Internet access and free beverages delivered to your room in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: joyluv
Reviews.Content: I love to travel. My stay at the Omni San Diego Hotel is in the top 5 of my hotel stays. The Hotel honored my request for a corner room. The view and balcony was great! I had many choices of hotels in the area and I am glad I chose the Omni. I would definetly stay here again if I am in San Diego. My only compaints are the old televisions and the train noise at night (which I believe the latter is beyond the hotels control).

Reviews.Title: “Staff pleasant, accomodations satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: jeffofescondido
Reviews.Content: We checked in after using Hot wire to get a reduced rate. We parked overnight in the city owned parking on the corner of 4th and Tony Gywnn Way. There or no in and out privileges, but at $14 its very reasonable. So if you plan to just hang out downtown this beats the hotel overnight rate of $32 plus the customary tipping. The hotel is clean and the front desk staff well mannered and pleasant. Loaned us umbrellas for walking to Morton's Steak house, within walking distance. The room, is alright the bedding is the standard fair, however after being in heavenly bedding its a real step down. The TV was old school and there was all sorts of unnecessary electronics for games? DVD Player, keyboard, too much. Keep it simple stupid. The TV was fuzzy until and dropped my suitcase on the floor next to the TV and walla the picture screen went clear. Restroom was good size, but the towels were very standard. We were on the 20th floor which provided a good view of downtown and Petco Park. The kicker was night time noise, I have stayed here twice and forgot that the Hard Rock Hotel has a club which creates noise. Also the hallways seemed noisy. We were in 2016 which was right by the elevator, so that is the luck of the draw. Wi-Fi was $9.95, which seemed reasonable to me and pretty standard. I use my IPAD to stay in contact. Overall the value against the price was good, not great. limited dining choices in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff - noisy in the rooms”
Reviews.Author: AVisitor80126
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four days on a holiday package - it was an excellent deal - included valet parking. The staff is awesome - maybe the best I have ever come across. Very friendly and knowledgable of the area, and some great ideas. Location is great right next to Gaslamp and Petco (in season). Went out of their way to assist a few times, when I know other places would have not been accomodating. But - the rooms are not well sound insulated. The Hard Rock across the street is LOUD, and even the provided ear plugs did not help. Could see light all around front door, so noise in the hallway was right in the room. The sliding door on the bathrooms is pretty dumb idea. I would stay here again in a heartbeat, but would ask to be on the other side of the hotel. Be sure to sign up for Preferred and get free internet and beverages in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Try the Romance Package!!!”
Reviews.Author: Zin Fan
Reviews.Content: I don't know of a better hotel experience (and value) in the Gaslamp District. Stayed for one night with Omni's Double Bubble Romance Package. For about $45 more than the AAA room rate (select a Premier room), they lavish you with champagne, rose petals, $50 breakfast voucher and two mimosas, plus they put you in the best rooms! Service was perfect beginning with a call from the concierge the week before our trip to arrange dining reservations, to check-in, to room service to valet. A short block to 5th Ave and all of the fun restaurants, bars and music. Having read some of the reviews, I was concerned about train noise, but we were on the 18th floor overlooking the tracks, the bay and the Coronado Bridge, and we never heard the trains once. Fantastic overnight trip. Will be back again and again...

Reviews.Title: “Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: megcalve
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Omni's before, but this hotel really blew the rest out of the water. Our room had a fantastic view! It was very modern and zen like in the room and the bathroom. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel for couples or friends for a girls weekend. The concierge was very helpful in helping with dinner reservations and nightlife suggestions. We booked this hotel through hotwire, so it was a steal of a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: skamikirn
Reviews.Content: 1st time staying at this hotel and was very impressed. It's right next to Petco Park and across the street from the Convention Center in the Gaslamp District. It's within walking distance to everything - restaurants, bars, clubs, movie theater, bookstore, Horton Plaza, etc, so you don't even need to worry about driving anywhere and look for parking..just leave it at the hotel. No self-parking, only valet, so you can't get away with paying the $26 or $35 a day parking fee. Staff was friendly at check-in. If you're a member, you get a bottle of water the 1st night, complimentary morning beverage, and free Wi-fi service which was great. If you're not a member, you'll have to pay $9.95 for internet access. Room was a little on the small side, but that was ok. As someone also mentioned, the sliding door to the bathroom does not cover the doorway. Got a great deal on this room - $99/night through Travelzoo. Would definitely stay here again for that rate.

Reviews.Title: “just ok for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: ferguson5
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni as a three day stop over on trip around the world. To be fair had had an amazing trip to this point but San Diego was a real disappointment. The rooms were a bit small (even though we had adjoining living room) and they were on a corner of a floor next to the maids cupboard, which was occasionally noisy. The complimentary morning drinks were appreciated. But as far as San Diego goes, the sea 'haze' clouded the skies and it was pretty cold for this time of year - only hit 21 degrees whilst we were there. Hired a car and went to check out the beaches, hair raising car trip over the bridge, but sadly the beaches (compared to Australian beaches) were poor (dark muddy sand). Did spend a morning at the zoo which entertained the kids but it was a lot smaller than i was expecting. The homeless wandering near the hotel with their shopping carts was a bit odd but we were never approached by them.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!!!”
Reviews.Author: mdenton
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and accomadating! It was very clean and in the middle of all the nightlife and for those who enjoy a Padre game, there is a walkway straight from the hotel to Petco park! I will be staying there everytime I travel to San Diego! The only down side was that the bathroom door was a sliding door with a crack so there was a bit of a privacy issue if you are embarrased to have the person you are with notice or hear what is happening in the bathroom. But other than that it was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: megs93
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon and everything was perfect. The location is great, and the staff was so friendly and helpful! We got a free room upgrade to a corner room with a beautiful view of the water and Petco Park. We couldn't have asked for a better place to stay--so many happy memories!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice pool”
Reviews.Author: touristnyc
Reviews.Content: The room are kind of small with crt tv, didn't know they still exist. The decor are very outdated, bathroom are okay but could be better. Location are okay but kind of noisy right next to the stadium and railroad track.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: pinkins
Reviews.Content: You feel like a welcome guest from the moment you step into the lobby. Everyone greets you by name and are constantly on the lookout on how to be of assistance. I can't say enough about how kind everyone is. The rooms are immaculate and comfortable. This is a top notch hotel located in an area where there is always something to do. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel itself was really nice, Can't say the same about the room.”
Reviews.Author: msaligumba
Reviews.Content: Walking in the hotel I thought it was pretty nice.. No one was in line and one of the front desk ppl saw me but did not acknowledge my presence..She looked at me and just looked back down, good thing another employee came and said "May I help you?". Although he did not offer me the omni select guest even when I did ask him about the wifi.. I stayed at the hotel for 4 days and did not know I could sign up for select guest till 2 days after. I felt like These front desk ppl were being a little snotty cause I am young. Booooo! Anyway, The room was OKAY nothing AMAZING.. probably a 3 star room in a 4 star hotel. lol. Our garbage was not emptied.. I hired a make up artist to do my make up for my cousins wedding and when she saw the bathroom she was like "OMG, they need to empty out your garbage!" I felt embarrassed when she said that. The bathtub also needed some cleaning but when we came in we were all so tired we didn't even bother. The pool was verrrry nice though! we went down there a few times and had a couple of drinks. Quite relaxing. The area of the hotel is great we could just walk anywhere. I don't know if i'll stay here again.. but i won't completely x it out of my list when going to san diego.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was as terrific as San Diego”
Reviews.Author: joybo_10
Reviews.Content: The staff met every need that I had. On my last night, the snack/coffee bar was closed and the front desk clerk went to housekeeping to score some awesome chocolate chip cookiies for me. I requested a room with a flat screen tv and also a room on a higher floor. Both requests were granted although my room wasn't quite ready when I arrived at 3:15 p.m. They sent us in to McCormick & Schmick's for cocktails on the house until the room was finished. Definitely use the self park across the street. Since we were out most of the day, we were generally only paying the overnight rate. It was much easier than waiting on a valet and then having to tip in additio n to the $35 daily valet parking rate. I think the most I ever paid in a day was $15. Got a great rate on this stay through TravelZoo. $119 a night. Stayed for 4 nights and enjoyed the area, played golf nearby and had some great meals too.

Reviews.Title: “Quality stay, quality service in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Teagle
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Omni. We enjoyed top 5 star service and rooms the whole time. The doormen out front were very knowleable about how to get to somewhere around town for the least amount of hassle or cost. The pool area was lovely and we enjoyed dinner and breakfast in the on-site restaurant McCormick & Schmick. Both and Omni Front Desk staff and the Restaurant staff went out of their way to make our kids feel welcome with small gifts to help keep them entertained. 5 Star stay, but you also pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience; perfect location for Convention Center.”
Reviews.Author: ks225
Reviews.Content: If you are attending an event at the Convention Center and don't mind the rates then this is a perfect option. You are a few steps from the main entrance. The other hotels that are at either end of the building are actually a significant walk to the entrance. Rooms are big, elegant and well-maintained. Service is outstanding. Regarding the train noise: I am a good sleeper so it didn't bother me. I suspect that any hotel in this area will have the same issue. Also, I enjoyed watching the trains go by.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: jd3374
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night and had incredible service, a great room on the top floor and view to Gaslamp and the bay, and a bottle of champagne. concierge and valet gave us directions everywhere and the location was great to walk a lot of places. My only concern was that it was kind of noisy sleep, especially with that Hard Rock club right down below.

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom doors are strange!”
Reviews.Author: runninggirl5
Reviews.Content: The Omni is a beautiful hotel located in a fantastic area of San Diego. We loved the location. The strange thing about the hotel is the bathroom doors. They are frosted glass schich makes everyone aware in the middle of the night when you need to use the facilities. It also doesn't seal which makes your business known to all. A little uncomfortable for sharing rooms with others that you are not very close with. Great pool!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Omni in great location”
Reviews.Author: thekeone
Reviews.Content: I am an unabashed Omni fan, their hotels and customer service have yet to let me down, which is remarkable because I have stayed at most of their locations. The San Diego Omni is one of my favorites. It is literally connected to the new Padres stadium. My GF and I were able to take their private bridge over to the game instead of walking around to the front of the stadium and waiting in line. They put us in a room on the top floor looking down at the pool. The room, while a standard room, was nice and sparkly clean. I have stayed in quite a few omni suites, and they are certainly the way to go if your budget allows. But this room was nice for a standard room. Also, we were able to purchase our San Diego Zoo tickets from the concierge in the lobby, which was very convenient. Everyone we came across was very helpful. There is a McCormick and Schmicks in the lobby, which is a great seafood restaurant. Not sure if that location offers it, but most of that chain offers amazing food specials for happy hour. drinks are still standard price though. For nightlife, the hotel is in a prime spot, directly adjacent to the gas lamp district. It was my first time going out at night in SD, but there seemed to be a lot of options. I noticed a couple other hotels in the area, but I would strongly recommend the Omni, especially if you're planning on watching a baseball game.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect except for one major flaw”
Reviews.Author: Uugster
Reviews.Content: Everything was great at this hotel BUT bring ear plugs! There are in fact ear plugs in the drawers but the nightly freight trains blowing their whistles outside WILL wake you up and they take about 30 minutes to pass the hotel. They have SIX engines so you can imagine the noise and size. But I would still stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and a great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: MickyEssex
Reviews.Content: My Wife, Myself and our handicapped Son Jason stayed at the Omni San Diego and had a great time. The staff are brilliant and the service is great!! They serve great food and drinks and nothing is too much trouble for the staff. The weather was hot and sunny which of course is always a plus. This hotel is a gem, give it a try and you will not be dissapointed. Ask for Angelo his is a great guy and will look after you.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Camie41
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni San Diego Sept.31st-Oct 3 2010, attended the San Diego Padresgame had a great time, This is a 5 Star hotel, excellent customer serive from the bell man, front desk, house keeping and Justin Sondgeroth-Concierge. Thank to Janelle Ruhumuliza for making our stay perfect we had a great relaxing time. Hotel is close to everything downtown. We do recommand that you eat at Mary Janes, its off 6th Street on the side of Hard Rock Cafe Hotel very good food. and a Woman's Bar in Hillcrest called Gossip Girls great cheeseburgers and fries,unlimited menu, ask for Jusin to be you server excellent customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Will_travel_4_food15
Reviews.Content: My 9 year old son and I stayed a week at the Omni and enjoyed every minute we were there. The room was great and overlooked the bay on the top floor, the pool was lots of fun and a bit cold in June, but it did not stop us to go in and enjoy it. Do park across the street where it is cheaper. Will go back next year again with my son and make it our annual trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Park yourself across the street”
Reviews.Author: stretch418
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Great location, although I don't think we got the room I was suppose to get. The confirmation said window to floor windows and high powered shower head which we had neither, we still had a great time. You can't ask for a hotel with a better location. Close enough to all the action just far enough away to not deal with the noise. I don't know how it would be when the Padres are in town. Was checked in and the room was ready when I got there. The only complaint was parking was $35 a day or $26 for the weekend. We parked at the hotel the first night. After it took the valet a longer than desired time to get our car (in their defense the jacksonville jaguars were staying there and trying to load their bus for their game against the chargers) we noticed that there was a parking garage right across the street. For the next two days we parked their for a cost of $16 TOTAL. And we were able to get access to our car faster than the valet was getting it for us. Even though you get free Wi Fi in your room (if you are a member), if you need to print something the concierge won't do and you need to use the business center was $6.95 for 15 minutes plus printing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great room - though a little bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: palmz87
Reviews.Content: We managed to get a fantastic deal on this hotel through Priceline, so going by my previous Priceline room experiences (which I'm not complaining about!), I expected to room to be quite small. On the contrary, our room (614) was perfect- located fairly near the lift and near the gym and pool. The room was brilliant. This is my first Omni experience, and I was impressed. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom very spacious. My only minor complaint was the noise factor. I think I can still hear the drone of the train horn that seem to start in the early hours from the nearby railroad crossing and also, though this didn't effect me personally, the club on the road opposite has loud music- though we were out 'till late, so it didn't bother us.

Reviews.Title: “My Best Omni Experience Yet”
Reviews.Author: lefty713
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at quite a few Omni Hotels in the last year, and I figured that it would be a tough task to outperform the Los Angeles Omni. I was wrong. After a small glitch, the front desk personnel did everything possible to insure my comfort. And they succeeded at every turn. From spacious rooms and comfortable beds/work spaces, to wonderfully convenient location this hotel impressed me. But what impressed me even more was the attitude and personality of every single employee with which I had contact. What a delightful couple of stays I had, I cannot wait until I get sent to San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN! AIGH!”
Reviews.Author: GregInEllijay
Reviews.Content: The staff was outstanding -- courteous, prompt, attentive. The hotel was nicely kept. The problem? Rampant cost cutting. Towels were thinner than Wal-Mart shop rags (really atrocious). "Spring Break" atmosphere, lots of noise until well past 3 AM from nearby clubs. Room was small, even by French standards and accounting charged me $44.10 for two bottles of water. Oops. Never mentioned my overnight package at the desk. Oops. $35 a day to park, $9.95 for Internet that's free most anyplace else. I almost expected a bag fee ... Nickels and dime charges from a fairly pricey place. Thanks, but I'll stay someplace else. OMG ...

Reviews.Title: “Great location and awesome with the girls.”
Reviews.Author: worldisabook
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms as part of our girlfriend weekend getaway last March and one of our rooms was on an upper floor corner room with the other one next door. I learned from calling them a few days earlier that they only have 1 set of adjoining rooms (a little hard to believe). The hotel has a great location and we had a great view of Petco Park, downtown San Diego and the Coronado bridge. The rooms were clean and were modern but simple in decor. Beds were soft and comfortable. Robes were provided and bathrooms were a little cramped with just one sink. The bathroom door was a slider with no locks. Check-in was a breeze and all the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. Parking was $30 valet and parking across the street on the structure was a little bit cheaper. We walked over to most of the restaurants in the gaslamp area. McCormick & Shmicks was in the lobby and a couple of the gals had the buffet breakfast which was close to $20 with not that much variety. They also had ala carte breakfast items. It is a beautiful hotel with a great location so I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “is great hotel”
Reviews.Author: littlestep
Reviews.Content: great hotel incredible staff we atayen on the 18th room 1813 never had a problem, the hosekeeping is very professional ( thank you martha) our room is very clean. the hotel is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with easy public transit access to all the San Diego hot spots.”
Reviews.Author: Glam30
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are ending our stay here. It was an excellent stay- I am going to miss San Diego. The hotel is very close to all sorts of public transportation & that was very helpful as we did not rent a car. The staff was very friendly from the very beginning. I liked the room and the location. My only complaint would be the bathroom. You can hear everything that is going on :( At any rate highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong staying here”
Reviews.Author: nyleeny
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying 7 nights at THE OMNI, I can't say enough good things about this hotel, rooms were a good size, clean, water view and pool view were great. the best thing about this place was how friendly and helpful the staff was,every single person we dealt with was FANTASTIC. The location is also great its across the street from PETCO PARK where the PADRES baseball team plays(it even has a elevated walkway from the hotel to the park for guest of the hotel). The gaslamp district is 1 block away and the trolley is 1 block away. NOTE: before you go sign up on line to become a gold club member (no charge) and you get free internet,turn down service, free coffee and cold beverage brought to your room every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a WINNER!”
Reviews.Author: Caron-Gerry
Reviews.Content: Stayed @ Omni while attending a convention, just a 3 minute walk away. Stayed an extra week and enjoyed all the local amenities. Great location, right in the heart of Gaslamp. Close to restaurants, shopping, bay area, Seaport Village, Coronado Ferry, USS Midway, and even connected to Petco Park. Easy access to Old Town, Zoo & Balboa Park via public transit. Staff extremely friendly, courteous & helpful. Many special touches that you don't get at other hotels (e.g. sewing kit, mouthwash, live wake-up call). City view was nice and quiet. Would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: fb132
Reviews.Content: Its a beautiful hotel with all those baseball memorabilia's everywhere. I was located on the 17th floor and I enjoyed the ocean view. Right near the baseball stadium and located in downtown San Diego, so you have access to everything you need. The only downside is they charge you and arm and a leg for any service you want such as wi fi internet or even printing something, luckily printing a boarding pass is free. Overall I still recommend it unless your on a tight budget and internet is a necessity.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Beautiful City”
Reviews.Author: narcissa_bell
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I decided to stay at the Omni after getting an EXCELLENT deal. The room we booked was very roomy/comfy and because we were part of their rewards program we received free beverage service in the morning. We used the fitness facilities nearly every day we were there and it seemed top-notch, we were very pleased to see that they served iced lemon water which is super refreshing after working up a sweat. location is amazing, gas-lamp is SO much fun and theres so much to do. The only complaint is the restaurant in the hotel (McCormick and Schmidts) NOT impressed... However, you are so close to many many WONDERFUL restaurants theres no need to worry. Favorite meal was Red Pearl Kitchen, YUM.

Reviews.Title: “Dont miss their baseball package”
Reviews.Author: HuskyFan59
Reviews.Content: A great hotel. Good service with the added advantage of being skybridge connected to PetCo Stadium the home of the Padres. They have a package that includes a first class room fine field box seats and apple pie waiting for you in your room after the game.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service,great location”
Reviews.Author: Jayne_pj
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with an incredible staff . We asked for and received a corner,view room. The hotel was very clean with towels replaced twice a day. Turn down service nightly and great room service. Our vacation was made much nicer by staying in a hotel were everything was done right!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: chatterbox-2007
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated next to Petco Park and the Gaslamp district. On the weekends it can be a bit loud as music from nearby venues can be heard, though it wasn't disturbingly loud (at least for us as we were on a high floor (20th)). Hotel parking available at a hefty price but you can find street parking near the hotel. Lots of restaurants nearby. The room itself was clean and comfortable and a good size. My friend did see a bug in the room one morning though--not a roach, but not a small ant either.

Reviews.Title: “We'd stay here again in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: GillsMan7
Reviews.Content: We'd never stayed in an Omni before, and having stayed in very friendly hotels such as the Petite Auberge in San Fran, we weren't expecting much. How wrong we were! From the moment we arrived, we were made to feel welcome, which we didn't expect as a young family staying in what we thought was predominantly a business hotel. Luke, the valet manager, was extremely friendly and remembered my name the next few days. Oliver, the bellboy, was also extremely friendly, very affable and knowledgeable about the area. He also picked up a kid's pack for our young daughter which was most appreciated as it contained lots of nice toys for her. The room was lovely with a great view over the Coronado bay and the swimming pool below. We booked this hotel via a great deal on Travelbag, so weren't expecting such a nice room. The bathroom was salubrious and the room extremely comfortable. Tip: join their SelectGuest program free of charge before visiting to get free WiFi - it's well worth it. The swimming pool and jacuzzi area were very nice - although the pool wasn't the warmest, the attendants at the pool were extremely helpful and friendly. Unlike other reviewers, we didn't have a problem with the location. It's next to the Gaslamp Quarter (pretty much in it) and next to the Convention Centre and the Baseball stadium. It's also next to some train tracks, and the trains weren't that noisy, although one night we could hear some freight trains, but it wasn't particularly bad. Another point some reviewers have mentioned is the bathroom doors. Yes, they are a little weird. When they slide they slide across, there is a little gap, but I can only see that there would be privacy issues, if your partner was deliberately trying to look in. Which is too weird to think about really. In short, they were fine. With regards to parking, you can pay $32 for valet, or $18 dollars for self parking - all in the same garage across the street. The valet was nice, but a little inconsistent - the first time we picked up the car, it had been tidied a little bit and there were two little bottles of water in the cup holders. This was a lovely touch, so we were disappointed when it wasn't repeated the second time. We definitely intend to stay here again, and will be looking out for other Omni hotels on future trips to America. We would heartedly recommend this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: seekingtomorrow
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend for a business meeting. It was quite nice. Room overlooked the pool. Room was modern. Has an amazing sleep on the bed. Staff were quite friendly, concierge was great and quite helpful (they serve free champagne by his desk at happy hour so watch for that) My only complaint was my room was not ready when I arrived (not a problem at all as they were booked full and I arrived before the 3pm check in time). I was told that once my room was ready they would call my cell. I didn't get that call. If it's a baseball game night, be prepared for some crowds around the hotel. Even with ball games going on next door I didn't hear a sound in my room though. Overall, a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT location!!”
Reviews.Author: hilltoppermike
Reviews.Content: Don't freak out with the cost of the rooms! The great location means you barely need a car for a few days as you explore the harbor area. Connected to Petco Park (Padres) and Gaslamp District begins one block away. Gaslamp is perfect vacation area for couples.....great restaurants, great bars, great live music with shopping intermixed. Hotel was wonderful with very, very helpful people. Excellent pool area. If you are a baseball fan, can't beat the fact that this hotel is connected to the ballpark via a ramp! Sat poolside until I heard the National Anthem and then headed to seats.....no traffic, no parking. Rooms large, clean....having all you need. Can't recall a better stay at ANY hotel recently! :) Thanks to all those that previously posted to NOT valet your car with the hotel ($32@ nite). Go across the street to the garage where you pay $9@nite!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TuckerMidwest
Reviews.Content: It was updated, clean, and had a great view of the bay. It was also ideally located in the Gaslamp Quarter to several shops and restaurants and Petco Park. It was also a short taxi ride to the various tourist attractions like Seaworld, San Diego Zoo, and Seaport Village. You don't need a rental car if you stay here while in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views and location. Parking is expensive”
Reviews.Author: Bruingirl6
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni on business. I had a very spacious room on a corner. I had beautiful ocean views. The parking is quite expensive at $32 per day. I had my husband stop by to join me for dinner...so our parking total for the trip was $96 for an overnight trip! Service was good and had no problems holding my bags after checkout when I was attending a meeting. The room was quite noisy. I was woken up many times with the nearby trolley noise. The bed was of good quality and quite comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and friendly but loud”
Reviews.Author: Goober818
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel, very small rooms a la Manhattan and exceptionally friendly staff. I think it's a bad sign when your nightstand boasts a collection of earplugs and wondered if that was a sign of things to come. Sure enough, this place is noisy. I can hear every word said as people walk by in the hallway (much louder than normal), the outside noises include a frequent train and heavy traffic. Trust me, I'm not unreasonable, you can always hear some noise in a hotel and that's what it is to travel but this place is very loud (obviously I'm not alone in thinking that or I wouldn't have earplugs in the room). Small, outdated TVs. The common areas and location are by far the strong point of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel shame about all the homeless”
Reviews.Author: surfsup2
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel at the beginning of the Gas Lamp area in San Diego,Staff friendly and the rooms are really modern ,Had a good view over to the water and the convention centre.Also nice pool area and really comfortable sun beds.Never had a meal in the hotel as lots of restaurants within walking distance. The hotel is also next door to Petco Baseball park and also has a walkway from the hotel into the park. Only downfall was when you look down from the window to the street we counted about 3 homeless peope sleeping below the hotel window and if your idea of seeing this and them just dropping there bottoms when they need the loo,then dont worry, found San diego was a bit scary this time as have never seen so many homeless people and beggars on every corner in the Gas Lamp area..They seem to have a big problem as they were everywere in all the parks on the side of the trolley tracks on the grass even on pathways and on benches.Might be a few years before we go back shame as a really nice hotel and this is our 7th vistit to San Diego.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Ras Al Khaimah, United Arab Emirates
Reviews.Title: “A Great hotel in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: ammoss
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights on the first leg of our month long vacation. We had been travelling for more than 24 hours to reach San Diego so were really tired when we arrived at the check in desk but the key card was already waiting for us. As I was celebrating my birthday during our vacation the hotel automatically upgraded us to a junior suite on a high floor where there was champagne and chocolate waiting for us. The room was great, very clean and very spacious. We were overlooking the pool and the railway line but I can honestly say that not once did a train disturb us either, by day or by night. We had taken the Breakfast and parking package which we thought to be excellent value.......the breakfasts and the service in McCormick & Schmick's were very good and the portion size incredible! The hotel location is great for shopping and dining. We made use of the gym and the pool just once during our stay but both were very clean and well equipped. The concierge was very knowledgeable, helpful and friendly.....we booked our trip on the tram tour through him. We too were staying at the hotel during the earthquake mentioned in the previous reviews but knew nothing about it until someone told us about it the next day.......and as for all the comments re the bathrooms......it obviously wasn't a problem as we cant even remember the doors! Our check out was as efficient as our check in. The valet guys asked if we needed directions to our next location and even gave us details of good places to see and eat en route. We could not fault the hotel or the service we received from any member of staff and would book this hotel if we are ever back in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and clean but annoying lack of attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: timezoner
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night for a breakfast meeting the following morning at the hotel as well. The rooms are decent size, modern, and clean - I thought of it as an updated Marriott. The bed was comfortable. Staff was friendly. But overall there was a definite lack of attention to detail. Now, I don't expect a Four Seasons experience at these prices, but.... First, I signed up for their Select Guest program to take advantage of the freebies, which are generous compared to other programs. But I never did get the promised bottle of water, morning beverage, evening turn down, or Wall Street Journal (USA Today delivered instead). Second, I took advantage of the free shoe shine freebie. My shoes were picked up that evening. I asked them to leave them hanging on my door by 7am the next morning. But instead of leaving them on my door (which had the Privacy Sign up), they kept knocking away promptly at 7am until I came out of the shower to open the door. Very annoying. Third, the TV in the room did not work right. The remote clearly needed batteries. But even when using the controls on the TV itself, I had a hard time getting the guide to work. The TV would only turn on to a channel with snow rather than tuned to the set top box. And it would not easily switch. In addition, the default volume when turned on was very loud. Even after I got the TV to tune to the box, it functioned very slowly. In the end, I just gave up. Very annoying. Fourth, twice I experienced the elevators randomly missing my floor and changing directions while riding them. Have no clue how that happens. Fifth, I asked for a quite room on a high floor away from the elevators. I got most of it but their definition of a quiet room was to put me near the housekeeping area - which is not quiet at all with the staff going in and out and gossiping away. And they also put me in a handicap room without asking. That meant the closets had low hanging rods for wheelchair accessibility, bathroom had no tub, etc... And clearly it was a seldom used room because dust had gathered on the coffee machine, coffee cups and grinds. Sixth, it may be a bit unfair of me to evaluate the breakfast at the meeting since it really depends on the meeting organizer's contract, but there was no vegetarian option for the meal. They did put together a nice fruit plate which took very long to bring out. Seventh, I was planning on letting the front desk know about my stay experience, but to my surprise, when I checked out, the desk agent did not ask how my stay was. She was friendly for sure, but gave me only a quick thanks and goodbye. Finally, my stay has still not shown up on my Select Guest profile. I'd look into it if I thought I'd be staying at Omni regularly. Nothing above by itself is a big deal, but collectively it adds up to an irksome stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally nice”
Reviews.Author: Sutter
Reviews.Content: Modern, spacious rooms. Good service. Based on reviews we'd seen, we purposefully requested a city-side room, rather than a bayview room, to be further from train/trolley noise. I suppose there could be some noise form Petco Park, literally next door, on game nights, but there was no game the night we were there (if you do go to a game, there is a special walkway for hotel guests). If you join the Omni loyalty program, you get free wireless Internet use and two free breakfast drinks brought to your room, even if you get your room through Priceline or other third party service (very unusual). There's an upscale chain restaurant (McCormick & Schmick's) downstairs, but there are also many restaurants in the adjacent Gaslamp Quarter. Hotel is next to a trolley (light rail) stop and within easy walking distance of the convention center and bayside walkway.

Reviews.Title: “Please Replace The Hotel Bathroom Door”
Reviews.Author: Buffed112859
Reviews.Content: The only issue with this hotel, which is a big one when traveling with a significant other, is bathroom privacy. You will have none with this hotel. Bathroom doors need to be replaced along with ventilation within the bathrooms. Apart from that I would have given the hotel a five star rating. But until this can be corrected and soon, I would look for another hotel, if like myself, privacy is an issue.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed the 3-night stay!”
Reviews.Author: NewMomTexas
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed in Omni San Diego. First time was for our 1st anniversary; and this time we went there with our 3-year-old son. Overall we enjoyed the stay. Pros: (1) The hotel is fairly new with contemporary decorations; (2) Great location with walking distance to tons of restaurants; (3) We thought it was targeting business travelers but we were wrong. As soon as we checked in, our son received a nice backpack with at least five toys. He was very happy about that and carried that backpack even on the airplane back home; (4) Check-in was easy and quick. Knowing the whistle of the train, we asked for a quiet room and got one. During the three nights stay, we didn't hear any whistle from the running train down the street; (5) We joined the select member program and received complimentary beverage every morning. (6) From the bell boy to the people at the front desk or concierge, everyone was friendly. (7) The gym and swimming pool are nice. Now a few cons: (1) As mentioned by some reviews, the interior wall was pretty thin. In the mid of night, we woke up when our next door neighbors talking loudly. (2) Since it is summer time, the PETCO Park hosts Padres’ games every weekend. Some roads around the hotel were blocked so we did experience frustration to get to the hotel at night. (3) $32/night valet parking was expensive. However, compared to other hotels in San Diego area, it is still in a reasonable range. By the way, we paid $101/night (not include parking and tax) via priceline.com. We think it was good value. Hope my review helps.

Reviews.Title: “Very inviting, friendly, and great customer service.”
Reviews.Author: dubique
Reviews.Content: Omni's customer service is second to none. I stayed at the Omni while at a conference this past June; and I must say that I was fully satisfied with the amenities, customer service, and staff. Like most other hotels, where you get lost in the shuffle, the Omni felt like home. The friendly and attentive staff made my stay a fulfilling experience. This is how good they are: I requested a refrigerator when I arrived in my room. It was delivered in less than no time. That is what you call customer service - little things like that.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: eos_domestic_goddess
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, the front desk staff welcomed us, gave us a great room with a balcony overlooking the pool/coronado bridge/bay on one side and the convention center/harbor on another. I told them it was my husband's birthday that day, and they sent up champagne, bottled water and chocolates! You must join the hotel club to get the freebies; morning beverage, free wifi, newspaper etc. This hotel chain goes above and beyond. Yes, I agree about the louvered doors to the bathroom, but I was with my spouse; turned the tv on to make noise; don't sweat the small stuff; life is too short. The trains did not bother us at night as someone else said, and we didn't hear anything from the room next door. We had the best dinner at McCormicks and Schmicks; seared ahi tuna, petrole sole, oh, and the hama hama oysters are so sweet and tender. We had to go there a second time just for the oysters! The Gaslamp Quarter was a fun area to be in; so many restaurants to walk to; try the Broken Yolk for breakfast and the Trattoria La Strada for dinner. Rent bikes on Coronado; it's a fun place to ride around. Visit the Cabrillo Monument. San Diego has so much to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: jelly4
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel a lot - it wasn't in any way amazing but it wasn't very expensive either so we were very happy with it. The location is perfect for down town nightlife and restaurants. The rooms were fine, perfectly clean and the higher floors had good views of the city. My only criticism is the weird bathroom door. There's a big gap and it doesn't close properly. A bit of privacy would be nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, would come back”
Reviews.Author: kaylac_10
Reviews.Content: This OMNI is fun to stay at due to its proximity to the Old Town. I love the OMNI program and try to get room with view of bay which has balcony. We had a corner room and it was great. Woul.d return if in area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: woolly1dog
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband and two young children for a conference that my husband and I both attended. It was right across the street from the convention center. It is not a large hotel, which suited us fine because it was not difficult to navigate through. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel gave each child a backpack of toys and there is the option of borrowing a suitcase with more toys and activities. We had a view of the shoreline from our room and from another window in the hallway, of Petco park. The rooms were clean, wifi was easily accessible and free with becoming a select guest (free membership). The bathroom was large enough so that my husband and I could fit in there to bathe the kids and a pocket door conserved space although it was slightly derailed. There was plenty of shelf space in the bathroom with nice amenities, but not enough hooks to hang towels to dry. Bathrobes were provided. Housekeeping emptied our garbage cans twice a day (since we have kids, we generate a lot of garbage.) The walls were a little thin but overall not a noisy hotel. The trains outside were somewhat loud and ran during the night as well but since I have toddler boys, I welcomed the trains as entertainment for the boys during the day. The hotel cafe was small and expensive, but there was plenty of seating the hotel lobby to eat or drink your coffee. The Mc Cormick and Schmick's restaurant was delicious. Location was great as it was close to the Gaslamp district and restaurants and shopping were very accessible. Children's museum was within walking distance from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “underwhelmed, glad i got a good deal on the place”
Reviews.Author: Umailop
Reviews.Content: I usually stay a block away at the Solamar when in san diego, but i found a good rate over memorial day weeeknd, so i gave the omni a shot. It is amazing how much of a difference there is between a queen bed over at solamar and a double at the omni, the small size of the beds made sleeping not so comfortable. fitness room was good size and 4th floor allows for an averave view of the field at petco. joined the select program and part of the benefits is that i was allowed to choose complimentary morning beverages. too bad they didnt arrive the first morning i was at the hotel and it took 3 phone calls and one hour for them to finally arrive to the room. Dont offer up a service and then do a poor job of following thru on it.

Reviews.Title: “First class all the way”
Reviews.Author: Benny1022
Reviews.Content: A first class hotel in a great location in Gaslamp. Connected to Petco park by a walkway used only by hotel guests. Can't get more convenient than that. Awesome restaurants nearby on 5th and 6th streets. And survived a 5.7 earthquake on the 16th floor. Only downside was the restaurant service in the hotel was a little subpar. Coffee was cold, food took a long time. And the little shop in the lobby was not open late at night, so had to walk to a store a couple blocks away for sodas. Valet parking is steep cost $32 but what do you expect for the location?Other than that, everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and for Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: ksaridakis
Reviews.Content: Great views and perfect for walking to local destiations if there for a short time. Location close to airport, Bay , running path and Gas Lamp district - which has tons of restaurants and shops. Very nice and well maintained gym. Rooms clean and modern. Small pool area. Would recommend to solo travelers. Staff friendly. Walking distance to Petco ball park.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Josie630
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our vacation. The location couldn't be any better. We had tickets to a Padres game & the hotel is connected to the park. Very convenient. It is also within walking distance of hundreds of resturants & shops. The staff are friendly & the hotel it'self is extremely clean & modern. My only complaint is the bathroom. It does not have a solid door or walls. Louvered panels instead. Believe me, you can hear EVERTHING that goes on in there! No privacey. As well, you can hear the bathrooms on either side of you. We are members of the select guest program & had 2 beverages & a newspaper delivered to our room each AM. Very nice. We atayed on the 18th floor facing the water. Never had a problem w/train noise. Would never have known there was even a train nearby, if we didn't see it outside our window.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location hotel and excellent rooms”
Reviews.Author: pinchivida
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night with my girlfriend as a local gateaway since we dont live in downtown and we got what we wanted. Its walking distance from all the clubs and restaurants and the room was amazing. What we liked the most besides the beds is the bathroom had a window that could be open to when you are getting ready you feel you are still in the room or closed to have your privacy if you wanted. I recommend anyone that wants to stay in downtown without having having to stay at a party hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, helpful staff, pretty good housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: librarian5
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with impressive views of the city. You couldn't ask for a better location. The room is beautifully decorated with thoughtful amenities down to the tiniest things like earplugs, which can come in handy for light sleepers with rooms facing the railroad tracks or busy streets. The bathrooms are enormous and we didn't have the shuttered doors mentioned in another review but a beautiful sliding door instead. Room service was perfect and the food was delivered quickly and piping hot. The servings are large enough to share. We let them know we were going to share and they made sure we had two sets of utensils. They even sent two complimentary bottles of spring water. If you're bringing a laptop, sign up for the Omni frequent stay program and you'll receive free WiFi. The only issue I had was with housekeeping. The bathroom shelves were dusty and the coffeemaker looked like it hadn't been touched in a very long time. I had to wipe it clean before using it. The coffee condiments were not restocked after I used them. However, these were minor issues when taking into consideration our overall stay. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel-Questionable Room Design”
Reviews.Author: FasTxn
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great staff, great location BUT.... the bathroom in the room has floor to ceiling shutters on the wall. You know, the kind you can open and look through!!??Plus the door to the bathroom is also louvered. Maybe this is being picky, and probably not a pretty picture, but the bed (and my wife) is 2.5 feet from the shutters. WHO THE @#%&^ DESIGNED THAT???!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great City”
Reviews.Author: wg1219
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a fabulous Memorial Day weekend at the Omni Hotel, San Diego. After searching the numerous hotels recommended on TripAdvisor, we selected the Omni. Best choice. The location is convenient to everything, from Petco Field,the GasLamp District, and convention center. The staff was first class. Check-in was the quickest I have ever experienced and every request made on the reservation was honored. Need extra pillows? No problem, foam or feather? Our rooms overlooked the pool, which I feared would be noisy. Not a problem because of the soundproofing of the sliding doors. Iread about this hotel having a noise problem, but that was not our experience. San Diego is a great city and if you want a great place to stay, try the Omni!

Reviews.Title: “My first Omni experience - love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravellinMofo
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at an Omni (I've since stayed at other Omnis) and I loved it. The location was AWESOME - right by the Padres field and the Gas Lamp district. Walked to loads of good food during my stay. The room was big and very nice. Incredibly clean and comfortable. They have fresh squeezed juice on the breakfast menu, which I haven't seen at any other Omnis - just regular canned/bottled juice at the others. Front desk staff was AWESOME! I self-parked at the garage right across the street. It was so easy to get my luggage across to the hotel. My only complaint is that the walls are kinda thin. By the end of the first night, I knew some drunk woman's entire life story by hearing it through the walls. Before staying here, sign up for their free Select Guest program. It gets you free Wi-Fi access and 2 free morning beverages each morning!

Reviews.Title: “Great location Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: mkmc
Reviews.Content: We got our rooms by chance (Priceline) we would definitely choose a Omni hotel by choice next time!! We joined their membership club before we went and we were treated like pampered guests. They had the best housekeeping (next to Vegas) and the rooms and beds were very comfortable. You can park in the garage across the street, no hassle - a lot less money. Their restaurant was so-so but you are across the street from the entrance to the gaslight district with 100+ dining choices! Cafe 222 was by far my families favorite breakfast place...less wait than Richard Walker better food. San Diego has to be one of the most beautiful, weather and people friendly cities we have ever gone to...can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel next door to the ball park”
Reviews.Author: theallens04
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the omni hotel for one night. I'll start by saying that we arrived on a day when a baseball game was going on, so many of the streets were closed off and it was a little tougher getting to the hotel since it's connected to the ball park. But we had a gps and it rerouted us enough times for us to find the hotel. The hotel was super clean. We checked in and asked that a crib be sent up to our room for my little one. The crib arrived quickly and it was super clean with fitted sheets and a blanket. We were over looking the street and at night it is loud as the trolly/train runs. Parking only valet was available for $32, but we parked across the street at a very safe garage for $16 per night. We didn't eat at the hotel because we wanted something new not chain restaurants. I also got this hotel room on priceline for half the price so it was well worth it. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelcrazy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni for the Memorial Day weekend, and had a great time. Valet was quick, check in was a breeze, and the bellman followed us up to our room. We were pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to a suite that had a view of the pool area, Petco Park, and Coronado Bridge. Everything was spotless too. We used the fitness center and were happy to find everything in working order. We also kicked back at the pool, and enjoyed the heated pool, and the fast service provided by the waitresses on call. The pool was very relaxing with soft music playing. Loved using the skybridge that connected us to Petco Park. Enjoyed the free Wi-Fi, drinks left at our door, and the turn down service that brought goodies the first night, and replenished towels and ice. Remember to tip too. We left money every am and pm for our maids, tipped the valet, and the bellman. We witnessed people using the bellman to load their cars without doing this. All in all, a wonderful and relaxing mini staycation in Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TXnatives
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for a Conference in the SD Convention Center. The location was very convenient to shopping, food and entertainment. The best part of the hotel was the service we received. The concierge desk had 2 wonderful employees: Justin and Robert. They both helped us out with diner reservations and tours. Everyone in the hotel staff was helpful and friendly. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants contemporary luxury. If you want to check out a Padres game make the reservation through the hotel for the extra perks.

Reviews.Title: “sweet hotel, great views and great sleep”
Reviews.Author: lasfloras
Reviews.Content: The staff are always cheerful and friendly, the food was excellent from the catering staff. The internet service was free if you sign up for the frequent guest program! The internet was only a teeny bit slow, compared to other hotels that I've stayed at. The beds were very, very comfortable and the rooms had room-dark drapes so I slept in very well! There was a DVD player with the alarm clock, too! The room was spacious with a nice tv, minibar (no charge for opening it and storing your own beverage) and a roomy bathroom with lots of little side shelves to store your toiletries! Lots of mirrors and good lighting, and a sunny window with nice sheers to keep the room from getting too hot. Also, the mini-mart downstairs had everything you could need, cereal, soy milk, maps, it was great! The service was fantastic there as well. The bar had a daily happy hour special for drinks and snacks and the pool/hotttub looked nice and inviting, although, this weekend was entirely too cold and windy for me to enjoy use of the outdoor heated pool. All in all, I would like to return there to enjoy it for vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a corporate chain...”
Reviews.Author: b0nv0yage2007
Reviews.Content: I'm a local and I only use Priceline when I stay overnight in the Gaslamp...unless Comic Con or some major holiday is happening, there are always rooms available in one of the 4-star hotels for a steal. This is the second time the Omni has accepted my $95 bid...making me very happy! You never know how you're going to be treated when the staff sees "Priceline" next to your name...will they look at you with slight distaste? Will you be stuck in a room adjoining the elevator? Will there only be one bed for 3 women? I am happy to report that both times, the Omni has treated me right, honoring all of my requests...adjoining rooms with two beds...with a smile. This was the perfect location for a pre-Valentine's GNO. We could walk out the front door and in 3 blocks we were at our restaurant and in another 3 blocks the nightclub. The rooms were clean and stylish. We had a blast...hope we get the Omni again next year!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in the heart of downtown”
Reviews.Author: Travis D
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this location once before, I decided to revisit for a 3-night stay in San Diego. The location is incredibly located - walking distance to the convention center, many other hotels, bars, restaurants and nightclubs around the downtown/gaslamp district. The rooms are very spacious, updated and clean. Minibars are well stocked without being obscenely priced and the staff at the hotel was extremely courteous, efficient and friendly. Only downside: Valet parking (only option) is $32/night! There is a parking garage directly across the street which I opted for, which averaged about $15/day. Fantastic hotel for anyone traveling on business and/or for a few fun nights out in SAn Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: Jade25
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a government conference and the rate was $147/night. I understand that the normal rate exceeds $200/night. The food that was set up the conference was exceptional and surprising. When I made the reservation I joined the Omni Frequent customer program. It is free and well worth it. I recieved free internet daily, a daily complementary morning beverage (x2) delivered to the room free, and the view was amazing. The staff was very personable and great. I had a great stay here and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: TravelGal415
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several San Diego Hotels- Marriott, Hyatt, Hilton, Hotel Solamar and now the Omni. They are really all good choices for downtown San Diego/ the gaslamp district. If I went back, I would pick the least expensive of the properties as they are mostly interchangeable as far as rooms and views are concerned (bay view, Petco Park, street view). Hotel Solamar has a good pool scene- not sure if the Omni does as I stayed there in winter. My room as a corner room with nice views of the bay- the room itself was medium sized, but the bathroom was decent sized. Overall, nothing special, but also not disappointing- clean, comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “NICE”
Reviews.Author: jdip2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. Make sure to ask for a room on a high floor facing the bay. Great view of the bay. Was on the 15th but it goes much higher than that. Complimentary wifi in the hotel room if you sign up for some type of vip/frequent flier club thing which is free so you can't beat that. Nice pool on the 6th floor. Fitness room is also on the 6th floor. Pretty good, actually has a a few cybex style machines as well as dumbbells and cardio equipment. The hotel is at the entrance of the gaslamp and easy walking distance to bars and restaurants (few blocks). It is pretty much directly across the street from the convention center so if you are planning your trip based on access to the convention center and the gaslamp this would be my first choice in hotel. Would highly recommend to friends. One thing which may turn some off is that it has an old school style TV in the room. Was a bit surprised to see that being that flat screens are so cheap now a days. right next door to the hard rock.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Superleeds
Reviews.Content: Location - fantastic - at the bottom of the Gas Lamp district and so just a 2 minute stroll to numerous bars and restuarants. Parking - had a rate that included valet parking so this wasn't a problem. Room - beautiful room on high floor overlooking bay Food/Drink - breakfast was fantastic. Excellent bar and good choice of cocktails although quite expensive as you would imagine in a hotel of this calibre. Staff - for such a large upmarket hotel, I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful An expensive choice but certainly worth it. We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: SRBe
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a first time trip to San Diego and it didn't dissapoint. Hotel rooms are nice, we got upgraded to a suite as we were celebrating our wedding anniversary. The pool area looked very nice. Another plus was that the gym is free to use for guests. At first it seemed that the tram line right next to the hotel will be very noisy but, we didn't hear a peep. If you want to walk around in the gaslamp district, this is a great base. There are so many restaurants and bars around, great nightlife. Self park garage is right across the hotel which was a lot cheaper than Valet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the Gas Lamp District of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: mnasf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for spring break and loved the hotel. We had two room to accomadate our family. The rooms were modern and clean. The staff were very friendly. We ate breakfast a couple of times at Morsels in the lobby and were treated very well. During one day of our stay there was a fairly large earthquake. We were in our room and felt it, but we were very safe. The hotel is new and very safe. We used the pool on the 6th floor of the hotel and really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vanweezy
Reviews.Content: The valet parking prices are very expensive here, but I get the feeling it would be like that at any nearby hotel. Since I am a Select Guest member, I got a free newspaper and drinks each morning, which was very nice. The staff, especially the doormen, were always very pleasant and helpful with directions. We had a very nice view from our room and the Gas Lamp district was within walking distance. The room was a good size, but the bathroom had a sliding door, which overlapped and went past the door frame, but didn't create a seal upon closing. That was awkward considering there were four of us sharing that room. Otherwise our stay was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: tripsforfun1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one Saturday night. Arrived at 1PM and as a select guest member, my room was ready and check in took like 30 seconds!!!! The room was exactly what I had requested. The location is great - just a short walk to the gaslamp. Parking is pricey, but in line with most hotels in the area. Valet did have 2 bottles ice cold water in the console ready for the drive home so that was a nice touch. Going back for Mother's Day weekend - can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Strongly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Advisortip
Reviews.Content: We are a party of 6 with young kids and grandparents. Omni SD is one of the best bell /valet staffs I have encountered among hotels. They are friendly, welcoming and helpful. Througout our stays of 5 nights, we are greeted with big smiles anytime we entered the hotel, nice suggestions on where to go, provide us umbrellas when raining, They are professional, excellent, and provide outstanding service. Upon arrival, I told them I will be parking somewhere and not using the valet parking, they are totally cool, they continue to help with the luggages, and you do not feel the pressure or discontent. (Parking across the street is $16 per day) Check-in took 5 minutes, they got our rooms pre-check-in, with adjoining room as requested, and high floor, with excellent view of the city. For kids:My 2 kids received a gift of cool toys right after check-in, which my daughter was very happy and impressed. It is a little treat but it changes their mood right away. We went into our rooms and there are cookies and milk awaiting for them, again, another surprise and treat. You can also ask front desk to lend you a kid bag which consists of books and games for them to read and play during their stay. My kids said it is the best hotel they had experienced so far ;D The rooms are good size, everything is great and clean. bed are very comfortable, no complaints at all. it is a 4 stars and it live up to the rating without problem, I will even rate them a 4.5. The Select guest allows us to use internet for free and free beverages, a nice treat. Location is perfect, 2 blocks from Gaslamp, the area is safe and clean. CVS in 2 blocks, We travel mostly with our car, and park across the street from the hotel. I will not write more as others has written a lot about the hotel, If you travel with young kids, and elderly, are worry about cleaniness, space, safety... I can tell you Omni is excellent, throughout our stay, there is nothing I can complain about or pick on, and I can be picky because we are traveling with kids and elderly. I do not feel the pressure, pretentious staff sometimes experienced with a 4 stars and up, they make us very comfortable, and I strongly strongly recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: carrotop
Reviews.Content: Previous comments are very accurate about this hotel. Right on the edge of the Gaslight District, next to Petco Park - home of the Padres, and beautiful view of San Diego Harbor. The previous mention of a train blowing its horn in the middle of the night is very accurate, so if noise bothers you, stay on the city side of the hotel. We were on the 15th floor and could still hear the train. The hotel even provided us with a "white noise" machine!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a fantastic location, with a few drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: truthseeker64
Reviews.Content: The Omni San Diego is located in the celebrated Gaslamp Quarter, steps away from the trolley line - and from there, one can explore pretty much all that the beautiful city has to offer (all day passes are only $5.00 per day). We found the hotel area itself lively with an active nightlife, but neither overwhelmingly busy nor unsafe. Keep in mind, however, that our stay was in January and I imagine that during the peak season, the area is probably far busier. There were many upscale bars and restaurants nearby, as well as several quaint shops featuring reasonably priced souvenirs. It is also within walking distance to the convention center. The hotel itself is architecturally stunning, and has an upper level outdoor pool with a nice city view. It also boasts a skywalk to the ballpark if you're a baseball fan. It's a beautiful building, and my fiance and I enjoyed walking around within it, especially on the pool level. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. We thought it a nice convenience that the hotel has an in-house cafe with Starbucks coffee - though we found the selection and quality somewhat lacking. The room was small, and the television was unimpressive (according to my fiance, it was a bit old, lacking the necessary hdmi inputs for hooking up his computer or gaming system), but the bedding was comfortable and the bathroom was quite nice - and surprisingly large. Parking is expensive (around $30+), but there are self-parking options in the vicinity for far less. Internet access is not free, unless you join their select guest program - which, if you stay there, I would highly recommend. We booked through Priceline to get a great deal, and the Omni still honored our select guest membership with free wireless and complimentary coffee and bagels delivered directly to our room. Room service was great - especially their cheesecake. You can't have it all, but this hotel certainly has a lot going for it. The location, especially given the easy trolley access, was certainly the best part for us, followed closely by their attentive and friendly staff. For what we paid, which was roughly half of their standard rates, we found our experience to be of a decent value. Overall, we enjoyed our stay a great deal and if we have reason to stay in downtown San Diego at some point in the future, we will be sure to keep the Omni in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: the_beach_911
Reviews.Content: The Omni San Diego is sleek. The bell & valet staff are some of the best I've ever met- friendly, knowledgeable, helpful and surprisingly always in a good mood. We had a great view of the convention center, harbor & Coronado from our room. The beds were comfortable (except for the pillows which were a little flat for me). The only thing I thought was interested was that the bathroom door just slides, doesn't close or lock...it isn't really a door. Not a big deal though. No problems at all during our stay. Didn't use the pool as it was raining but I like where it's situated on a deck. Nice fitnes room. The only negative comment I have is regarding the concierge... he wasn't really willing to help and seemed to lack interest in his own job. The Valet staff made way better concierges than the guy that was behind the concierge desk. Despite this, we would stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, no ambience”
Reviews.Author: wahinekawi
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Omni with a couple of friends who were visiting from the Northeast. They stayed longer, for about one week. The hotel is in a convenient location 5-10 minutes off the exit of the 5 freeway, adjacent to the Gaslamp district, and across from the convention center. It is also next to one of the trolley lines (we could hear it from our room). It's 20-30 minutes by car to downtown La Jolla and a short drive to the San Diego Zoo. Valet parking is available but costs $32/day! That's a pretty steep price, especially as the valet dinged the side of my car a bit! My first impression upon entering the lobby was that the hotel was very modern but geared more toward corporate guests, as it lacked any character. I guess that's to be expected of a large chain hotel. I didn't get much of a chance to interact with the staff but they appeared courteous and helpful. There's also a McCormick & Schmick's restaurant inside the hotel. Our room (I think on the 15th floor) had a nice view of the bay/convention center. The room itself was nice and clean but like the lobby, it did not have much ambience or feel very welcoming. The bed was very comfortable. The room was also facing the trolley line, so I was woken up in the morning by the sound of the bells as the trolley passed by. Overall, this hotel was ok. It's pretty much a no frills hotel. It's newish, clean, and modern but it unfortunately has no character. I'd consider staying at the hotel again if only for it's convenient location near all the major sites and if I were in the city for business at the Convention Center.

Reviews.Title: “Sea World”
Reviews.Author: CindyM267
Reviews.Content: Les the girls a mutual friend and myself stayed at the Omni 06/2009. We all had a pretty good time, ate wonderful food Gas Lamp Dist, great company, good time at Sea World. .. Awesome Hotel, great rates x 2 rooms. Went back AGAIN in Sept to celebrate friends birthday... Still Great times.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel one block from convention center”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveller2
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night while attending meeting at the convention center. I had a conf rate so it was not outrageously expensive. Very nice room, regular hotel room. I asked for quiet room no feathers and I got no feathers. Room was across from elevator but I never heard it. There was a problem with whistling sound coming from under door (air pressure) during the first hour or so - which was fixed by placing a towel at the bottom of the door, but it was gone later that night. Hard Rock Hotel across the street can be a bit noisy at night as are the trains etc next to the conv center. This is not such a quiet area. I slept fine albeit with foam earplugs. No fault of hotel it's just the area is not quiet. Very modern guest room well appointed and with an operable window - very nice for air quality in the room. Window also seals well and is double pane so it is quiet. Valet parking at $32/day is expensive but if you want there is a public garage across the street. McCormick and Schmicks restaurant is in the hotel good for seafood. Cafe has good assortment of muffins and pastries do not have to order room service breakfast. Also good coffee. I would stay here again if I were attending a conference.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel near convention center”
Reviews.Author: Chicagoehc
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel - very typical of the Omni experience elsewhere. Good size rooms with outisde pool and gym on 6th floor. Helpful staff and very helpful bell men. Nice coffee shop too. Convenient to the convention center, but still within earshot of the Gaslight District - actually we could hear the Saturday night Gaslight parites late into the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: SCSweendaddy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a show at the Convention Center and it was great. Perfect location - a short walk from the Conv. Ctr. and then to evenings out in the Gaslamp. Street side room was a little small but nicely decorated and new. Gym area was great as was the pool. Do check the bill as they tried to charge $10 to receive a small UPS package - they were nice enough to remove it. It got a little noisy on Friday night when the clubs let out and then some of them happen to be staying on our floor. The walls aren't thick so TV from neighboring room could be heard as could the shower and a phone conversation. We got a great deal on Priceline (less than $100 per night) so I won't sweat the small stuff. Overall, it is a very nice hotel, with a great staff and superb location.

Reviews.Title: “Good for convention goers”
Reviews.Author: Mostly_business1
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I stayed at this hotel while attending a conference at the convention center. The hotel is pretty new and well maintained. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and nicely furnished. Bayside rooms offer a nice view of San Diego Bay. If you like to sleep with the window open you may want to stay elsewhere though. The hotel is beside the commercial and light rail train tracks and next to the baseball stadium so it is very noisy with the windows open; with the windows closed though I didn't hear the trains much (double-paned glass) and they didn't wake me up. Shower in room was one of the best hotel showers I’ve ever had. Good water strength and it had one of those curved shower curtains rods so the curtain didn’t stick to you. Don’t recommend you share the room with a colleague though as there are only shutters between the bathroom and bedroom so it is NOT sound proofed. Hotel is within walking distance of the Gaslamp area, which contains a good variety of restaurants and the light rail transit is a 1 minute walk. Hotel restaurant food is good but very pricey. No breakfast buffet is available so we had room service for breakfast, which was very expensive. Those on a budget would probably not want to stay here, but if you have a reasonable expense account it's a good place to stay. You should definitely join the Omni Select Guest program so you don't have to pay $10/day for internet service (membership is free). Membership also entitles you to a free morning beverage, but double check you bill before you check out because room service didn't give me the appropriate credits.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and view”
Reviews.Author: perryspires
Reviews.Content: Located a short walk from the convention center and one block off of the Gas Lamp district, but connected to the ballpark makes this an ideal location to entertain clients.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: shanexedge
Reviews.Content: I brought my wife here on a bit of a surprise birthday vacation, and mentioned something about that in passing when requesting a bay view room. When we checked in, there was a piece of cake, champagne, and two glasses waiting for us on our bed, along with a very sweet happy birthday card signed by several staff members. Way to start on the right foot, Omni! We had a room on the 19th floor with a wonderful view. True, the Hilton blocked a bit of the bay view, but I can't fault the Omni for Hilton building a hotel there. The train/trolley noise that other people have mentioned didn't bother us at all, and we didn't once notice it in the middle of the night. The location was fantastic, close to shopping, restaurants, night clubs... so much to do in the Gaslamp. A little tip, try the veggie nachos at Maryjane's, a coffeeshop/restaurant on 5th, attached to the Hard Rock. Sooooo good!! The only downside we experienced AT ALL was that one of the window shutters on the bathroom didn't really like staying closed, but that's a very minor inconvenience compared to all of the positives. All of the staff was incredibly helpful, and very friendly, we would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “What a Letdown”
Reviews.Author: icyclops
