Reviews.Content: I don't understand why this hotel gets such good reviews here. I reserved a BayView room and even paid extra for this experience. What I got was a view of the train yard and the big Hilton in front of the bay. This hotel is really too far away to have a bayview, even on the 12th floor you really didn't see much but Hilton, convention center, train yard and a thin strip of ocean water out on the horizon. The rooms were a good size, but were noisy from the trolleys running most of the night...plus the bed was so uncomfortable and the pillows put a kink in my wife's neck. The bar closed down early at 10:30 when we arrived and the hotel was dead. I know they can't change their location, but a bar closed at 10:30? They should not mislead people on their website into thinking that this place has nice Bayviews, as it doesn't. The good reviews here must be for a different Hotel than what I stayed at...as I was not impressed and checked out early.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: HelenIMelbourne
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and niece stayed here just before Christmas. We spent 5 weeks in the USA (west and east coasts) and this was the best hotel we stayed in. The room was spacious, comfortable, clean and had a beautiful view of the harbour. Staff were always very friendly and had a smile and kind words on our return to the hotel every day. Check-in and out not a problem. Only negative comment is that we were woken on the first few nights by the loud and incessant horn from the nearby train track/ trolley line. Once we got used to the sound (around 2 nights), it was easier to get back to sleep straight away. Maybe a room facing away from the train line would eliminate this problem but then you would miss the beautiful harbour view. Would definitely stay with Omni again - wish we had them in Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and rates”
Reviews.Author: wavewatcher123
Reviews.Content: We went here because we had great rates, and it was also in a good location, right next to Petco Park, although we weren't going to an event there. The hotel was upscale, concierge very helpful, rooms nicely appointed. We parked in the lot across the street. Lots of restaurants within walking distance. We even walked to Horton Plaza one day. A very pleasant stay. Very convenient to have McCormick and Schmick Restaurant in the lobby. If you joined their Omni "club" internet was free, plus other amenities. Join before you go!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: Calmity72
Reviews.Content: We undertook a recent whistle-stop tour of Las Vegas and California and stayed in 6 hotels in total and by far this was our favourite. The Omni brand, for us is consistently good in terms of location, quality, and service. What stood them out from the out from the crowd (Hilton, Marriott etc) is the customer select programme which stops the entire cross selling the other chains do. As a select guest each morning we were promptly delivered some free juice and coffee which is a nice bonus. The best thing, for us, was that as a select guess we had fee internet access. We don’t need to be connected to the net constantly but it’s great for a quick check to see, for example, what time the Zoo opened, best voted restaurants in the area ect ... so was a real bonus. The Omni San Diego is in a great part of the town with great transport links - tram at the door basically and taxis are plentiful and inexpensive (taxi to the zoo - $12). Enjoyed my stay and would choose the Omni brand over the Hilton/Marriott all day long. One wee criticism - the concierge was a bit patronising - but everyone else was really helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Softball trip 2009”
Reviews.Author: Gman365
Reviews.Content: Awesome location in the gaslamp district. Hoel isvery nice and modern. Kids loved the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Gaslamp Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Jluchico
Reviews.Content: Request a room with a view of the Bay, clean comfortable rooms. 15-30 min away from most attractions, a CAR is a must!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: GSKorelys
Reviews.Content: We got a great holiday rate at the Omni - buy one night, receive the other 1/2 off! I was thrilled with the hotel, and based on our two-night stay in San Diego, we will definitely be staying there again (and looking to stay at Omnis in other cities we visit!) The bed was so comfortable. The staff was responsive, friendly, and helpful. We weren't impressed with the dessert menu that room service ordered, so we called down to McCormick and Schmick's, and they boxed up some of their famous desserts for us instead (I recommend the chocolate box). The room was spacious and stocked with necessities -- coffee, toiletries, sewing kit, magazines, etc. The minibar prices weren't totally outrageous, but they have the same stuff downstairs in Morsels. They were even thoughtful enough to put earplugs in the nightstand for the train noise. I would only change a few things about the bathroom - the sliding door was neat and a good way to save space, but the gap was about 2'' even when the door was shut. There was also no fan in the bathroom, which I thought was a weird omission. Whoever designed the bathrooms did a genius job with the shelving, there was plenty of space to stash my collection of beauty products. If you stay here, park 1/2 block up the street for $8 instead of the $30 charged by the valet. The valet attendants were very accommodating, letting us unload the car so I could check in while my husband parked at the garage. Our view from the 11th floor was fantastic. It's close to everything. I'd recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Modern comfort and elegance, wonderful service, in downtown San Diego high-rise.”
Reviews.Author: washbrol
Reviews.Content: Located in the southern parts of San Diego's Gaslamp district, not far from the water's edge or the Padre's baseball stadium, the Omni occupies a fairly new modern glass skyscraper where one finds luxurious comfort, space and modern touches in each guestroom. The service was fantastic, as I've found at all Omni's in California, with professionals trained to care about the guest's Omni experience. Polite, informative, friendly. The room was complete with a large fresh bathroom with luxury toiletries. The furnishing in the bedroom included dark woods, fresh soft new linens and blankets, modern entertainment system electronics and an amazing view out into the sky of San Diego, many floors above the bustling nightlife of the Gaslamp District. Sexy, romantic, exhilarating. Fantastic breakfast room service, with top quality coffee, juice, pastries and fruit.

Reviews.Title: “OMNI corporate - great. OMNI San Diego - not so much.”
Reviews.Author: Hootiemcfly
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was really nice. The bed was very comfortable and the thermostat was adjustable down to about 64 degrees. I was in town for a week and requested a mini fridge and microwave. The microwave was stone age and complicated. The mini fridge had a busted shelf and held almost nothing. I was told by corporate that my request for these items (phoned in weeks ahead) was in and would be waiting for me. I spoke to someone at the San Fransisco OMNI who was very helpful. When I got there neither item was in my room. I requested a high room with a view. I got a low room with a view of the parking garage next door but was moved after a few nights up to the 19th floor with a nice view. The housekeeping staff were excellent, best people in the hotel. Here's the worst part - the parking. When there's a Padres game you can forget about paying less than $20 to park your car. The garage under the hotel is not accessible by hotel guests, only valet which costs $30 a night. The garage RIGHT ACROSS THE STREET is cheaper, but you can't get in during most games. The valet guys will charge you $30 to park your car in there. It's ridiculous. Forget about street parking. Great walking distance to lots of restaurants and shops and bars. I enjoyed my one week business trip to San Diego but I'd never stay so far downtown or at that OMNI again. Nightmare on a few fronts, great on others.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: kobeeight
Reviews.Content: LOVE this hotel!!! Staying here and going to a Padre's game is a MUST!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel next to Petco Park”
Reviews.Author: victorcherd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni for 3 nights (Sun-Wed), and it's a really nice hotel. The hotel is next to Petco Park, Convention Center, and Gaslamp District. Since I stayed during a quiet weekdays, the hotel was pretty quiet, but I can imagine it being busy when there is a game at Petco Park or a convention across the street. The room is standard comfortable like any 4.0-4.5 star hotel. Housekeeping kept our room clean everyday, and the valets are very nice. The fitness room is very clean, but the pool/jacuzzi area is a bit small for my standard. I would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Nice Rooms - Stay away from Convention Center Side!”
Reviews.Author: jjmegantravel
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights at the Omni and was very impressed with the service. Everyone from the bellman to the registration staff and even housekeeping were very pleasant and helpful. Found the room nice- sign up for Omni points (for free) and get great benefits - free Internet, turn down service, and free pressing! My one caution - do not stay on the side facing the convention center. There is a large train that comes by between Midnight and 2am and blows its horn most nights. Very loudly, echoing off the building and the convention center. I should have suspected something when I saw the handy earplugs in the nightstand (of course, how does one wear earplugs and get up on time for work, I wonder).

Reviews.Title: “A grateful shout-out to the parking valets”
Reviews.Author: Forest20851
Reviews.Content: I was at the Omni just over 48 hours, and I spent most of the time going in and out. I became almost dependent on the parking valets who all turned out to be pleasant and helpful people. I couldn't have done this trip without their efficiency. When I asked my travel service for a booking, I wanted to be close to the interstates, to the airport, and to downtown. To be at the foot of the Gaslight District and yet between the convention center and the baseball stadium was way, way over the top convenient -- though it made for some tricky traffic situations. I mainly used my 15th floor room's desk and Wifi when I was in, and I was pleased by the quiet up there even though there were planned events going on most of the time I was there. And even with guests arriving in gowns and formal wear, the valets got my car quickly and got me dispatched when I needed to go out. My only problem came when I checked out at 5am Monday morning in order to catch a 7am flight. I decided to pay my bill with cash, and the hotel's billing computer and an inexperienced clerk couldn't make it work. My long stay at check-out brought out both the local hotel manager -- and then hotel security to see what was going on. When I got outside 20 minutes later, a smiling parking valet had my rental car there with my keys in his hand (worth a *big* tip :-) . Nevertheless, I have **nothing but good things** to say about the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Comprable to Best Western”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryLinens
Reviews.Content: if I hadn't booked through Priceline, I'd be totally furious. The Omni has scratchy sheets, similar to bargain chains. The basin in the sink had a huge crack and I'm guessing it has been that way for a while. When we were leaving, there were four doorman standing together nearby who ignored us in unison. As my companion pointed out, at least at bargain hotels, there's be only one door person to ignore the patrons. Also, valet parking is $30 - or $8 across the street for self parking. My recommendation: Do NOT pay full price for this hotel. You'll be sadly disappointed if you do.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value”
Reviews.Author: sjb68
Reviews.Content: OK, I was a Priceline traveler, so those who pay in full might not share my enthusiasm. But I was not singled out as a Priceline traveler. I was even allowed to enter my Omni laylaty program number, which gave me a) free WiFi, b) free beverage every morning and c) a choice of newspapers - free. The room was big, right at the edge of the Gaslamp quarter, right on the other side of the tracks of the convention center. Cheerful employees. Ear buds for the odd train at night. What more could one ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Smoking rooms. Oohh it stank!”
Reviews.Author: juliogulio
Reviews.Content: I requested a non-smoking room. They didn't have any left and forced me to stay in a non-smoking room. Ughh! For this kind of money, you would expect more.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff who really care”
Reviews.Author: kwanghui
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni San Diego for around a week while I attended a conference. It doesn't have the flashy new building which the Hilton does across the street, but it is the one we would definitely prefer to stay in. The moment we arrived we were greeted by friendly and helpful staff. The rooms are clean and comfortable and it is conveniently located across from the convention center and Gaslamp district. The staff are exceptional: friendly and professional. During our week there, we were constantly impressed on how the little things were done well. Sign up online for their Select program and your stay includes free wifi, beverages in the morning, and newspapers. Very nice touches. The room had wired and wireless internet with stable and fast connections, and important consideration if you're on a work trip. There are a couple of negatives, the first being poor “smell insulation” from the bathroom to the bedroom (separated by an “open concept” wooden panel, not a wall), and the second being poor sound insulation between rooms. For example, during the initial part of our stay, we had an issue because the guests next door decided to hold all night parties throughout the weekend. To be fair, this was not a fault of the hotel that some of their guests were unruly. On the second night we phoned to complain (thrice!!) between 1am and 3am in the morning. The hotel promptly sent up the security guard, and later the manager. The next morning, the hotel staff reassigned us to a quieter, nicer room (thank you) and the night manager even sent a handwritten letter to apologise. Later I learnt that they decided not to rent out our room for another few days, till the noisy guests had left. The responsiveness of the staff and their good service really stood out for us. We will definitely be back to stay at the Omni the next time we're in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Omni!”
Reviews.Author: Dominici
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed everything about the Omni. We were on the 20th floor with a corner room overlooking the city and the ocean. The room was fantastic and we really couldn't have asked for more. We have stayed in other boutique style hotels, but unfortunately the noise level at those were a bit too much, especially on a weekend. Here, we couldn't hear the noise at all. The location was perfect for walking around the Gaslamp District. The people were so helpful and nice and the overall feel was very welcoming. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is a real Gem with great Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: MickyEssex
Reviews.Content: My Wife Myself, & our Handicapped Son stayed at this hotel and had a wonderful time here. The Hotel is a real gem, with brilliant Staff who go the extra mile to help guests and make your stay a great one. Give this hotel a try and you won't be dissapointed. Ask for Charles he is a great Guy and will look after you.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Location, Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: mlms1206
Reviews.Content: The Omni is in a GREAT location, right in the Gaslamp District. It's actually attached to Petco Field. You can walk to tons of restaurants and shops. The rooms are nice (this is my 2nd time staying here.) I was upgraded to a suite, but would have actually preferred a room with a balcony. My suite had an adjoining room, which I could hear the people staying in that room early in the morning. Beds are super comfy and the service was good as well. Overall, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: LIJNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: Went to San Diego for a kid-free getaway. We got a great deal through Priceline and just loved the Omni! We were able to check in a 10am and our room was great. One of the blinds in our room wouldn't open and someone was there to fix it within 10min of us calling. The pool area is beautiful-we actually spent an afternoon just relaxing there. The location of the Omni is ideal for dining out and enjoying nightlife. We were in town for 5 days and used the trolley and buses with no problem. It's very convenient that the trolley stop is just outside of the hotel. Be sure to sign up for their Preferred Guest program (it's free). You get a free coffee and juice per person and newspaper delivered to your room each morning!

Reviews.Title: “great location connect to petco park”
Reviews.Author: jeferyw
Reviews.Content: can not beat location at the bottom of the gas lamp and across from the bay.... new modern hotel with a great happy hour at the pool. park across the street for $16 instead of the $32 valet.

Reviews.Title: “classy joint”
Reviews.Author: bertus09
Reviews.Content: We walked in and they took care of of us from the start. It was a busy marathon weekend, but they didn't allow it to bog them down. The rooms were nice. The pool area was beautiful. Great view of Petco park out our window. The bar downstairs was well stocked and quiet enough to talk to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great service and great location”
Reviews.Author: sgupta38
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, great service and great location - what else do you want? Got this hotel from priceline for $76 a night. Requested room upgrade at check-in and they were nice enough to accommodate my request. Beautiful view, free in-room coffee and great location. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Omni Is Our New Favourite Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Michelyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni San Diego while we were in California for our honeymoon. We chose Omni based on tripadvisor reviews and its location in the Gaslamp District. After reading the tripadvisor reviews we signed up to be Omni Select Guest members prior to our trip and I am glad we did. They provided us with a card to fill out for our coffee/juice/newspaper choices we would like brought to our room in the morning. It also allowed us to choose our room preference, bedding and pillow preferences prior to our stay. Definately worth signing up for. We were upgraded to a corner suite which overlooked Petco Park on one side and the Water on the other. We were on the 12th floor and also looked right below to the 6th floor pool and restaurant. The room was beautiful. It consisted of a living room with desk and tv, and a separate bedroom with tv. The bathroom had huge windows and a great sink/vanity - the only thing I would have changed was to have a seperate tub and shower. We had indicated on our select guest profile that the Omni was the first hotel on our California honeymoon and the staff were very quick to offer their congratulations. They provided us with the suite upgrade and later on in the evening sent us a congratulatory note and a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. A very wonderful gesture that we will remember from our honeymoon. The location of the hotel is right at the entrance to the Gaslamp District and everything we needed was within walking distance. We ate at the Tin Fish next door to the hotel for lunch and then Toscana Wine Bar for dinner - both fantastic. The hotel only offers Valet parking for $30 night, but we parked directly across the street form the Omni in a parking garage for $12 overnight. It was very convenient. Overall we had a fantastic stay at the Omni and it will come highly recommended by us, the staff, the facilities and the customer service was amazing. I

Reviews.Title: “great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: tdunk0926
Reviews.Content: we booked our hotel through pricline so I called to verify our reservation and request a king bed when I called I spoke to Gloria and our reservation hadn't posted yet so I told her I would call back later when I did the reservation was there and Gloria had already taken care of my request when we checked Gloria had make a note we were celebrating my husbands birthday so they sent champagne, chocolate, & fruit to our room with a note signed by everyone they gave us a room with a great view of Coronado Island and a balcony we received free turn down service a beverage and a newspaper every morning the hotel is just a block from the gaslight district which had so many restaurants to choose from the staff was great and helpful with any questions we had the only negative thing in the room was the bathroom it has shutters on each side of the sink so anyone outside the bathroom can hear everything going on in the bathroom the parking at the hotel is expensive but there is a garage right across the street that is reasonable we would recommend this hotel to anyone going to San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Great location for family”
Reviews.Author: seablu
Reviews.Content: We arrived by Amtrak and took a 5 minute taxi ride to our hotel. Check-in was fast. In our room, we were greeted with some chocolates and a bottle of champagne. This was a nice b-day surprise. Our room also had the over powering smell of room freshener. We turned on air and opened our window as far as it would go. I thought the maid must have been a bit generous with the spray. Our room had 2 double beds with great linens and a comfortable bed. We were traveling with our 2 sons and other than the beds being double(Queens are always better in this situation!) the room was a nice size. We left our room to get dinner. It was a short walk into the gaslamp district. After a couple of hours we returned to our room. We then figured out why the room smelled like it did. Someone had smoked in a non -smoking room. We are always sure to request non-smoking. The smell was VERY strong. I went down to the front desk to ask for a room change. We were told one was not available that nite. There was a convention and they were full. I asked if we could pay the difference and move to a suite. A manager walked up and said the only other room that was open had a murphy bed and would not hold 4. The next nite they could move us, but the room would not have a view or be available until the afternoon. I asked for a fan or something else to help with the smell. They sent up housekeeping with a small glass jar filled with scented oil and bamboo sticks. It didn't do a thing. By the next afternoon, the smell was better, or maybe we were just used to it. We were gone all day shopping and siteseeing. Late that afternoon they said a room was available. It overlooked the pool area where a loud reception was going on. By now we thought we would just stay in our room. We went to a Padres game. Inside the Padre Logo shop at the back, was a cage area where we watched the teams warming up. A manager on the Padres tossed a ball over the fence to one of my sons. This made his trip! We found an area where Kevin Kouzmanov -3rd base- was signing autograghs. He now has 4 new fans! The stadium has an easy access to the hotel. The fitness center in the hotel was the best I have ever seen. Lots of modern machines, circuit training, free weights, personal TV's with headphones, towels, shower, etc. Spotless and not crowded. The pool area was small, crowded, noisy, and had a man smoking a cigar. We couldn't escape the smoke anywhere. (We have gotten spoiled by non smoking areas) There is a nice happy hour at the hotel resturaunt. Food was great, service was slow. We were sitting outside so that may have been the problem. Because we did not have a car, we walked everywhere. Even down to the Star of India. Shopping, eating and entertainment were all close by, safe and easy to walk to. I would return to this hotel in spite of our bad luck with the smoking smell. Hotel staff was great with recommendations. Bell service was especially fast and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasCindy
Reviews.Content: On the surface this seems like a nice hotel, but they falter when it comes to the little things. My biggest complaint is that the walls are too thin. I could hear the guy in the room next door snoring all night. I could hear the water running anytime anyone around me took a shower. The information in the room was outdated and wrong. Items in my room were dusty. As much as I paid to stay there, I expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Stay”
Reviews.Author: jrcc1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for 2 nights. The service from check in to check out was great, friendly and professional. The rooms were very nicely appointed. The bathrooms were very nice as well. I loved that the tub had a curved shower rod to prevent the attack of the curtain. I took the advice of the other travelers and joined the free Omni club. We received the coffee/tea and freshly squeezed juice in the morning at a time that we selected. It was nice to be able to add a muffin, bagel, or english muffin for less than $3. Our view was awesome - we could see both the city and the water. We usually choose small boutique hotels when we travel for a more resort type experience. But, this hotel was very nice and did not disappoint us. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: filosab
Reviews.Content: Stayed this past Saturday night, thanks to an amazing deal on priceline! The rooms are small, but so nice. Great decor, color scheme, bed, linens, lighting. Wonderful bathroom, really nice. The service was wonderful checking in and out, all around wonderful service. Went to the Padres game Sunday, and they held our bags. Free street parking after 6:00 pm on Saturday and all day Sunday, so you can't beat a Saturday stay over. Would definitely stay again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: redoctober30
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night (a Saturday). The location is great - steps to Petco Park (with a private entrance!), Gaslamp district, convention center and trolley station. I took the advice I read here and joined the Omni Select Guest free program before booking. I recommend doing that, as in addition to the free a.m. beverages, pressings, wifi, they upgraded my room! I booked the basic room, but we got a gorgeous room on the 19th floor with water and city views and a balcony. The room was very clean and stylish with a gorgeous, spacious bathroom. The staff was very friendly. We did not eat at any of the hotel's restaurants, but did go next door to Tin Fish (great food and beers) and had breakfast down the street at Broken Yolk (good breakfast food but service was a bit spotty). I recommend the Omni San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: SwanseaBmb
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Omni for 2 nights at the end of a coastal road trip. Hotel was lovely, rooms excellent and spacious, pool area was very luxurious, and free drinks in the morning through the select guest programme were a nice touch. Hotel looks over the padres stadium - great view from the 20th floor. Short walk to gaslamp quarter which has lots of great bars and restaurants. Highly recommend this hotel which was a great end to our holiday. Park accross the street for £8.00 a night rather than paying $30.00 valet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service with Average Room”
Reviews.Author: Off-Season_Traveller
Reviews.Content: After doing a lot of research for a hotel for my wife's birthday, my first choice in San Diego was The Omni. Much of that was based on the most recent Tripadvisor reviews. However the website price was high, so for the first time I went to Priceline, as their 4* hotels were coming in around $70/night in San Diego. I was thrilled when I got to $71 and my bid was accepted by The Omni. I knew going in that valet parking would add another $30 (plus tips for each pickup) per day. This was much less than half the hotel's online rate for their lowest class of room. We checked into the hotel and the first thing I noticed was how helpful the many staff were. Although I knew the smart advice was to park in the garage across the street, it was the evening after a long day and figured that we'd valet the first night and park it ourselves after. When we got to our room on the 11th floor, the first thing I noticed was that it looked like an older hotel that had gone through a remodel. From outside you can see what appears to be old hotel and new addition. We were in the shorter, older part. A remodel doesn't bother me, however it's the how they did it that made me question the 4 or 5 star rating of this hotel. The bathroom was made larger, which is a good thing, however they used open slats into the rest of the room for some reason. There are two of them - one on each side of the freestanding sink and the two sliding doors (that don't quite meet together right) have them too. If you want, you can adjust them to see straight in (and out) of the bathroom from the rest of the room. The major downside of this is that all the sounds and smells of a bathroom will be shared even if the slats are turned down. The closet couldn't be closed without making a racket that could likely be heard in the neighboring room. We could hear many sounds from other rooms, which due to proximity to the gaslamp district, happened around 2:00 - 3:00AM. They came from many directions as we were in the middle of the floor. We did get the Select Guest benefits which included a nice beverage service and free internet, although we didn't use the internet much during this stay. For the price we paid, the hotel was what we would expect - the high point being the courteous and helpful staff. But had we paid regular online rates, I would have been severely disappointed. There are too many other nice hotels downtown to go out of my way to stay at The Omni again. I'd take a chance on Priceline again, so I wouldn't know what I'm getting. But I can't expect it to be any worse at any of the other (Priceline rated) 4* hotels.

Reviews.Title: “The best!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dsallen74
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Omni for two nights and our stay was FANTASTIC! Every single person that works in that hotel have a genuine smile on their faces and they are very helpful. Check in was super fast, they also got us 2 free breakfasts at M&S. We signed up for the select guest program and we had the free beverages every morning and free hi speed internet. We paid the military rate which was $147.00 free of taxes and I thought that was great! Location is fantastic too...great views and good time by the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mailcommando
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni San Diego for two nights at the beginning of August 09. We were blown away by the service at this hotel. This was our first time staying at an Omni Hotel but it certainly won't be our last. The hotel is located in the Gaslamp district which makes it ideal for strolling through the various shops and eateries along the street. It is also connected via a sky bridge to Petco Park which makes it perfect for fans going to a Padres game. The trolley stops nearby and the convention center is across the street. Its also about a 20 minute walk from where the cruise ships dock as well as where harbor tours depart. The hotel itself is superb. With our room we had a king size bed, flat screen TV, nice-sized bathroom and a lovely view of the San Diego skyline. We signed up for the Omni Select Guest program which gave us a complimentary bottle of water on our arrival as well as complimentary morning beverages each day of our stay. Very nice and FREE! Be sure to sign up! The hotel also has a business center, pool, fitness center, and a restaurant. The staff were very accomodating too. We had an early check out and requested our morning beverage be delivered at 4am. Not a problem. We can't wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “I'm never staying anywhere else now when I go to San Diego”
Reviews.Author: countindayz
Reviews.Content: Wow! I just returned from a business trip in San Diego where I stayed at the Omni and I just was blown away by what an incredbile place this is. - The hotel itself is beautiful from top to bottom. - The service can't be beat, every single person there goes out of their way to make your stay nicer...they make you feel like you are the only one that matters and they spoil you. - The location is perfect - The valet parking is the best I've ever had, never had to wait for my car. The guys are great, especially wonderful Joe! He taught me some great short cuts in San Diego saving me valuable time and gave great recommendations on things to do. - The people at the front desk were the ultimate professionals that handled a real sticky situation with such grace and dignity. They went above and beyond the call of duty for me and it was truly appreciated. - The daily cleaning service was the best I've ever had, both in cleaning the room and in the nightly turndown service. - The business center was outstanding with brand new equipment that actually works and it was open 24 hours a day...a nice touch! - The fitness room is the best I've ever had, very up to date and well equiped. Its also open 24 hours a day. - The pool was first class....the fireplace that is shared between the pool and lounge area was awesome. They serve you drinks and food - felt better then the Loew's hotels! - Even the hotel engineering service was unbeatable. They had to fix my a/c in my room. They were there in three minutes, had it fixed within 30 minutes and the man was so very nice and polite. - Noice level - was worried about the train tracks and hearing my neighbors after reading one of the reviews here. I heard neither. I slept like a baby! - Most of all, I felt completely safe as a woman traveling alone here. In summary, I travel a great deal for my job and am on a mission to find the best hotels for business travelers. I have found the best one in the city of San Diego - its the Omni. I look for a good fitness room, a nice outdoor pool to get some sunshine after being in meetings all day, good service, a quiet hotel, a safe to stay hotel with good security and lighting and a good business center. The Omni has it all and they do it right. I am beyond impressed and look forward to staying here every time I come to San Diego. Thanks, Omni!! Business travelers need

Reviews.Title: “For baseball and downtown action this place is the best!!!”
Reviews.Author: joebobeo
Reviews.Content: My wife and two boys have been coming to the Omni San Diego since it opened back in 2004. We are Padre season ticket holders and we enjoy doing a 'staycation' every year here in San Diego. People come from all over the country to vacation where we live and we pick the Omni every year when we stay home. Yes, the pool is small, but we don't stay here for the pool. We stay because of the view, the staff, the rooms, the location, the location and the location. When you can walk across a private bridge into the ball park and also walk to just about any great type of restaurant in town, this place is the best. The way you know tha this is such a great place is because we have seen the same staff at this hotel since it opened. Be sure to say hi to the head Bell Captain, David, because they don't come any nicer than this man...we hope you stay for a long time! We are select guest members at Omni and that was why we stayed at the Omni in DC. From coast to coast this hotel chain is great. Janelle you did a wonderful job taking care of us while we were there. If you are coming to San Diego and are looking for a great place to stay, this is your spot!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay for a Ballgame!”
Reviews.Author: nadavena
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly. Upon arrival, they upgraded us to a mini suite with an adjoining room as this was the only thing available where we could have adjoining rooms since we were traveling with family. The rooms were nicely appointed, clean, and well stocked. We loved the turn down service which came with cookies, milk and a bottle water. They have morning beverage service and a newspaper; which we didn't take advantage of as we forgot to put our request on our door the night before. These are a few of the perks of being an Omni member! :) However, with that being said we did have a few issues with the hotel. First, the television set in the master bedroom, had a control cover panel that was broken and coming off. The couch in the living room area, had a very large tear in the front cushion. Also, the sink basin in the master bathroom had several cracks. Then there was the stripping on the outside of the hotel that was loose and dangling down in front of the bedroom window. There was wind during the night which caused it to bang against the window. We didn't get a very good night sleep because of it. We had an issue with the room service. We had place a breakfast order and after waiting for over an hour, we had called down to find out where our order was and learned that it had been delivered to a different room. They did offer not to charge us for the order and delivered it within 5-10 minutes. The food was hot and delicious; but there was no salt and pepper on the tray... we needed this for our eggs and hashbrowns. Even with this issues, we will definitely stay here again as staff were quick to remedy the room service problem and the other items were just minor things in the overall picture.The room, overall cleanliness, and other amenities exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - very small pool”
Reviews.Author: SeichanG
Reviews.Content: We picked the Omni based on the excellent reviews we saw at Trip Advisor, the rate, and the location. The hotel is new and modern and the location is great. It is located at the end of the Gaslamp district and it is walking distance to any of the downtown attraction. The room is large, clean, and comfortable. The only thing a bit disappointing about the hotel was how small the pool is. We wanted to spend a day relaxing by the pool. For a hotel with over 500 rooms, the pool is tiny. We went up to the pool at around 4 PM and could not get lounge chairs. There were probably a total of 30 lounge chairs at the most. There was one jacuzzi pool that fit only 8 people. We will pick this hotel again in the future if we do not plan to use the pool. It still has great location and good value.

Reviews.Title: “modern, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: greenhappiness
Reviews.Content: I was a little tentative after reading some reviews complaining of noise. I did not encounter any noise problem and had a great stay. I listened to Trip Advisor reveiwers who suggested parking across the street and I ended up saving alot of money.Thanks!!! The rooms were modern and clean, the beds comfortable and the service second to none. Remember to sign up for the select guest program to receive free internet and beverages.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Great Views”
Reviews.Author: lululouise
Reviews.Content: I just returned from San Diego this afternoon and stayed at the Omni with my mom. The hotel is beautiful with great access to Petco Park. I know that some of the reviews stated that the valet parking is expensive ($30 per night) but if there is a Padres game, it's worth paying the fee. The staff were wonderful and being a Select Guest is nice, too. Our room was on the 19th floor with a great view of the water. I will definitely stay there again when I return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay during Comic-Con”
Reviews.Author: Vracev
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Omni during Comic-Con. I didn't want to brave the traffic, so I took the Amtrak train down to San Diego, then hopped the trolley, which stops right next to the hotel. Worked out perfectly! The hotel check-in process was a breeze, and I have to say all the front desk guys were really cute! My room was fabulous—it was high enough that it was nice and quiet. Room service was fast and met my expectations. All in all, I'd recommend this hotel and hope I can book early enough to stay there even longer next year.

Reviews.Title: “Omni comes through again for Priceline customers”
Reviews.Author: Pricelinejunkie00
Reviews.Content: Celebrating an anniversary...secured a $95 bid through Priceline the day before comic con comes to town. Unreal king suite with views of the bay and the ballpark. Fantastic pool setting with terrific lunch options. Staff gave great tips on getting good seats for the Padres game. Even gave me a tip on where to stand during batting practice, and I came back with a homer hit right to me. We've been to other chains that treat Priceline as second rate, but never at the Omni (both San Diego and DC.) Going to comic con tomorrow to suggest that the Omni staff star in their own comic book!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixBanshee
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff at check-in, top-notch concierge, absolutely gorgeous room overlooking Petco Field. I didn't want to leave! The 6th floor terrace is a slice of heaven, with THE most comfortable chenille lounge furniture I've ever encountered. Anyone who worked there could not do enough for us! I only wish the pool was adults-only so we could have enjoyed that wonderful terrace without having to listen to screaming and splashing. Also, the room service is ridiculously expensive, they charge a room-service fee as well as a delivery charge....those with a tip you can expect to add $20 on to your room service bill for nothing. Those two things aside, we will definitely stay at the Omni again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: alexsw1
Reviews.Content: I don't have too much to add to the comments below... first, when you book this hotel sign up for select guest - it's free and you get free wifi, coffee/tea/juice delivered to your room each morning, two items pressed for free and more. I particularly liked that I could choose very specific room prefs on select guest and then on arrival, despite booking on priceline.com (about $70 per night), I got all that I asked for. Having said that, don't book a bay-view room unless you don't mind that train. We were in 1505 and while a stunning room, the trains were annoying at times. There was a comment below about feeling obliged to tip - perhaps because I'm not American I'm immune but I certainly didn't think everyone wanted a tip every time I turned a corner (well, no more so than anywhere else in America). I did leave a tip for the concierge who was very helpful. Parking - definitely don't use their parking at $30 per day - they park in the multi story car park across the street which you can use too for $8 per day (we paid $13 one day for leaving it for about 24 hours). There is some on-street parking but it's hard to come by.

Reviews.Title: “great room with sloppy staff at a way too high price.”
Reviews.Author: Csabatje
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in the Omni for a week while on a conference. The (simple) 15th floor room was excellent, beautiful inside, nice sea view, clean, large, and the hotels' location is as good as it gets. Bed huge, comfortable, bathroom great, big windows. However, the staff was quite bored and unfriendly. Here's a small strange story. Reserved with a credit card with first night prepayment, however when i got there the lady at the front desk wanted me to pay immediately for the whole period. Maybe it's normal there but it ain't normal anywhere else! Moreover, she wanted to charge my CC the full sum which was well over my CC daily limit (without consulting me about it). Then she didn't want to believe i have only one card. Then she advised me to go and get cash at their ATM, "and pay as much as you can". Turned out, the ATM is out of order. I had to go across the streets to the Petco stadion and withdraw 1000 bucks which was the daily limit on the card...my pockets bulging with 20$ bills, go back to the hotel and bear with their funny-face while counting the cash. Of course wasn't still enough at twohundred-something $ per day so i got twice reminded in the week that I still need to pay. I got a reduced group rate, maybe that's why they were not so friendly...?(full rate is around $500! ) At this price one would expect breakfast included, wireless or at least wired internet for free, ...nope. Only a very fancy roll of toilet paper (see photo). The restaurant downstairs is very fancy looking but just so-so foodwise. Airco in room rather noisy. All in all, go there only if you are definitely not on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “BEST Hotel EVER!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Spikey1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the BEST hotel our family has ever been in, hands down!!!! Right when we arrived the hotel staff handed my 2 children (10 & 8) huge "goodie bags" filled with all sorts of fun things. We stayed on the 14th floor with a corner room which had 2 VERY large windows. One view of the fabulous city and the other of Petco Park. My kids loved watching the fans go by from a huge window seat inside our room. The room was very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. I am a light sleeper and usually have a hard time sleeping in hotel rooms, but I slept like a baby at this lovely hotel. I noticed the trains outside, but NEVER heard them at night??? The bathroom was nice and had lots of complimentary items, but we also had trouble hanging up our towels? No hooks or bar racks? Every morning before heading out to one of the sights (Legoland, Sea World, Zoo) we would visit the fitness center on the 6th floor and fill our water bottles up with fresh, ice cold lemon water. This helped quench our thirst during the long day walking around the parks. Much better than plain water!!! We also saved money on the parking lot across the street. Tons of restaurants all around the hotel and all within walking distance. Due to a problem with Priceline, we had to check into a different hotel after staying 4 wonderful nights at the Omni. We moved into the Grand Hyatt for our last night of our stay and we were sadly disappointed. We could see the Omni from the Hyatt and were ALL homesick for our former residence.

Reviews.Title: “Very very nice!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jael
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. Our wedding night and the next night. We are from Tijuana, B.C., Mexico and got married there on a Saturday and we were going to fly for our honeymoon on Monday from SD, so we crossed the border after our wedding. We booked the cheapest room, since we didn’t want to spend our money here but in the honeymoon, but we did write on the comments from the reservation that it was our wedding night, so… when we got there they gave us one of the best rooms available. It was amazing. By far, that’s the best hotel I’ve ever stayed in. It was beautiful. Location: Is located right next to the Petco park, it actually has a bridge to go there specially made for guests who want to go to the games. It’s in Downtown SD, in front of the Convention Center, and like 4 blocks away from Horton Plaza. It was only like 10 bucks for the taxi to takes us to the airport, it’s very near. There are tons of restaurants around the hotel. Room: It was amazing. They upgraded our room to a corner one in the 14th floor, so we had two walls of windows. The bed was super comfortable. It’s super clean. The carpet was very nice and new (well… the hotel was new). The bathroom was big and nice. There is a shower and a tub. Very spacious. We had a desk and a chair, along with flowers. It had a big closet with a safe, hangers and bag for dry clean and laundry. Lobby: Very big and beautiful. I don’t remember a lot of the lobby but it was nice. Right in front of the hotel you catch a taxi; they are always parked in the front. Service: Very good. As I said, they upgraded us to a better room which was nice. They also gave us Moet & Chandon champagne because it was our wedding night. When we made our reservation we said we would get there by 2 am, and we actually did like at 4 am. As soon as we entered the lobby the receptionist asked us how was our wedding and congratulated us!!!! He knew it was us! (No, I was not wearing my wedding dress anymore). We thought that was a very nice touch. We ordered pizza from room service and it was AMAZING, it was very good, and it only took them like 20 minutes to make it, even though it was like 5 am! We didn’t even have to go check out; there was an envelope on the door with our receipt. Very nice! I totally recommend this hotel, if you are there for a special occasion like your honeymoon, let them know!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: OCragazza
Reviews.Content: My 2 night stay at the Omni seems to be on par with the majority of the reviewers. Positive: 1. Excellent Location in Gaslamp District. Plenty of great restaurants within walking distance (we ate at La Strada, Blue Coastal Seafood and MaryJane in Hard Rock Hotel - all located on 5th Street - we high recommend all three!). The convention center is across the street and there's a walkway connected to Petco Stadium. The Westfield mall is about 10 minute walk. 2. Signing up for the Guest Select program is a definite must - Free beverages in the morning, pressing of clothes and internet access definitely put this hotel a step above other hotels that will charge you for these. Of note - The coffee and orange juice we had each morning was great! The croissant we added to our beverage service (you pay about $4.00 extra) is enough to split for 2 people. 3. Another advantage of signing up for the program ahead of time is that you can customize your stay. Since we signed up beforehand, check-in was also a breeze since they had all our information on file. We pretty much said our name, the front desk handed us the key and that was it! 4. The room we had was clean and beautiful. We were on the 20th floor with a gorgeous view of the water. Negative: 1. As other reviewers mentioned, the train runs in between the hotel and convention center and does blow 3 or 4 distinct whistles as it passes through. The first morning, it woke me up at 5:45 AM and a second one later around 7:30 AM. For a very light sleeper (such as myself), it was loud enough to feel like the windows were open. However, my husband (who is a moderate sleeper) never heard anything. If you do have sleeping concerns, request a room with a view towards the city and not the water. 2. As everyone mentioned, parking at the hotel is $30.00 per night. We parked adjacent to the hotel (it's a pretty large structure right off K street...you can't miss it) which is $8.00/night on weekday and $16.00/night on weekend. The structure appears to be open 24/7 as there were attendants available when we arrived that evening at 11:00PM. I wouldn't recommend driving around if you plan to stay around the Gaslamp district and immediate surrounding areas since parking seemed to be an issue. There are plenty of taxis or people riding bicycles that offer rides if you're tired. As point of reference, a taxi ride from the hotel to the Westfield mall was about $7.00. We thought it was very safe to walk around at night as long as you keep on the main street where all the restaurants and bars are located. 3. I do agree with one reviewer that the walls are a bit thin. During my stay, the neighbors were quiet (I heard an occasional cough and when they used the restroom, it did sound like they were in the same room). However, I can definitely see where it can be unpleasant if you get noisy neighbors. 4. Although the bathroom was beautifully decorated, it wasn't well thought out in terms of where to hang your towels. There's only 1 towel holder inside the shower and two small hooks that barely held a towel. Though not really a "negative" thing in my opinion, it was a minor annoyance. If you hang a hanger (from the closet) on one of the hooks in the bathroom, that served as a pretty decent impromptu towel holder. Nevertheless, despite the "negatives," these observations did not impact our stay in a negative way. We stil had a wonderful time and look forward to staying there again the next time we need to be in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel - Bargain Price”
Reviews.Author: HouCop
Reviews.Content: I booked a room through Priceline and could not have been more pleased with the Omni Hotel in San Diego. The location is perfect and the accomodations are first-rate. I followed the advice from other TripAdvisor members and joined Omni's Select Guest program. I called the hotel a couple of days prior to my arrival and they added my Select Guest number to the reservation. When we arrived at about noon, I was pleased to be told that the room was ready -- I hadn't even asked for early check-in. The room was clean, well-appointed, and had a decent view, although it was not a bay view. My parents arrived later in the day, and had also booked on Priceline. I don't know if it was just luck of the draw but they got a room with a beautiful view of the bay. Perhaps the rooms with king beds are on the bay side of the hall and the doubles are on the other side?? With the Select Guest program we got free morning beverages and newspapers and also were able to have two items pressed for free (which was great because we were there for a wedding and I had my shirt pressed.) I also got free internet access. Other people have commented about noise from the trains or adjoining rooms. We were on the 19th floor and didn't have any noise problems. Some people have also said the "louvered" panels in the bathroom make for lack of privacy. Our room didn't have the louvered panels -- it had a large sliding glass door. It was an unusual design, but wasn't a problem. My parents' room had the louvered panels and they didn't mention any bathroom privacy problems. Their room also had a small balcony with sliding doors and sculped carpet, while our room just had a window that opened slightly. All of the staff members were very friendly and helpful. Every time I called for anything, the phone was answered on the first ring and I was greeted by name -- as cheesy as this may sound, I felt like royalty. The neighborhood has great nightlife and lots of restaurants and attractions within walking distance. Follow the tips here and self-park in the garage across the street (6th and K Parkade). Even though we came and went quite a bit, we still saved a lot vs. what valet parking would have cost. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again, especially with the bargain that I got on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Join Select Guest for Free Internet”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinVagabond
Reviews.Content: If staying at an Omni Hotel, even if you plan no further stays at Omni's, it is to your advantage to go online before your stay to join their Omni Select Guest program. You get free in-room Internet, both wireless and wired if you prefer (saves you $9.95/day). You also get a free 0.5L bottle of Evian water your first night, free morning beverages each morning (if you request coffee, you get a big pitcher full), free clothes pressing, and 500 airline miles per stay. I think I got a better room as well (19th floor view of bay). Things I liked: in-room safe was large enough to hold my laptop computer, room had DVD player on TV and CD player on radio (plus radio had input for my mp3 player), Wolfgang Puck coffee and Earl Grey tea furnished with in-room coffee maker, 2-line cordless phones, outside window actually opens a bit, floor to ceiling windows, electric trolley goes right by hotel, and you can print your airline boarding pass for free in the business center (go up escalator from lobby and turn right - on business center PC's it says there is a charge, but if you look on the very bottom of the screen there is a button to click for free access to airline sites for printing your boarding pass). Things I did not like: in addition to the nice electric trolley cars on the tracks outside your windows there are long freight trains going by - blowing their horns as early as 4AM and as late as 11PM - beware if you are a light sleeper, I requested that towels not be changed and TV not be left on after turn-down service but they did it anyway, and they failed to provide my complementary beverages on my last morning.

Reviews.Title: “Omni makes life easy”
Reviews.Author: Sofasurfer
Reviews.Content: WE just stayed from England for 5 nights as part of a 12 night SoCal trip with our 4 year old. I have been lucky enough to have stayed in many top hotels in Europe and NA when travelling with my work as well as on holiday with my husband and daughter and this Omni really ranks up there as probably one of the top 3 ever.The rooms are spacious,contemporary clean and well serviced.We had a great view. But most of all with a 4 yo the staff were fantastic - they could not do enough to help,right from check in to check out. My daughter loved the welcome pack,and - especially now we have moved to other hotels (see my other reviews!) which are not so forthcoming - the free refills and in fact first drinks in her "special cup" the hotel supplied made a huge difference.Being able to get warm milk or juice at any time for free made it so much easier.Plus the cookies in the lobby. They also charged very fairly for the food she actually ate at breakfast, as opposed to the "rack rate" of the food she chose. She loved the milk and cookies delivered the first night, and fernando the restaurant manager was brilliant.All the guests were also nice, and a real mixture of business and vacation.The only thing I could criticise, and its very minor, is that we would have preferred shower gel rather than solid soap (told you it was minor!) .The location was great and staff went out of their way.Pool was great, Select guest programme was the best loyalty program I have encountered. (and I have all the cards!) The concierge, especially Mark ,gave great advice and didnt try to sell us anything. Sadly, we probably wont have cause to visit san diego again, but on the basis of this visit I would search out Omnis every time.Just fantastic and made life so easy.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly a great experience, but a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: DMR
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight for the bed and breakfast special while at a Padre Game. Hotel is great for ballpark access and walking to Gaslamp area. Room was very comfortable and clean. Our only 2 negative comments would be that the hotel offers evening turn down service, but it was not done in our room. Also, be advised that the sound control in this building is very poor. We could hear (and were awakened by) every shower or tub that went off next door, below or above our room. It sounded loud enough to be coming from our own bathroom!!! We have stayed in many high rise upscale hotels and never experienced this kind of loud plumbing disruption. The $30 overnight parking rate is very high, so park at the lot nearby for 1/2 the price. Views are great from the higher levels.

Reviews.Title: “Wow.”
Reviews.Author: vertnyc
Reviews.Content: I'm sitting in my room on the 10th floor looking outside on downtown and it's a great view. I just did a quick workout at the gym and the facility was superb- better than Omni Hotel LA which I stayed at last night. The swimming pool was also way better. Before you check in you should request to be an Omni Select guest (for free) and then get all the complimentary stuff. I'm going to get my shoes shined and 2 articles of clothing pressed tomorrow. I learned something about the valet parking, if you really have $30 bucks to waste per day then do it. Otherwise do some research and find a nearby hotel. I found a hotel a block away called Ace parking and actually I found out that Omni Hotel basically just parks your car there. However, I'll be paying $11 tonight instead of $30. I will take the car out for the whole day tomorrow and park there at night. Anyways, I don't think you really need your car if you stay at this hotel since it's right next to the USS Midway (something I'm interested in because I'm in the service) as well as the shopping center and a whole lot of other stuff. In fact, there's music playing outside right now and it seems very upbeat, a big change from Omni Hotel LA - which in retrospect wasn't the best location for strolling around with my family. Oh, did I mention you should get the Omni Select status to get free wireless too? I'm on Day 8 of my West Coast Trip and this is the best hotel overall so far.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staying there”
Reviews.Author: drcyriac
Reviews.Content: The service was perfect. The rooms were simply fabulous. Most parts of the city were easily accessible from here. Just a 10-15 minute drive from the airport. Did not have to spend more than 2 minutes at the reception both when coming in and when leaving. Staff were most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: bratbruin
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my birthday weekend surprise from San Diego. My girlfriend booked us a room at the Omni SD in the gaslamp quarter. She has asked them for a good room with a view. The hotel hooked us up with a great room. We had a corner room on 21st floor overlooking the harbor and coronado out of our panoramic window and view of the whole gaslamp quarter the petco park out of the balcony. The hotel has great staff and were very friendly from the moment we pulled into the valet till we pulled out. The valets and the bellmen were great. Ashley at the check-in was great, she explained all the amenities and etc. and also the room. When we walked into the room, it was just aweinspiring. The hotel also provided us with a $40 breakfast voucher which we used for breakfast room service. For lunch we went to their lake terrace pool area on the 6th floor. It is a nicely set area but very windy due to the height and facing the harbor. All the loungers were taken and everyone was trying to sit in the sun due to the wind. We finally found two loungers in the sun and ordered lunch of super nachos and tofu sandwich. The food and drinks we ordered were great and the waitress was great also provided the prompt service. The bedding in the room was great, the bathroom was different than the other hotels, though very chic. It had sliding doors that did not lock and there were louvres from which you can look into the room. At night when we cam back from dinner in the gaslamp quarter, there was turn down service with mood lighting and the tv set to nice mood music, it was very romantic. We put our order for breakfast room service before we went to sleep. We had set up our room service derlivery for 9 am, we got a call at 8.45 to verify our order and it was promptly delivered on time. The breakfast was very delicious, we enjoyed it watching the view of gaslamp in the morning. They also gave us a the late check out and they did hold our bag after check out because we wanted to stroll in the gaslamp. All in all a great experience and on the plus my girlfriend went all out it make it an awesome weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Great ballpark experience and more”
Reviews.Author: mpurt
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Omni. The bridge to the ballpark is really neat and the hotel itself is really very nice. Restaurant was great for breakfast, staff was awesome and valet was quick. If you can get the breakfast pkg well worth it -- it included brkfast and parking.... Join the Omni guest program before travelling and you an enjoy some nice perks. If you're looking for a place to eat, try Confidential in the Gaslamp District. Really great food and some nice surprises during happy hour (4-7 pm when we visited)

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent Performance”
Reviews.Author: suebob
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Omni before and returned there with enthusiasm. However, this trip prompts a less than top-notch review. The location is of course very convenient to Gas Lamp, the Convention Center, and the ballpark. The hotel is lovely. The rooms are spacious and very nice with good temperature control. The restaurant had good food at reasonable city prices. However, the room service breakfast was wrong every morning! One day, no coffee at all; one day, no milk for coffee; one day, bagel with no cream cheese, jelly, or butter; etc. Sheets are scratchy; bed has only two pillows; water pressure is low. They can do better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel--Meets Omni Standards”
Reviews.Author: SanDiego84
Reviews.Content: For being in gaslamp san diego, this hotel is very nice. I would say it is once of the nicest hotels in downtown. There isn't a fancy bar at the hotel. However, there is a McCormick and Schmick's inside the hotel that offers a great happy hour. THe rooms are spacious, the hotel staff is great. The pool is also nice. They have a fairly large gym as well.

Reviews.Title: “The Positive Reviews Are True”
Reviews.Author: StateEmployee1948
Reviews.Content: Rather than repeat the positive reviews below, I want to emphasize the friendly staff which made the stay even more enjoyable. The reservation system did not have my Select Guest-, and one hour after I checked in--staff delivered to my roomh a bottle of wine and a box of candy, and a handwritten apology. Here are some other points-- 1. Clean Rooms 2. Upper floors have expansive views which is conducive for reflection with a cup of coffee in the morning and a glass of wine in the evening. 3. Select glass program entitles you to free Internet and coffee and beverage in the morning. 4. Internet signal is strong. 5. Pool is large enough for lap swimming,. Abundance of giant towels for drying off,.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, customer service takes it over the top!”
Reviews.Author: form2
Reviews.Content: Simply adored our stay at the Omni Hotel! I'm a firm believer in quality customer service and it's definitely one of the attributes that I do remember from a hotel. Sure, you could have the clean, simple modern architecture but w/o a friendly face to greet you at valet, the front desk, in the lobby, on your hotel floor you might as well stay across the street at pretentious Hard Rock! (did I type that out loud, oops!) The valet offers you bottled water for your excursion, the bell boy is friendly, and if you sign up for free Omni rewards you get complimentary wifi in your room! The bathrooms are clean and well kept. The bed could use a little advice from the Westin beds, but they're not too bad. They definitely need to upgrade their TVs to flat screens. But the location is perfect if your stay includes a Padre game, a trip on the trolley or just running around downtown. Just goes to show that hotels can be stylish and trendy w/o being cold and snobbish! Yay Omni!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: 2Sweet
Reviews.Content: Stayed this past weekend at the Omni. Hotel is "beautifully appointed." Great room size. The staff is incredibly friendly and did everything possible to make our stay pleasant. Fantastic location in the Gaslamp quarter. All reviews are correct about the convenience of shopping and eating. So many places are just a short walk away. Be careful...hotel charges $30 per night for parking. There is a lot immediately across the street that is just a dollar an hour...Overnight is about 18 bucks there (their math is a little funny...read the signs)... but by far a value over parking at the hotel. And they will tout "in and out privileges"...DON'T FALL FOR IT!! I didn't...and I was happy about my choice. Being from Texas the air conditioning never got cool enough...but I guess we had "meat packer" expectations. There is a nice restaurant inside of the hotel as well. You will do well to ask for a high floor with a harbor view...it's beautiful. I would most definitely recommmend this property!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great service.”
Reviews.Author: doctorbubba
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal for this hotel on their website and were thoroughly pleased with the selection. Spent 3 days being tourists and the location was perfect, particularly for going to a Padres ball game - just a 5 minute walk and you're in the stadium. We walked to fantastic restaurants in the Gaslamp Quarter. All staff were pleasant, professional and very helpful. The room was lovely and comfortable. We did not have a car so cannot speak to parking. Be sure and take the Segway tour - tons of fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: jules51r
Reviews.Content: Everything was superb - rooms, facilities, service, and staff. One of the biggest perks is the location. It's basically on top of Petco Park, the Convention Center, the Trolley, and Gaslamp District (lots of nice, cute restaurants and shops). Also, it's an inexpensive cab ride from the airport, or, if you're up for public transit, you can literally get door-to-door service from the airport by taking the bus, then the trolley (cost for me:$3.50). The rooms were excellent and I had a great view of the water and convention center. The beds were fine, but just slightly on the hard side. Rooms were cleaned thoroughly and promptly and included turn-down service in the evening. Outdoor pool and hot tub on the 6th floor were not huge but warm and clean. Lots of loungers around the pool where you can sit and relax or read. Staff/front desk really helpful and nice. I signed up for their preferred club (easy to do on their website) and received complimentary beverages in the morning, and free Internet. The beverages were a nice touch, and usually came when requested, but strayed slightly a few times. Overall, great experience at a wonderful hotel in an ideal location. Highly recommended - would definitely return here!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel... just pick your room wisely”
Reviews.Author: sjunkins
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel, probably one of the nicest that I have ever stayed in. The location was perfect. I was attending a conference at the Convention Center and it was right across the street. Also, it was perfect situated to get to the Gaslamp Quarter (the hot spot area). My room had a great view overlooking San Diego Bay and one of the floors you could look right into PETCO Park's baseball stadium. Here is the only complaint I had, the trolley/train would come through on a regular schedule nightly/early morning and wake me up frequently. My colleagues on the other side of the hotel didnt have any problems. But, I would recommend asking about this issue when booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Well managed, beautifully decorated, and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: ives
Reviews.Content: Our initial inclination was to stay at the Omni for our trip to San Diego after a great experience at the Omni in San Francisco last summer. But my traveling companion, who is a light sleeper saw the postings about the Omni being noisy and we choose instead to stay at a Marriott property. After one night at the Marriott (the accommodations were depressing) we packed our bags and moved to the Omni where we stayed for about 5 days. It is a great hotel with a wonderful staff (the housekeeping staff is unbelievable) nicely decorated, and has wonderful views. It is a beautiful building with a great gym and business center. On the subject of noise: the hotel overlooks the water and train tracks. Occasionally during the day one could hear the occasional train horn but the noise stopped at night so it was never a problem - even for a light sleeper. Because the hotel is adjacent to the baseball stadium I would presume that once the season kicks off it will increase noise and traffic problems, but since we were there off season I cannot comment on this. This is a well managed hotel - I hope you enjoy your stay in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Elisabetd
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here three day pre cruise on our first visit to San Diego. It was a Hotwire booking and we could not have been more pleased with the hotel. Check in was fast and friendly, we had a corner unit, very nice and large with view of the pool. That made it easy to pick a good time to use the pool when not too busy. We loved the bathroom and the balcony, would have been nice to have some chairs on the balcony though. Doormen were very helpful and the location to everywhere we wanted to be very good. We did not use the restaurant, but had coffee and orange juice in the room for breakfast and I can still taste them, they were so good.

Reviews.Title: “Omni-Fantastic! 2 Sisters get First Class Stay!”
Reviews.Author: NMCruzzin
Reviews.Content: My sister and I wanted a get away to San Diego, Mar 20-24, 2009. I got a good deal on Priceline for the hotel. We really loved staying at the Omni. Knowing we were staying mostly downtown, we didn't rent a car. The Trolley is right behind the hotel and made it easy travel to Little Italy, Seaport Village, Downtown/Santa Fe stop ( 2 blocks from Cruise Terminal). Sure wish we had been here during a ball game - but maybe next time! Everyone was Very helpful at the hotel. It's close to shops and other places to eat, the convention center is across the street - the location was Perfect! Room was very clean - Big Bathroom! Loved the Robes and lots of towels without having to ask for them. Pool & Work out room are on floor 6 - we used the big hot tub 2 nights. Beds are comfortable and we left feeling so rested even though we made sure we took in the sights during the day. We will Go Back and just might let our husbands come with us!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: rickpie
Reviews.Content: My partner and I needed to get out of the cold Seattle weather, so we booked a room at the Omni in San Diego. The hotel staff was excellent and very attentive. When we arrived, we were checked in and up to our room in minutes. Our room was quite small, which surprised us, but it was very clean and very comfortable. There were ample amenities and we were snug and bugs in rugs. The hotel is across the street from the Gaslamp district, where there are lots of restaurants to choose from. It is also right next to the San Diego Trolley line. Some people have complained about the noise from the trains, but it didn't bother us at all. There were, however, baseball games going on each night of our stay. The baseball stadium is practically attached to the hotel and the noise from the cheering crowds, all the way up to midnight, was jarring. Other than that our stay was perfect. We joined the Omni Select Guest program, which is their frequent guest program. It is free to join and members receive lots of extra amenities, including coffee, drinks and a newspaper of your choice delivered to your room each morning. You choose what time you would like your coffee delivered. This is a service we really enjoyed. Select Guest members also receive free Wi-Fi service in the rooms. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay on the Omni and we are looking forward to returning for another fun weekend when the gloomy Seattle weather has got us down.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great locality for couples or families-yes its that versatile.”
Reviews.Author: axleftwich
Reviews.Content: The Omni was awesome!! It is in a great location in the Gaslamp Quarter (next to Petco Park and across from the Convention Center) and is right near the Trolley system in case you want to save money and take the trolley. There are several excellent restaurants within walking distance to the hotel. In addition, they have a Kids club--they gave our kids a fun little backpack with toys and activities inside. Not to mention that every night they got chocolate chip cookies and milk delivered to our room! They loved it and were excited every night when they were about to be delivered. The only downside was that our shower head in the bathroom was malfunctioning the first night, but after a quick call to the front desk, they promised to fix within the next 2 hours or give us another room. They were excellent to deal with and immediatlty got our showerhead fixed. This is an excellent choice whether going with your family or as a couple or with friends. You will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Omnirific in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: cpsunset35
Reviews.Content: So glad we chose the Omni San Diego. Booked hotel/air through Priceline. Omni was perfect from check-in to check-out. Room was spacious, modern and very clean. We were on the 13th floor and had a view of Petco Park (San Diego Padres stadium). The World Baseball Classic was going on while we were there so there was activity in the stadium. Housecleaning did a wonderful job in cleaning the rooms and making them smell fresh. Beds and pillows were very comfortable. The bathroom was spacious with a nice shower/bath and very clean. Plenty of towels were provided. The location of this hotel is perfect. We did rent a car because we wanted to do things outside of San Diego. Parking at the hotel is $30 but there was a garage across the street that was less. Transportation is abundant with trolleys, cabs, buses, etc and wouldn't have needed the car if we weren't leaving the city. We toured San Diego University which was around 15 min drive from the Omni. After the college tour we drove to La Jolla and Mission Beach which is only a short drive from the city. La Jolla has many beautiful sights and a small beach full of seals. Mission Beach has an amusement park and a boardwalk with skaters, rollerbladers, bikers, runners, etc. Both areas offered free parking. Took a city tour with Old Town Trolley. This is a great way to get a feel of the city and the sights. The guides were all very knowledgeable and fun. Ate lunch in Old Town San Diego at the Cafe Coyote. Food was very good and a fun place. Drove over to Coronado and had a delicious brunch at the famous Hotel Del Coronado. Hotel Del Coronado is grand and the grounds are beautiful and right on the beach. The beach is very clean here, we were lucky to see a herd of dolphins swim by while walking along the beach. We did not experience the hotel restaurant but did get coffee and tea from Morsels. Hotel Conceirge was most helpful. We were able to purchase activity tickets at the hotel. We spent a lot of time at Gaslamp Quarters which is in walking distance of the Omni. Many restaurants, bars and shops are located in Gaslamp Quarters. Restaurants we experienced in the Quarters were Whiskey Girl, Hard Rock Cafe, and Ghiardelli (for dessert, mmmmm) . Nightlife is great here if that is what you are looking for. Wasn't able to experience the nightlife since I was with my 19 yr old daughter but it looked like lots of fun. Thursday we went to the San Diego Zoo and had a great time also not far from the Omni. Next time will go to the Wild Animal Park. The hotel was very quiet and private. We were not bothered by any noise whatsoever. Pool at the Omni was really nice with heated water and a hot tub. A nice view of the area from the pool level.
