I travel a lot and have stayed in many hotels, this one was lovely and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. As two girls we felt really safe in the area, we were coming back late at night and had no problems. If you stay here make sure you walk to Seaport village, 10 minutes walk, really pretty shops, restaurants and views. our other choice is Fred's Mexican restaurant on the Gaslamp, a good happy hour and tasty food. We had a good look round San Diego and feel we couldn't have stayed at a better hotel. Easily a four star!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect start to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: EllieC
Reviews.Content: We spent the first 4 nights of our honeymoon at the Omni San Diego and could not have made a better choice. Everything in this hotel is pristine, very stylish and very very clean. The bedroom and bathroom were a good size and very nicely decorated. When we first booked the hotel we were uncertain whether it may be aimed solely at business travellers but that is not the case. Whilst it would be the perfect hotel to stay at if you were going to a convention it is equally good for all other occasions. We were exceptionally impressed with the staff and particularly the Assistant Front Desk Manager who treated us like royalty from the moment we arrived. The restaurant and bar were very good for in hotel facilities. I suspect you could get cheaper food nearby but the convenience and standard made it a good choice for our first night. The hotel is in a very central location and we were quite happy to wander around after dark. There is some building work going on across from the hotel but we were not disturbed by this at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: weejim
Reviews.Content: Visited the OMNi as part of a convention in San Diego and the hotel is ideally situated for that purpose. It is also close to many bars and restuarants. The rooms are very good but there is a lot of noise from the train line that runs in front of the hotel - if you are a light sleeper then you may be dissapointed. The bar/restuarant is not part of the hotel and is not cheap, (except for happy hour which has some great food deals).The staff in the bar were very friendly, but a bit young and too overconcerned with each other and not with the guests. Shame as it clouds your judgement of the hotel, the staff employed by the hotel were much more professional.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rotraveler
Reviews.Content: This was a business trip with my husband, so we had no control over where we stayed. But it turned out to be a good thing, newer hotel, great location, very clean, next to the new Petco Stadium and close to the gaslamp district with lots of shopping and fabulous resataurants. Could walk to many places. Hotel has a McCormick and Schmidt seafood restaurant in house, also serves a full breakfast. Lots of baseball memorabilia throughout the hotel. Good Service.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Iwan-Machen
Reviews.Content: Just briefly to say that we didn't fully experience the pleasures of the Omni, as it was part of the Insight holiday booked from San Francisco to San Diego, where early rising and other arrangements meant being on the move most of daytime hours. The greeting staff were very welcoming, the young "bellboys" were extremely pleasant and helpful, and also very supportive to individuals who needed more care than others. The one breakfast we had was more than enough- cereals were rather disappointing, and the one group dinner was tasty, well served, but obviously limited in variety. Lovely bedrooms which were very quiet despite their positions and the very loud public transport facilities immediately outside had seemingly all conveniences appropriate to their style. As it was part of the Coach Tour, I could not quote what price we would have paid every night, but I nearly felt that I could say it was worth the price!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Vaison
Reviews.Content: We spent the extra cash to get a premium room for the view. First mistake made, our room wasn't ready. We spent time at the hotel bar and each had two drinks - which should have been comped and wasn't. At least the bartender was very attractive and friendly. Since we had two rooms - and somehow not next to each other or even on the same floor - we each had different views. My room had a view of the convention center and in the distance you could see the bay. My friend's room had a view of the bay and Petco Park. The room itself was nice (and small). None of us liked the bathroom door. It was a sliding door that did not give total privacy due to the sides of the door being always open and the door itself was mostly frosted glass. We complained that the room did not get nearly as cold as we wanted and we called 3 consecutive days until finally we found a note from maintenance on the 3rd day telling us that the air unit was working properly. We did not understand how we could set the air at 70 and it would only get as low as 74. The hallway felt like it was 65. Perhaps the sun in the windows kept the room too warm and the air just couldn't keep up. That was frustrating and uncomfortable as we like it cooler. We ordered breakfast for 2 the first morning. After taxes, numerous surcharges and tip = $75. I only ate half of mine as it was not very good. We didn't make that mistake twice. Valet parking is outrageously priced so we had to drive around the block, pay for parking and walk back to the hotel every day. That was annoying. A hotel of this class should have it's own garage. The positives - the hotel is very clean, the staff was friendly and helpful. Good customer service saved them from a lower rating. The hotel location is great as we went to the Gaslamp Quarter almost every night. Lots of good places to eat and drink there. Stay away from the hotel food, save a few bucks and get a better meal. We had tickets to the Padres game and the private entrance to the stadium on the 3rd floor was very nice. Would I stay here again? Only if my company paid the bill. There is no way that I would spend that much for a hotel like that. One restaurant, one bar, no entertainment and lots of extra costs. I have stayed in far better hotels for the price. This hotel is simply average.

Reviews.Title: “Newer property, great location, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Belasaria
Reviews.Content: We were blown away by the clean decor, friendly staff, and quality of the Omni. This is a newer property and has a great location a) next to the ballpark, b) close to the convention center and c) close to the Gaslamp District. The King room was a nice size and had great bedding. What made the room were the wood blinds between the bathroom and the main room and the sliding doors of the bathroom. The glass shelves in the bathroom were very nice as well. The hotel has complimentary wireless internet, which is a bonus for business travellers, and the work area and business center were really nice. The staff was incredibly friendly, from the bell staff greeting us upon arrival, to the front desk, to the person running the cafe. The lobby decor was fresh with a library setting. The hotel was easy to navigate as well. We weren't there during baseball season, so I don't know the effect of crowd noise has on the hotel room, but the room I had was relatively quiet despite the hotel being next to the train tracks. Regardless, the Omni is at the top of my list for hotels in San Diego near the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Their quoted special price was not honoured”
Reviews.Author: kazda
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed here but when I was making a booking to stay for 4 nights in April, this is what happened I tried to book at their personally emailed quote of $129.00 special rate. Firstly, I tried to get the speciaI rate $129.00 by booking online at their website with the special promo code, but when I entered the whole 4 nights of my stay it didn't show the $129.00 rate at all. Therefore...I then emailed Omni reservations direct and had a prompt reply from Joshua in Reservations, stating he could do the 1st three nights at $129.00 and the last night at $279.00. Which I was really happy with and when I replied to that email that the web booking didn't allow more than 1 night at the cheap rate, I was advised to email Reservations my credit card for booking confirmation and my booking would be processed. THEN I receive another email stating that he (Joshua) made a mistake and only the 1st night was at the $129.00 rate. The emails then went back and forth as I replied that he DID in fact quote me on the 3 nights and if it was a mistake, thought that the quoted price he supplied in his email to me should be honored by the Hotel. Next thing I get another email stating ALL the rooms within the special rate of $129.00 ARE SOLD OUT. But get this, I then immediately went back to their website to check, and there are STILL rooms available at $129.00 for the 5th April (which I think is when the special rate ends) I think the management don't want to honour the quoted price that Joshua made to me of $129.00 for 1st three nights ( 5 to 7th April and then 8th April @ $279.00) Very dissapointed with MANAGEMENTS decision, as I do have the emails from Joshua quoting the special price for the first 3 nights of $129.00 my 4 night intended stay in a Premium room with Bay view & 2 x double beds increasing to $279.00 for the 4th night (staying in the same room) Thats my winge about this hotel Hotel may be in good location etc but when it comes to honouring their quoted prices their service is at rock bottom.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a crowded cityscape.”
Reviews.Author: mothnm
Reviews.Content: Arrived at night. The area was teaming with young, beautiful people. Event at Petco Park left no street parking so we paid $15 for the parking garage across the street. Valets offer unlimited in and out parking for $24. Beautiful room and bathroom, Institute Swiss bathroom goodies, spectacular bed, coffee maker, not so beautiful view of the city, baseball memorabilia in the hotel public areas. All kinds of architectural features such as a glass encased exterior elevator, a truncated corner with platform and large ceramic pot, and nubby silk backing the phone ledge by the conference rooms. Used the exercise room since possible runs around the hotel are paved. Variety of equipment. Everything clean. The outdoor pool has sails around it. The airport Hilton is still my favorite hotel in San Diego because of sitting on the room balcony and seeing the boats. The Omni is a lovely hotel in a crowded cityscape.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it thinks it is”
Reviews.Author: Ed05
Reviews.Content: I booked this through Hotwire and got a rate of abot 250USD over a weekend, a big saving on the usual 500 USD price tag. First, location is great for the Gaslamp district and for Petco Park, we could see right into the stadium from our window. The room was adecent size, and was fitted out in a modern if somewhat cold style. Poool are was nice agin but felt sterile. My main complaint was what seemed the rather dismissive receprion staff. Not very welcoming at all. They also charged me for valet parking when I did not have a car, and when I pointed it out, I was asked if I was sure I didnt have a car?? No apology. I also handed in a handbag I found in the lobby to reception- no thanks whatsoever. Would not have been happy paying the full rate for this place.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...........”
Reviews.Author: loralei33
Reviews.Content: I was here for a business meeting in late Sept. The location cant be beat, downtown is a mix of the old, charming and eclectic with a lovely view of the water. Stores and restaurants are abundant and within a quick walk. Highlights: The pool area is warm and inviting with music that plays undewater-my son got a kick out of that. and yes, the hotel is kid friendly. The service seemed to be on par and not overly patronizing in that phony way one sometimes finds in hotels. There is the now-requisite outdoor fireplace that all west coast properties seem to have these days but it is mainly for display as no real heat was generating from it but who needed it this time of year anyways?? We got tickets to a Padre's game and Petco Park is worth seeing even if you arent catching a game. We were, and really enjoyed the skywalk which takes you directly to the park from the hotel. All you need is a room key to enter. For baseball fans, this may be "the place to stay" in San Diego. As for the room, well I am not one to nitpick a very nice place, which the Omni certainly is but I have to say that the bathroom door which in our room was part clouded glass, while visually pleasing from a decorative standpoint, did not lend itself to alot of privacy nor was there a fan in the bathroom. Now, being married for twelve years, I can say that wasnt really an issue, it still wasnt practical and I can imagine that some couples might find the design uncomfortable for their stay. In addition, the coffee maker had to be taken out of the wall console and plugged in at the desk where my laptop was situated. Again, not a huge deal but an inconveninece none the less. And since the tv/stereo had electrical hookup, a little forethought, could have remedied this design flaw. The conference rooms were quite adequate. I believe the service was good as well and the temperature was not below freezing as is the case with many hotel meeting rooms. As for food service, the meals at the conference were quite nice and above the average that I have had. We did not eat in the hotel restaurants due to a plethora of places in the surrounding area. But I did see the buffet for breakfast at McCormick and Schmicks and it did look enticing and a good value. Conceierge was busy but helpful. Bonus: they comped us the foldout bed for my son which was suppose to be an additional 25 a night. We had signed up for their special guest program prior to arriving and that may have been why, In any event, that goes along way in my book to building good will and customer loyalty. All in all, it was a pleasant stay and i would recommend the hotel to anyone visiting the San Diego area looking for acommodations in that class.

Reviews.Title: “superb”
Reviews.Author: cclarke
Reviews.Content: super staff who were only to egare to help. The hotel was spotlessly clean and the rooms were spacious and well serviced. We had booked a go san diego stay which we later realised we did not required and the hotel kindly reduced the rate of our room. I would recommend staying at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: SMUSteve
Reviews.Content: PROS: 1) Great location! The Omni is situated downtown on the bay; a short walk away from the historic Gaslamp Quarters which we walked to daily for dining, drinking, and shopping. The hotel is connected by skybridge to the incredible new Petco Park where we saw the San Diego Padres play. New convention center is right next door. Beaches, shopping and site seeing is only a short drive away as well. 2) Great value. After staying at the Hotel del Coronado three nights previous, it was refreshing to enjoy nicer amenities at a less expensive nightly rate. This new facility has beautiful rooms and common areas with very nice finishes (tile, fixtures, carpet etc.). Those who appreciate clean lines and modern design without sacrificing comfort will feel right at home (see pics). The rooftop (6th floor) pool is heated saltwater which is wonderful on a chilly San Diego evening and has a bar (although it’s not open very late). Wireless internet is free (included in nightly rate). 3) Staff was very friendly. After noticing a comment on our reservation from our AAA agent that it was our honeymoon, they automatically upgraded our room free of charge. 4) We had a nice sense of privacy compared to our experience at Hotel del Coronado. Noise was not a problem at any time during our stay. 5) Fun for kids. Even though we are newly weds without children, our upgraded “junior suite” had the “Omni Kids” room attached. This room had bunk beds, giant stuffed animals, books, games, bean bags, and a separate TV. I can imagine that kids would have a tough time leaving this hotel as it definitely looked like a lot of fun (see pics). CONS: 1) Pool area closes at 10:00PM and the poolside bar usually closes at 7:00PM. Not a big deal at all but we feel this was a little early for such a nice amenity. 2) Valet parking is $24 per night. A little tip: To save some money, self park in the new garage right across the street. Our nightly rate there was only $8 as we only used the car once a day (no in and out privileges). Overall our honeymoon experience at the Omni was great. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking to stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great annual visit to San Diego Omni”
Reviews.Author: footymum
Reviews.Content: We visit San Diego annually for meetings and always look forward to staying at the Omni Hotel but this year we really learned to appreciate the great customer service they provide. We arrived late at night after a long day of travel to find that our anticipated view room was not available. (Not a bad room, just not what we had booked!) One of the assistant managers was very diligent and got us moved first thing the next morning as we had breakfast. We discovered when we returned home that we had left some articles of clothing in the first room and when I called to inquire they found the items, confirmed our mailing address and shipped them to us the same day at no charge! I am impressed as items left in hotel rooms rarely end up being found, let alone returned. We also love the convenience of the ball park, the convention center, the trolley and an almost endless selection of great restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: joenbrenda
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel on Priceline so we got a great rate. I am not sure if we would have enjoyed it as much if we had paid 300 a night for a room but paying 140 was SO worth it. The hotel has an excellent location. Every person working at the hotel that we encountered was more than gracious. The rooms were upscale and well appointed. Overall we would love to stay here again, especially if we got a really good rate!

Reviews.Title: “Omni was the GREATEST!”
Reviews.Author: slowmn
Reviews.Content: I took my 13 year old grandson to San Diego in August to see a Padres game at their new ballpark, and booked the "Home Run Special" at the Omni. When we arrived, we were told we had been upgraded to the Tony Gwynn Suite on the 20th floor! A beautiful room with a fantastic view. Our stay was wonderful, my grandson will remember this always. The whole experience was entirely positive -- loved the breakfast buffet (best fresh-squeezed orange juice since I had my own tree!) and the entire staff was so friendly and welcoming. Everything was very clean and so nicely done. I would never hesitate to recommend this property to anyone traveling to San Diego, and definitely plan on staying there again myself! One really nice advantage was the Skybridge to Petco Park -- one can stay in the hotel and walk to the game, no worrying about parking, it's totally safe and convenient. The Omni gets a "2 thumbs up" from me!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaliGirl23
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with very nice rooms. The bed was soo comfortable. The furniture was very classy and there was always about 5 people standing at the front door ready to open the door for you. The valet guy was very helpful even though we did not valet. We parked at the lot across the street which was much cheaper than the valet, but not as convienient. The room was absolutely gorgeous. the bathroom was nice and there were complimentary bath robes for you to use. This is a great hotel for baseball fans. There is a bridge connecting the hotel to Petco Park. There is also tons of baseball memorabilia scattered throughout the hotel. There are things such as Babe Ruth's baseball bat (I think) or someone else's shoes, etc. Very nice. My only complaint is that it is near a port (or something) and there was a lot of noise in the morning. I looked out the window to find out that there were giant machines moving things that were either contruction material or containers to be put on a ship. I"m not sure because I couldn't really get a good look at what they were doing. but there was a lot of noise. It seemed to be a GIANT crane that was making all the noise. Other than that... this was an excellent hotel and I would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Threw out diabetes meds”
Reviews.Author: Helen4kidz
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a 3 night stay with 2 rooms booked for us and our 4 children. Upon arrival we were told we could not have adjoining rooms after I confirmed this twice. THen we asked if they could move us the next day to adjoining rooms which they said they could. WE had asked for a refridge because my husband needed it for keeping his Diabetes medication cold .. When we told them 2 times to just move fridge and not touch the medication.. THey DID IT anyway....they trew out his insulin.! Can't even begin to tell what rediculos lies we were told over the next 27 hours as they tried to fix it by getting us a new prescpription. NEEDLESS to say they were very very apologetic and took total blame. They didnt charge us for our 3 nights and even payed for our lunch while we sat at the pool waiting for a delivery from the pharmacy that finally came 27 hours after they threw it out. The hotel is beautiful but should invest in REAL bathroom doors. Rooms are beautiful and the hotel staff very friendly. We heard you can stand out on the street around 3pm and the ball players fom other hotels arrive on golf carts..

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: DGKalina
Reviews.Content: Got a rate of $122/night through Priceline, which made this a very affordable and comfortable visit to San Diego. As noted before, valet parking is expensive, but with a multi-story parking garage across the street and (at least when the Padres are not in town) reasonable access to nearby on-street paking (30 minute limit before 6:00 pm), there was no need to pay $24/day for valet. Overnight parking in the garage was $8, except for Friday and Saturday night when it cost $13. Location is good, but being on the very end of the Gaslamp Quarter seemed a little isolated from the action. Lots of construction activity in the area, so some traffic issues. Had a nice meal at McCormick & Schmick's. Prices were reasonable, portions generous and food quality good. Service was well-bleow par, however. Even though the restauant was not particularly busy (Sunday night) and there seemed to be a lot of staff, our waiter did an excellent vanishing act numerous times, so that getting a refill on wine, dessert menu, coffee refill, check, etc., made fo a much longer than necessary meal.

Reviews.Title: “Customers DO come first!”
Reviews.Author: savery
Reviews.Content: I really cannot remember the last time I stayed in a Hotel that REALLY seemed to care about thier guests as much as the Omni. I would reccommend signing up for the Select Guest package, it will get you even more bang for your buck. The rooms are beautiful, the views are beautiful, the food is great (a tiny bit pricy though) and the staff is FABULOUS. When signing up as a Select Guest, there are a number of choices that you can pick from, for example, we chose a high floor corner room that ended up being an amazing room! The views of the bay and gaslamp quarter were gorgeous. There were a few things that could be a tiny bit better, parking was $24 a day but there is a lot that you can park in across the street, so it wasn't that big of an issue. The pool was kinda small also, but there is a great patio for sunbathing or just eating and relaxing. The location was great, on the southern tip of the gaslamp quarter, literally attached to Petco Park, across the street from the convention center and the bay and about 15 minutes driving distance from Mission Beach or Pacific Beach. Don't stay at the Omni if you are like mediocre hotels, you will never look back!!!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: hrfuchs
Reviews.Content: Just finished a two night stay at the Omni. The valet and bell staff practically pushed each other out of the way to help us from our car upon arrival. By no means was this a push for any potential gratuity. To sum up the overall valet staff and bell service in one word, "professional". Just so you know, there is a $24 per day charge to valet your car. This includes all day in/out privledges. There is a small sign posted indicating this. Due to the small entrance area, it may not be visible to all. In todays day and age, this is to be expected, especially from a downtown location. Check in was painless and quick. The issue arose around connecting rooms which I had requested via the company website at time of booking. By the way, I tried to book this hotel at almost every travel web site known to man with no success. Went to the hotel site at the 11th hour and was successful. We were traveling with four children and it was a must to ahve connecting rooms. After what looked like a potential glitch, the front desk manager, came over and handled it, no questions asked. He even upgraded us to the bay view side of the tower and did it with a smile. The location of the hotel was great. 10 minutes to Sea World, a few to the San Diego Embarcadero, Zoo and Balboa park. Not far from anywhere. Definitely nothing closer to Petco Park than the Omni if you care to catch a ballgame. They are connected via a walking bridge. You are at the south end of the city's Gaslamp district where there are many restaurants and bars, if you like. The area was very crowded, but clean. The hotel pool is small and the kids let me know it. However, the staff and the surrounding pool grounds were immaculate. Great service. Not a true test as there were only about 10 people in the pool area. Never the less, a great time. We had breakfast at the buufet at McCormick & Schmicks which is located inside the hotel. Not too expensive, but be wary about the drinks. Caveat Emptor, $45 dollars of fresh squeezed orange juice, for 10 servings. Wonder how many oranges we could have bought back home for that amount ? Needless to say, drinks are not included on the buffet menu. Darn good O.J., even for the price. Food was slightly above average, with a nice omelete station. Clean, well appointed rooms and bathrooms. Decent size, with magnificent views of the bay and Coronado Island. Very comfortable and open. All in all, a great stay. I would definitely return to the Omni on business or with my wife again. Not to sure if I would return with the children. My kids definitley rate hotels based on the pools and The Omni pool was a bit to small for my family's liking. Other than that, Well done Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: tmbl
Reviews.Content: Excellent in every way. Friendly service, very nice rooms, efficient valet, and a very detailed housekeeping staff. Great location. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very polished”
Reviews.Author: Berghof
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for six days during mid July. Check in went smootly and they were very accomodating and professional. The exterior of the hotel is very upscale and modern with impressive views depending on where your room is. Liking to have a nice view, I requested a room change and they accommodated me and were very cordial about it. I eventually ended up in room 1414 which is a corner room on the front left side. I had an incredible view of the harbor, Point Loma, Coronado Island, and the Pacific Ocean from my forward view and downtown / ballpark out my balcony view. The balconies are much larger on the corner floors as well. Only corner rooms on the front westward facing side of the hotel have balconies and those directly overlooking the pool (rooms facing north and east do not have balconies. Floors 21 and up are condos. The common areas from the lobby to the hallways are very upscale and refined. The rooms are also very nice. The bathrooms have very interesting wooden blinds that open into your room , but don't give you the privacy you may desire soundwise. The rooms were insulated well and noise was kept to a minimum unless you include the frieight train that comes by a few times a day. This did not really bother me, but it may some. Maid service was very good. One day she even put ice in the ice bucket for me as she noticed that I had used it the day before. Evening turn down service is also very nice. They leave you a little surprise too each night with the turn down service. There is free parking after 6pm on adjacent streets, but you may have to circle a few times to get a space. Valet will park the car in a garage directly across the street for you or you can do it yourself for about $8.00 a day. I found a street spot every day however. All in all, a very polished, sophisticated establishment that affords all the comforts you would expect. I got all this too for about $105.00 a night on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Our Downtown Favorite”
Reviews.Author: octraveljunkie
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel numerous times since it opened. The rooms are fabulous. Join the Omni Select Guest program and get perks like late check outs and lightening fast check in. As a Select Guest, all we do is pull up to the valet, hand them the keys, go straight to the front desk, give your name and they have your room keys waiting for you. One time, we literaly went from our car to the front desk and into our room in under 2 minutes! That's excellent service. While you're there, everyone greets you and treats you like a VIP. Excellent restaurants and the Gaslamp nightlife is a 5 minute walk. The private walkway connecting the hotel to Petco Park is great for easy access during Padres games.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Catchin a Ballgame!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Omni hotel is definitely a 4 star hotel. The layout makes the whole place feel bigger than it actually is and is very asthetically pleasing. The restaurant is overpriced, and with so many great ones within walking distance, dont bother. The best thing about the hotel though is the skybridge into Petco Park. We were down from San Francisco to catch a few Giants games, and using the sky bridge made us feel like VIPs! After the game, check out the bar/restaurant Dick's Last Resort. Rockin good times!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Omni San Diego is Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Joel1950dc
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have been more pleased. My room was on the top floor facing the convention center and the bay. The view was incredible! I arrived late due to a major delay in my flight. When I finally got to the hotel (at midnight) I was welcomed as an old friend, even though it was my first stay at the Omni and my first visit to San Diego. Everyone at the hotel provided exceptional service, from the concierge to the parking valet to everyone at the front desk to the people who cleaned the room daily. Location: How can you beat it? At the edge of the happening Gaslamp district, directly across the street from the convention center, and the Omni is attached to the Padres' Petco Park stadium (hint: take one of the tours of the stadium; you won't be sorry!) Breakfast was delivered on time every day, and most of it was free because I signed up to be an Omni Select Guest member when I made my reservation. Noise? None! I never heard sounds from other rooms even though my room had a connecting door to my neighbor's room. Sometimes the trains at night were a bit noisy, but that's city life, isn't it? Due to my experience last week, I'd stay at any Omni in any city from now on. What a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Major problems, poor service”
Reviews.Author: NachoLibre
Reviews.Content: I had two problems during my stay at the Omni that I have never had at any other hotel in all my life, not even the budget hotels. But the real problem was in how they handled the second problem. The night before I was to check out (at 6 am to catch a flight), I called and asked for a wake up call. Someone answered the phone and confirmed the time that I would be given a call. The alarm clocks in the room give you the option of either radio, CD, or natural sounds (who wakes up to the sound of the ocean??), but no buzzer. So I was counting on that wakeup call. I didn't get it and ended up missing my flight as a result. When I went down to check out at a little before 8am, the manager on duty confirmed that I didn't get a call and apologized. He put me in a cab to the airport at the hotel's expense, so I was happy about that. The strange thing though was that he wanted me to leave my bags at the hotel. I asked why and his explanation was that they would be there in case I couldn't get on a standby flight. I asked what if I do get on standby, what happens to my bags? He said they would drive them over. Apparently the manager has never flown on an airplane because that makes no sense. By the time you get confirmed for standby, there isn't time for bags to be shuttled to the airport, come back outside security to get them, go back inside, etc. etc. Anyway, aside from the bizarre recomendation to leave my bags, I was still happy that they did whatever was necessary to get me to the airport ASAP. My real beef is the next thing that happened... When I got back to Dallas, I saw a huge second charge on my credit card, to the tune of about $150. I called to ask what it was and left several messages that were never returned until days later. While waiting for the callback, I called again and asked to speak to the hotel desk to see if someone could tell me what the charge was for. I finally spoke with the manager on duty and he researched and told me that it was from the mini-bar. I said, "WHAT?? I never even opened the mini-bar, I certainly didn't take or consume anything from it." The manager then began to argue with me over the charges, as if I was a liar and thief. He was unbelievably rude. I spent a huge amount of money to stay at the hotel, they then tack on some other wrong charges, and *I'm* the one who is being given the second degree?? He starts listing the timeline, "Our records show you checked out at 1:30pm, we checked the mini-bar at 2:00pm...." etc. I say, hold on, you don't even have these times right. I checked out at about 8:00am, and I can prove that I was in another city eating lunch at the time you have me checked out. He goes on to say that's all irrelevant, the charges are still correct [because his computer tells him so]. I said, no, your records are demonstrably incorrect on many aspects, you can't tell me that despite all the other errors, you are certain that the charge is correct--someone obviously inputted someone else's data to my name or room or whatever. He continued to argue with me and that's when I lost it. I finally told him that they either fix the charges or I'm disputing them with my credit card company, I took nothing, and I refuse to pay for something I didn't take. He finally said in a huff that they would remove the charges, but there was no apology, no acknowledgement that the mistake might have been theirs. There was never an offer to look into it or investigate, etc. He was only doing it because I refused to pay it, as if I was just some scummy person trying to get away with something. I refuse to let some manager impugn my character when the mistake was the hotel's. I've left a message with the general manager about the manager's terrible attitude and haven't yet gotten a callback. For a hotel that prides itself on award winning customer service and quality, it is outrageous that they treat guests like criminals when the hotel has made a mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, I suggest that you become a Select member. The prices of the bar/refrigerator items in your room are crazy. If you are a select member one of the things you get is complementary beverages in the morning, which is nice. The rooms are very small, but clean. I will say I got a good price from Priceliine, but would never pay the full price. The only downfall is the parking $24.00 a day. Should be a lot cheaper for guest!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Bathroom...”
Reviews.Author: schmudu
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the Omni!! Positives: + Soft Blankets....Huge Bed + Bathroom!! (I love the fact that there are blinds from the bedroom and the doors are sliding....Love it!!) + I requested to be placed on one of the higher floors with a view of the Bay and I received both. Could be Improved Upon: + hmmmmm.....I only stayed one night....so I didn't utilize too many of the hotel's services... + Would've like a bigger bath tub....but probably needed to shell out some more dough. + Revolving bed. =) In my eyes it was worth a one weekend splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, a couple of complaints”
Reviews.Author: sekashi010
Reviews.Content: The Omni San Diego is right across the street from the Convention Center, which is nice. It sits beside the Hilton and adjacent to the in-construction Hard Rock Hotel. It is connected to the San Diego Padres' stadium Petco Park via a 5th floor Skywalk which takes you directly to the stadium. The Omni actually has ballpark view which allow you to see into the stadium. That's pretty neat. Definitely the place to stay if you're going to see a Padres game. There are actually about 5 tables with seats on the 6th floor that allow you to do work and look into the stadium. The 6th floor also has a decent and quiet seating area to do some work (across from the fitness center). Pool is nice, a bit small for the size of the hotel, but heated. There is also a nice little hot tub. Not a big pool area though, compared to the Hyatt Manchester Grand down the road. Hotel is very clean and has a nice, modern look. It looks brand new actually. Rooms are nice and are cleaned efficiently and quickly. Turndown service with some chocolates at night are nice (for Omni Select Guests). Select Guests also receive free coffee or orange/grapefruit juice in the morning along with their choice of newspaper. It's delivered right to the door. A nice touch. My family had a bay view on the 19th floor with excellent views of Coronado Bridge, Coronado Island, Point Loma, and down Harbor Drive (where you can see past the Marriott, Hyatt, and to the Embassy Suites. Very pleased with my stay. Staff is nice and courteous. Complaints: What is the deal with the bathroom door? There is a sliding door with a frosted plexiglass window separating the bathroom from the bedroom. A silhouette is clearly seen through the door. There are even cracks in the side so anyone walking by can see. The Omni might has well have hanged a sheet or piece of plastic in between the bathroom and bedroom. It was so annoying. There is a complete lack of privacy and you have to essentially tell people not to get near the bathroom when you are in there. Bathroom is nice, with nice shelving, but the door needs to go! Also, the $24/night valet parking is outrageous. The valet guys are annoying as well and aren't very efficient. I would prefer a lot to park in where I could come and go as I please. Also, due to the location being in downtown, and there is a lot of construction all over downtown, there can be banging throughout the day. Also, while being beside the train tracks is nice because of trolley service, there are also freight trains that use that tracks (mostly at night) and you can expect to hear train horns and whistles a couple of times an hour throughout the night.

Reviews.Title: “Good time!”
Reviews.Author: superez
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent Cinco de Mayo weekend at the Omni San Diego and had a marvelous time! The location of the hotel is hard to beat...adjacent to the Gaslamp District, steps away from the trolley and connected by pedestrian bridge to Petco Park. That was a plus...it took us 5 mins to get from our room to our seats! All of the Omni staff we came in contact with were incredibly cordial and helpful. We decided to do the $24/day valet parking after all, just because of the convenience and the in/out privledges (even though we didn't even need the car the whole weekend!). They do park the car in the same lot as the $9/day self park lot across the street, but I didn't mind paying extra for the convenience. Upon check-in we were given a 20% off coupon for the McCormick and Schmicks restaurant in the lobby...quite a good deal!! The food was good and actually, even if you are not staying at the hotel and eat there, you can use the convenient pedestrian bridge to Petco Park. We reserved a King room. The room was not super large but definitely fine and cozy for 2 people. It was a busy weekend so unfortunately we couldn't get an ocean view room and instead got a view of the city. There is quite a lot of construction going on so we did hear some of that on Fri and Sat, but the windows are pretty thick so it wasn't too bad nor an issue for us. The bed was extremely comfy, and the bathroom was huge considering the overall size of the room. We didn't have those wierd slats like others have complained about (between the bedroom and bath) but I must agree the hotel walls are quite thin. This only bugged me the first night..unfortunately I could hear the couple next door having a "good time." But, earplugs were the easy solution and I slept like a baby. There were no noise issues for us the second night at all. Unfortunately the bathroom doesn't have a fan, we thought that was a little strange. But we did like the fact that you can open the bedroom windows. We used the gym both days and really liked the setup. The orange water, apples/oranges, towels and spotless facility were definite plusses. The pool area looked really nice, but we didn't use it due to the cool and gloomy weather that weekend. Do register for the Omni's Select Guest Program....the room was set up to our specs (extra towels, turndown service, get fit kit) and we really enjoy the complimentary morning beverage service. The other great advantage is late check out! We left by 230 but Select Guests can stay as late as 5pm. All in all our stay at the Omni San Diego was great. We were there for a getaway weekend (we live in LA) and came back rejuvenated and relaxed! The service is fantastic and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “The Omni in Gaslamp area...baseball, bars and the bathroom door!”
Reviews.Author: 101travelers
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a Padres/Dodgers game and decided to stay at the Omni. The proximity of the hotel to the Gaslamp area and Petco Park make the location perfect for exploring San Diego. The hotel lived up to the reviews- easy check-in, early check-in accomodated, comfortable and well furnished rooms, and the most efficient bell staff I have ever encountered! The valet seemed "disappointed' when I mentioned we would be self-parking across the street... great tip TripAdvisor members, thanks! We did not have a view of the water or ballpark but the bellman did arrange for us to be moved to a higher floor so we were not looking directly into the parking structure. The Downtown area is undergoing an incredible building boom so it is unavoidable that all rooms facing the front will have a view of construction. Joining the Omni Select Guest program expedites reservations, preferences and the morning beverages and paper (delivered to your door). There is a coffeemaker in the room but take advantage of the SG free additional beverages of choice. You can also add on a muffin or bagel for a couple of bucks a piece. Most places charge more than twice that amount. If you appreciate quality amenities and attention to detail, the Omni does not disappoint. Now on to the question of the bathroom "door". Our bathroom had a frosted- glass wood framed "door" that rolls on a suspended track rather than being attached with hinges. And yes, therefore, there is not a sealed door but... the spaciousness of the bathroom, huge tub/shower with great water pressure , quality towels and amenities more than makes up for the unusual door. Actually, our curiousity contributed to our selecting the Omni. A great location!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: cdnabroad
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent a week at the Omni Hotel when he attended a conference. We loved the location: the conference centre was right across the street, the Omni is at the base of the Gaslamp District, and the public trolley is right outside the hotel. I took the trolley to go to a couple of malls on the outskirts of town - easy. Originally, my husband and I had a room just across from the elevator. We asked for a room change and got moved up a few floors and with a great view of the bay! The concierge staff were very helpful in recommending restaurants, arranging a car rental etc. We had a great meal at Chive restaurant in the Gaslamp District. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth staying”
Reviews.Author: guy148064
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a week for a conference/second honeymoon. Had done some research here, asked for a corner room with a bay/marina view and was easily granted it. I am a Omni SelectGuest Club member, which was helpful as your room requests are granted first, and free morning beverages/newspaper are delivered to your door every day. The room was spacious with truly great views as we had hoped. The only negative was that train tracks run right along the Omni, and there is construction going on to the East/Southeast of the hotel, so loud train whistles can be heard occasionally once or twice at any hour of the night, with heavy machinery piledrivers occasionally in the morning, though it did not bother me much as I am a heavy sleeper. Also, it should be noted that trains run across the length of Harbor Drive where several upscale hotels are located. The bathrooms did take a bit of getting used to, though they afforded enough privacy as long as no mischevious people try to open the wooden blinds while you are using the restroom (Perhaps small children would not do the best in this situation). Also, there was no fan in the bathrooms, which was slightly disturbing. The amenities were everything we have come to expect from the Omni, with wonderful chairs/desks, comfortable beds/pillows, and a large plasma flat screen TV in our room. The maid/housekkeping services were great, and cleaned up the large messes we left every morning in an appreciated manner. The valet services were great, and we used them primarily as we came and went several times a day, and it was much easier and cheaper than parking on our own. The area was wonderful with great shopping and restaurants around as well. When it came time for checkout we were a little late for our flight, so the express check-out was greatly appreciated. Also, we had left something behind, and when we called the next day the staff informed us they had found it and were mailing it back to us. Overall, the hotel experience was great, and we would certainly come back to this hotel with our next visit to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to its reputation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal through Hotwire. Arrived to find top-floor corner room, with a lovely view of Petco Park (which had games all weekend and was very fun to peek into) and a partial harbor view - gorgeous hillside in the distance. We were next to the ice machine and near the elevator - but we heard nothing at all. The rooms are extremely quiet. Fantastic location, a very quick and cheap cab-ride from the airport, within walking distance to all harbor attarctions. Our stay was excellent, especially at the rate we booked at.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: christy2064
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a great location. rooms are very nice. Bathrooms are large and well appointed. Bay views in some rooms. Right next to stadium and across street from convention center. Staff is friendly and helpful. Mccormick and Schmicks is a great restraunt and breakfast there is good also. The Tin Fish next door has awesome food. would definately reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got a deal for this hotel with Hotwire and are very happy with our luck! The location is right near the Gaslamp district and the trolley station. The beds were very plush and comfortable. The only downfall was that the hot tub was being fixed. I'm recommending this hotel to my friend who is going next month.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: carcar_06
Reviews.Content: My family and I went down to San Diego to attend the open house at SDSU. Wow! What a beautiful hotel. Everything from start to finish was excellent. The hotel is connected to Petco Stadium (San Diego Padres) by a skywalk. We were actually able to watch the game from our floor. We had an unbelievable view of the bay too!!! The Famous McCormick and Schmicks restaurant is located in the hotel and has super food!! Overall I 110% recommend staying at the Omni!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: leucadian
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Omni for 1 night early in April. It was a local getaway splurge, so we went for a junior suite with the "Night on the Town" package. It is an expensive hotel, but the package offers a better value, including dinner at McCormick & Schmicks and valet parking for much less than the standard rate for the room only. Our junior suite was a true suite with a separate living room with couch, desk, TV, etc. divided by a sliding door from the large bedroom with a view of the Coronado Bay Bridge. We've stayed in many so-called suites that were simply slightly larger rooms - not the case here! The bath had none of the problems described in earlier reviews - it was large, with a separate tub and shower enclosure and a regular door. We had no noise problems what so ever! As mentioned in other reviews, the location is great, especially for our purpose, attending the Padres opening game! The bellstaff and front desk staff we interacted with were very friendly and helpful. The food and the service in the restaurant were excellent. Also as already mentioned, definitely sign up for the "Select Guest" program. Turndown service is automatic with the program and we also enjoyed the complimentary morning beverages and late checkout which enabled us to stay until just prior to the ballgame.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lisafinz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business last week and after using Tripadvisor for so many years for real hotel reviews, decided to write one for the Omni. After all, it was because of this site that I ended up booking my stay here! First of all - Location, location, location - right at the Gaslamp District, Convention Center, Petco Park, and the Trolley that can bring you all over the city. Staff was excellent. Check-in a breeze. There was a convention of some sort on my 2nd night there, so it was a little slow for the elevator. But really, that's my only complaint! As others mentioned, the bed was extremely comfortable. The room furnishings reminded me more of a boutique-style hotel - very comfortable. I didn't have room service, but did have cocktails in the bar downstairs, which also offers a decent selection of happy hour munchies at 1/2 price. Definitely sign-up for the Omni preferred program - it takes just a minute - I was upgraded upon check-in, while my colleague was not. (I didn't tell him though... didn't want to rub it in!) I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a deluxe property in downtown San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Not Omni quality”
Reviews.Author: shepsle96
Reviews.Content: For some background: Although we live in La Jolla, my wife and I are spending this year on sabbatical and returned to San Diego for a conference in Mission Valley. When the conference was over, we decided to spend three nights downtown at the Omni. We were really shocked with the poor quality of service at the Omni San Diego. For example, on two of the three nights we did not get a turndown service despite requesting it in advance. Daily maid service was slow, on both days our request for an early maid service were ignored and we returned in the early afternoon to find the room as we had left it. I talked with a very nice guest Service Manager but who could do little other than give assurances as to future performances. We tried to order pool-side service via the pool telephone and were promised someone would be along shortly to take our orders for food. 20 minutes later no one had showed up. NB: very small pool for such a big hotel. Our room on the 18 floor had a nice view. The rooms are well finished, have nice falt screen TV, a CD and DVD player gives a nice omni feel. Nice, if small bathroom (lack of privacy notwithstanding). The shower and bath are not seperate and the bath is actually very small. The big problem with the bedrooms is the lack of noise insulation - from the exterior and other rooms. A 'hard rock hotel' is being constructed next door and that can be very distracting. However, the real shocker is when the person next door turns on his or her shower, or flushes the toilet: the walls must be paper thin. I just could not believe the lack of noise insulation. Someone taking a shower awoke my wife on one morning. This is not what one would expect from an Omni - more like a motel! Then again, the Omni San Diego is best described as the poor cousin of the Omni Chain - it is not a scratch on the Omni San Francisco in my opinion. Service and room quality let it down. With the exception of the Wyndham, the Omni compares poorly to other downtown hotels in San Diego that we have stayed at over the years: the nearby Hilton is much better as is the Hyatt up the street.

Reviews.Title: “Food needs attention”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife, 15 month son, and I stayed over the weekend of March 10th. The view from room was outstanding. Bathroom, of course as stated in other reviews, did not provide much privacy. However it did provide sufficient room, and there were plenty of towels and soaps etc. Staff were helpful and accomodating, absolutely no complaints regarding their service. The only reason I can justify giving it a 4 rather than 5 was due to the food quality. It was not exceptional as if compared to the Omni San Francisco. We ordered room service for breakfast 3 times. My wife ordered standard fare while I liked to try different things. The food was well presented, however it was not anything too special. The seafood restaurant was standard as well. We had dinner our first nights stay and although the service was good, the food was not exceptional. Its not that I am not recommending that you eat there, just beware that its not comparable to what I experienced at the San Francisco's Omni. The cookies we ordered one evening from room service were huge, but sorta tasted like something from a box. I would stay here again for my next visit. I was there to visit my family, I grew up in San Diego and I am astonished at the changes, some good, others not. If they would extend the trolly to the airport I would not have to rely on anybody! (parents).

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE OMNI”
Reviews.Author: lancaster98
Reviews.Content: Wow, we had the time of our life.We were treated so well.Beautiful hotel we went for our anniversary and they changed our room at check-in when they new it was a special occasion.The room was beautiful,clean and what a view of the coronado bridge.We only left the room to eat.We will absolutely stay again w/out a doubt.We felt so pampered the beds were so comfortable.The money is so worth it,very nice for those special occasions.Valet parking was reasonable considering your in downtown S.D.We had a wonderful meal at The Tin Fish,just a few steps away,highly recommend.Just be sure to bring your own H2O and snacks for nightime munchies.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: CoTravelsalot
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Stayed for a meeting in Dec 2005. The room was great with a view of the bay and Coronado Bridge. The service was exceptional adn I liked the pool and gym facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at the hotel a week ago and were very pleased. One word describes the hotel....location, location, location. You can’tget any better than this….you get a new trendy hotel right at the beginning of the Gaslamp District!!! We had a car, but chose not to use it unless we were going out of the area. It was not baseball season but when it is I imagine that place is packed to the brim. There is an entrance from the lobby right into Petco Park, not to mention you can see half the field from certain windows in the hotel. If you have some $$$ stay their and catch a game (I imagine during the season the rates go up quite a bit). A few things that we were particularly happy with were the QUICK check-in and out....we even were able to check in 4 hours before check-in time, wireless internet, the pool, and last but CERTAINLY not LEAST....the bell staff and doorman. EVERYONE of these individuals was SO nice. I especially fell in love with the doorman, he was so helpful. A few things that we weren't happy with was the room service...we tried a few different things and NOTHING was good, the jacuzzi was broken throughout our entire 5 night stay...we were VERY bummed about that....and the bar was VERY small....which I suppose is normal for a hotel bar:) Overall the hotel was a great place. The service was FANTASTIC, never came across a person that wasn't genuinely helpful, everyone went out of their way to accommodate ALL needs. It is a bit pricey and I wouldn’t mind trying a few other places I saw in San Diego but this will definitely be a place I suggest to others.

Reviews.Title: “Best room in gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: trishsen
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location is excellent. Trolley stop directly beside the hotel, and for $5 you can ride all day. The rooms are nicely designed, probably the nicest in the gaslamp quarter. If you sign up for preferred guest on their website, you really receive very good service and extra amenities. I booked an ordinary room, city view on the lower floors, but after i signed up for the preferred guest program, they gave me a room on the 16th floor overlooking san diego bay and coronado. my room also had a very petite balcony. The preferred guest program also allows you to choose two drinks for the morning, since coffee and tea are already in the room, this is a convenient way to get some juice and a bottle of water for the day. Through some error, I also received a complimentary cheese, nut and fruit plate with carrs crackers. (They thought I was someone who had booked a convention there, but they let me keep it anyway, it was delicious). Some complaints about this hotel: the late night room service menu is severely lacking in choices. The bathrobes are really short, and despite all these previous reviews raving about the bed, I did not think it was that comfortable, certainly not on par with a westin heavenly bed. The sheets are nice, but the pillows are really no good at all, I woke up with back and neck pain. The bathroom looks great, but somewhat disconcertingly can be peered into from the bedroom, and has no fan. Finally, the walls are not thick at all, anyone in the hallway can be heard with perfect clarity, and you can hear people using washrooms above, below, and beside you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, wonderful service, super convenient location”
Reviews.Author: annabelle32
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week stay at the Omni - Gaslamp. The hotel was great, the service was supurb. We got a standard room on the 15th floor, corner lot. We had a balcony and a great view of the ocean and sunset. The bed and pillows were the best EVER. I agree with the other reviews...parking across the street is MUCH cheaper than valet. Another review I read mentioned a breakfast joint on 4th street called the Cheese Shop...I highly suggest this location - the food was perfect and service was quick and friendly. There is a nice Mediterranean type Restaurant a block away from the hotel called Dussini. The hotel has a copy of the menu at the front desk for preview. This place was funky (but not too funky) up beat and friendly. The food was outstanding (I got the lobster Mac & Cheese a MUST try). There are pool tables and a great bar area on their third level. All and all - I would recommend this hotel and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel-Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: sbraith
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice, once in a standard room...once in a JR Suite. Excellent location in the heart of the Gaslamp. Great dining, drinks and fun within steps of the front door (Try the fish tacos at The Tin Fish next door, amazing) The service is quick and friendly, the valet is lightning fast and our stay was very enjoyable. Would definately recommend this classic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiancée and I stayed at the Omni for four days in December at $99 a night off of Priceline. It was above and beyond the best hotel I have ever stayed in. The location is incredible, our view of the bay was unreal, and the hotel feels brand new. I spent an hour in the heated pool and hot tub every evening. I never wanted to leave. Check out the Gaslamp Strip Club steak house one block away. It’s a great restaurant – trust me. I read the reviews that complained about parking and I would like to offer a suggestion. Transit passes. I ordered two three-day transit passes from [-] for $12 a piece and that allows for unlimited bus and trolley use. No parking hassles, no $24/day valet expense, no getting lost, and no dealing with parking on the other end. Here are some of the things we did, very easily, using the busses and trolleys: San Diego Zoo and Balboa Park (#7 bus) The Beaches (#34 bus) Fashion Valley/Qualcom Stadium (for a football game) (Trolley) Midway Aircraft Carrier Museum (Trolley) Old Town (Trolley) Sea World (Trolley to Old Town, #9 bus) Petco Park Tour (Walked) All of this info is very easily available on the sdcommute website. I’ll admit, riding the bus with the mass-transit crowd certainly takes away from the feeling of staying in a four-star hotel, but it was nice not to have to deal with a car for a few days. The trolley, while limited in its range, is pretty nice. On the fifth day, I took the #922 bus to the airport, rented a car, and we drove to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: myhaven
Reviews.Content: Ditto to the other glowing comments. I'd add that the pool is well heated and comfortable on a chilly day. The exercise room is good. The big surprise was the restaurant, McCormick and Schmidt, which was darn good. I usually steer clear of hotel restaurants, but tried this because we were too tired to go out. They have a ridiculously appealing happy hour where you can get a $1.99 "appetizer" with your drink. Appetizers such as a half pound burger with the fixings and fries! Don't have the bad cheese plate though. But for that price you can try everything. The drinks are very reasonably priced. For dinner, the kids menu is only $5. and the shrimp, e.g. are large prawns, not that frozen popcorn shrimp. The rest. specializes in seafood and the fish is so fresh that they post the catch date on the menu. Beware the preparation, though, which overpowers the excellent fish. Go for the simplest preparation. After one happy hour and one dinner, the manager came over and handed us a gift certificate for breakfast. The place is casual yet fancy, if that can be. Not a "kid" place, but kids are welcome and treated well.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: slnsalim
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very near the trolley stop and the entrance to the gas lamp quarter. We had a lovely room with a view of the bay. However, the walls are pretty thin. We could hear the neighbours to the left and to the right of us which is quite unacceptable really. There also appeared to be no lounge to lounge in and we had to make reservations for breakfast !? Perhaps it was because it was Christmas...or something. Really, not a bad hotel otherwise. At least internet access was free.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rcazares
Reviews.Content: I just returned from San Diego with my husband and 4 yr old daughter. The Omni was fantastic. We arrived at 11am and were able to check in immediately. We stayed in a room with a bay view. The rooms were very cleaned and restocked daily. Valet parking is $24. Pretty outrageous since you can park your car yourself (in the same parking garage that they would park your car) right across from the hotel for only about $8 or $9 a night. This hotel is in a great location. It is just steps away from the Gaslamp quarter, about 5 mins from Coronado, and about 15 mins from the zoo and Sea World. If you have time, drive up the coast and visit the many beaches: Mission, Pacific and La Jolla. They are beautiful. At La Jolla cove you can see seals on the beach! The staff was very friendly. On our last morning there we visited Coronado. The doorman recommended the Crown Bistro on Orange Ave. for breakfast. It was great! We will definitely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good not Great”
Reviews.Author: ML2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a weekend this month, and we found the Omni to be nice, but not worth its' price and certainly not as nice as other Omnis (we're in the Select Guest program). The place is sleek, modern, and tasteful, but the individual rooms are oddly designed (the bathroom is separated from the rest of the room by spacious wooden blinds...allowing the rest of the room to hear and smell all of the business going on in the bathroom - and the bathrooms don't have fans). The room service was ridiculously slow, and the McCormick & Schmick's is laughable - we stood at the host stand for minutes without being noticed, and then when we called to order food to our room, the phone rang for 5 minutes without anyone answering. We never received refills on shampoo, soap, or conditioner. The exterior/public areas are lovely and the location is great - but for those used to Omni standards in DC, San Francisco, or Austin, you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “The Omni was awesome.”
Reviews.Author: psubloch
Reviews.Content: The Omni definitely ranks in the top 10 hotels I've stayed at worldwide. The staff was very helpful. I checked in late after having a rough time travelling from the East Coast but as soon as I walked in the door they had my key ready and I was off. The only problem I encountered was the desk staff had a tough time working their credit card machine. The next morning they told me I was declined but had the approval receipt laying on the desk. I'm sure it was just a small mixup. Overall the room was beautiful and spacious and the view was amazing. I'd recommend parking across the street if you don't need your car otherwise the $24 for In/Out service is not that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Graciecc
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Omni for six nights the week of Thanksgiving. We booked the hotel through Priceline for a steal at $99/night. After the first night in a so-so room, we were able to use our complimentary upgrade to get a larger room with a wonderful view of Coronado. We really enjoyed the location of this hotel, near the Gaslamp Quarter, but far enough away from the nightlife to relax. We didn't take advantage of many of the hotel's amenities, so I can't speak to that, but the few times we called housekeeping for items, they responded quickly. Like others, we parked at the garage across the street. Most days it cost us $8, much better than $24 for the valet. I would stay here again, but I wouldn't pay full price. I wouldn't pay that price for any hotel room!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed for 4 nights at the Omni in August. I couldn't have asked for a better hotel experience. Rooms were immaculate, modern and extremely comfortable. Nightly turndown service and morning juice and paper were an added bonus. The bed was amazing. Valet, while expensive, was prompt and pleasant. Concierge assisted us every morning with our plans. I highly recommend this hotel to any couples looking for a romantic getaway. Dinners in the Gaslamp District are a perfect combination to this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: meverett
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Omni last Saturday night, for my birthday. It was a great experience and one that I can’t wait to repeat. My boyfriend called the concierge ahead of time to let them know it was my birthday, when we checked into our room on the 21st floor, there were rose petals on the bed and champagne, chocolates, and a birthday card from the concierge on the desk. It was such a nice touch and made me feel very special; my boyfriend told me the concierge had suggested the rose petals and the chocolates (which were delicious)—so thank you to the concierge for being so thoughtful! I joined the Select Guest program at the Omni after reading a review on Trip Advisor that suggested it. As a Select Guest, we were treated to complimentary beverages the next morning; we chose coffee, although we should have gotten orange juice or hot chocolate, as there are coffee makers in the room. Check-in/out was quick and efficient. The hotel lobby is stylish and comfortable. I really liked the room décor, cream tones with medium color wood. The bathroom was spacious and clean, although the bathtub was a little small. We had a view of downtown, which was nice, especially at night. The remote to the TV did not work, so we called down and someone was sent up right away and after adjusting some wires connected to the back of the TV, it was fixed. The front desk followed up promptly to ensure that the problem was taken care of. After a night out at in the gaslamp district, we retired to our room. The walls are a bit thin, as we could faintly hear the couple the next room. Also, be aware that parking is an additional $24 for hotel guests. All in all, I had a great experience at the Omni. All of the employees there were very attentive and gracious. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lntemca
Reviews.Content: We booked the Sweetheart Heart package for the night of the Rolling Stones concert and were impressed from the beginning! The service was outstanding with reservations, and check-in was a breeze! Our one bedroom suite was on the 15th floor and a corner view, which from the back allowed us to watch the Stones with their sound check prior to the concert.. I highly recommend this hotel for the service, it's very clean and has the most comfortable beds!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only 10 minutes by taxi from the airport (about $10). When we checked in, we were upgraded to a suite - what a great room. I liked the decor of the entire hotel, esp. the suite. Both balconies had a great view of the Coronado Bridge. Both the bedroom and the living room had separate TV's. It is a quick walk (2 minutes) to the Gaslamp district, a block away from the convention center, 10 minutes to the marina and Horton Plaza. TIPS: 1. RUNNING: a good 4 mile run (one way) is to run along the water to the airport until you get to the airport overpass, 2. Take the Old Town Trolley it is worth $30 - Judith and Ed are the funniest guides, 3. Ralph's Market in the Gaslamp district has great desserts and 4. visit the Hotel del Coronado - the woodwork is amazing in the lobby - it looks like an authentic saloon. We had a great time in San Diego and we definitely will stay here again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice. I love the location, right next to the stadium and the gas lamp district. Both times we have brought our kids with us and they love the hustle and bustle of downtown San Diego. They really enjoyed seeing the train, trolley and all the people coming and going. Very fun place for a family to explore. Safe too. This last time, our room was right next to the stadium. We didn't actually go to the game (my hubby is a camera man for sports and it was his night off) but felt like we were there. We could see the people in the stands and hearing their response to the plays was really cool. I was amazed when I shut the windows how effective they were at blocking the noise. Our favorite part was watching the fireworks dispaly from our room after the game. One word of caution, don't order the room service. We decided to make it a little easier on ourselves (so we thought) because it was crowded out and we were tired. The food took forever, over an hour. The hotel was very generous and did not charge us. They even gave us a free breakfast, which also took over an hour. Do yourself a favor and go enjoy one of the many nearby, fun restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Husband's birthday suprise!”
Reviews.Author: momluvs2travel
Reviews.Content: I can't believe I actually kept the secret till we pulled in to the lobby of the hotel. I got the baseball package deal, which gave us 2 box seats, one night stay and something that I did't even know about, almost threw it away, was a $25.00 credit for breakfast at the hotel restaurant. The game that night had fireworks which was an added treat. All for $299.00. The room was great! I am real picky and it was very clean, nice amenities, and excellant view of Coronado Bridge and pool. Service was real good, almost felt a little rushed checking in. All and all everything was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “No. 1 Hotel in San Diego, from my 3 y/o's point of view...”
Reviews.Author: irenericci
Reviews.Content: My husband, 3y/o daughter and I just returned from an 8 night stay at the Omni starting September 15. I chose the property based on 2 reasons: great Expedia flight and hotel package (which gave me $1,400 in savings) and of course, reviews from Tripadvisor. We stayed in room 1733 : corner room on the 17/f, 2 double beds, with a great view of the Petco Park next door. We were very thankful that the Omni had accommodated these requests -- and were even able to check in as early as 7:30 am, as we took the first flight out of San Francisco. The room was simply elegant and modern. From the cool alarm clock that my daughter was itching to play with, to the funky sliding bathroom door which did not pose a problem to us. In fact, my daughter had a blast peeking through that 1 inch gap whenever me or my husband would be in the bathroom! While I loved the plentiful shelves in the bathroom, my husband was impressed with the nice balcony (not an open one) that you can just gaze out endlessly to the game next door. Again, this is while my kid goes on and off the weighing scale in the bathroom, which is also a nice touch. Housekeeping did an excellent job in maintaining our rooms spotless throughout our stay. Room always smelled fresh and new, and even in the hallways as you come out from the elevator. Equally good was the turndown service that you get every night -- mint chocolates with next day's weather forecast on your pillow, dimmed lights, plus a soothing Omni channel on the TV that plays as you enter your room at night. The doormen in the morning and evening (Dave and Anthony, respectively) were very friendly and would always ask us where we are going for the day or where we have been. The valet guys (though we only used the service for a night) also had smiles for us whenever we come back to the hotel. Concierge, as expected, was courteous and knowledgeable with just about everything we needed to know about the area. The Front Desk were all very pleasant. I was surprised though at check-in that I was not asked for identification when i registered. Being a Front Desk agent myself, I found that kinda strange since my reservation has already been prepaid. Oh well,... =) My 2 complaints -- which are not much: 1. we were not able to get our complimentary morning beverage as shared by other TA reviewers. Though I signed up for the Select Guest membership prior to my stay, I was informed by the Front Desk that I need to have stayed previously in an Omni property to enjoy that particular service. Funny, but we got the other amenities/service (late checkout, morning paper, turndown service) that came along with the Select Guest membership. 2. fee to rent a fridge is $25/night. since we were staying for 8 nights, i don't think i can afford to pay $200 just to keep my daughter's milk from going stale. so we just made do of the ice bucket to serve that purpose. Overall, the hotel was an excellent base for our sightseeing activities in San Diego. Initially, we thought we were out of place seeing all the convention people staying in the hotel! But then we realize that we made the right choice and we are very happy to have stayed in one of the best hotels, if not the best, in San Diego. Thank you for making our vacation very memorable, Omni San Diego. Highly recommeded!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful view to the west”
Reviews.Author: meravard
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Omni Hotel for 3 days. This was a business/pleasure trip which included meetings, a ballgame and sightseeing. We were extremely pleased with the beautiful view from our room on the 18th floor( to the west )overlooking the trolley, convention center and activities in the harbor. The hotel is easily reached from the airport by taxi, the access to Petco Park was a dream and the room was well designed, well appointed and very clean. We had excellent service from check-in, concierge, bell captain and check-out. We will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: fisherprice
Reviews.Content: Just spent Labor Day Weekend at the Omni San Diego for our anniversary. Paid one hundred twenty dollars per night (including taxes and fees) via that name your own price website; at check-in, paid an extra thirty dollars per night for an upgrade to a premium room with a view of the bay. We liked the location at the tail end of the Gaslamp Quarter. Since there were no games at Petco during our stay, I decided to park our rental car on the street. With the exception of having to get out of bed early on Saturday to feed the meter till we felt like really waking up, it was relatively painless-- just remember that once meters aren't enforced (after 6 pm, Sundays, holidays), you can park in yellow zones (and there are a lot of those around the hotel). The room was spacious and clean. The bed was comfortable. The pool area was stylish. The concierge was quite helpful.
